hadiths.english: 2158. Imam al-Hasan (AS) said, 'The one who recites the Qur'an has a supplication of his answered, be it immediately or later.'

hadiths.arabic: 2159. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : سألتُ اللَّهَ أن لا يَستَجيبَ دعاءَ حبيبٍ على‏ حبيبِهِ
hadiths.english: 2159. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'I asked Allah not to answer the supplication of an enamoured one against his beloved.'

hadiths.arabic: 2160. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أربعٌ لا يُستَجابُ لَهُم دعاءٌ : الرجلُ جالسٌ في بَيتِهِ يقولُ : يا ربِّ ارزُقْني ، فيقولُ لَهُ : ألَم آمُرْكَ بالطَّلَبِ ؟ ! ورجلٌ كانَت لَهُ امرأةٌ فَدَعا علَيها ، فيقولُ : ألَم أجعَلْ أمرَها بيدِكَ ؟! ورجلٌ كانَ لَهُ مالٌ فأفسَدَهُ فيقولُ : يا ربِّ ارزُقْني ، فيقولُ لَهُ : ألَم آمُرْكَ بالاقتِصادِ ؟! ورجلٌ كانَ لَهُ مالٌ فأدانَهُ بغيرِ بَيِّنَةٍ فَيَقولُ : ألَم آمُرْكَ بِالشَّهادَةِ ؟!
hadiths.english: 2160. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There are four kinds of people whose supplications do not get answered: the man who sits in his house saying, 'O my Lord, grant me sustenance', to whom He says, 'Did I not command you to seek [for your sustenance]?', then there is the man who has a wife and supplicates against her, to whom He replies, 'Did I not make you responsible for her [put her affairs in your hands]?', and a man who has wealth and wastes it, who says, 'O my Lord, grant me sustenance', to whom He replies, 'Did I not command you to be economical?'...and a man who has wealth and loans it to someone without keeping any proof [of loan], to whom He replies, 'Did I not command you to take a witness?!'

hadiths.arabic: 2161. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : قالَ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ : وعِزَّتي وجلالي وعَظَمَتي وبَهائي ، إنّي لَأَحمِي وَليّي أن اُعطِيَهُ في دارِ الدنيا شيئاً يشغَلُهُ عن ذِكري حتّى‏ يَدعُوَني فأسمَعَ صوتَهُ ، و إنّي لَأُعطي الكافرَ مُنيَتَهُ حتّى‏ لا يَدعُوَني فَأسمَعَ صوتَهُ بُغضاً لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2161. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Allah said, 'By My Might, Exaltedness, Greatness and Splendour, verily I protect My friend by not giving him something in this world that will preoccupy him from My remembrance, and [that he may continue to call Me] so that I can hear his voice, and verily I grant the disbeliever his wish for him so that he stops calling Me lest I hear his voice.'

hadiths.arabic: 2162. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا يُقَنِّطَنَّكَ إبطاءُ إجابتِهِ ، فإنَّ العطيَّةَ على‏ قَدْرِ النِّيَّةِ ، وربّما اُخِّرَتْ عنكَ الإجابةُ لِيَكونَ ذلكَ أعظَمَ لِأجرِ السائلِ وأجزَلَ لِعَطاءِ الآمِلِ ، وربّما سألتَ الشي‏ءَ فلم تُؤْتاهُ واُوتيتَ خيراً مِنهُ عاجِلاً أو آجِلاً ، أو صُرِفَ عنكَ لِما هُوَ خيرٌ لكَ ، فَلَرُبَّ أمرٍ قد طَلِبْتَهُ وفيهِ هلاكُ دينِكَ لو اُوتيتَهُ
hadiths.english: 2162. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'A delay in response should not dishearten you, for verily the grant [from Allah] is proportional to [the sincerity of] your intention, and maybe the response has been delayed in order for it to be a greater reward for the one who asked and a greater bestowal for the hopeful one, or maybe you asked for something and it was not given to you and instead you are to be granted something better sooner or later, or it may have been kept away from you for your own good, for many a matter that you ask for would be detrimental to your religion [and faith] if it were to be given to you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2163. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ رَبَّكم حَيِيٌّ كريمٌ ، يَستَحيِي أن يَبسُطَ العبدُ يَدَيهِ إلَيهِ فَيَرُدَّهُما صِفراً
hadiths.english: 2163. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily your Lord is bashful and kind. He would be too ashamed for His servant to open his hands to Him [in supplication] and for Him to return them empty.'

hadiths.arabic: 2164. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : المؤمنُ مِن دُعائهِ على‏ ثلاثٍ: إمّا أن يُدَّخَرَ لَهُ ، و إمّا أن يُعَجَّلَ لَهُ ، و إمّا أن يُدْفَعَ عَنهُ بَلاءٌ يُريدُ أن يُصِيبَهُ
hadiths.english: 2164. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'There are three types of outcome from a believer's supplication: either it is stored away for him for later, or it is hastened for him, or it repels a calamity waiting to afflict him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2165. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : يَتَمَنّى‏ المؤمنُ أ نّه لم يُستَجَبْ لَهُ دَعوَةٌ في الدنيا مِمّا يَرى‏ مِن حُسنِ الثوابِ
hadiths.english: 2165. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The believer would wish that none of his supplications were answered in this world when he sees his beautiful and great rewards [in the Hereafter].'

hadiths.arabic: 2166. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : اِعرِفْ طُرُقَ نجاتِكَ وهلاكِكَ كي لا تدعُوَ اللَّهَ بشي‏ءٍ منهُ هلاكُكَ وأنتَ تَظُنُّ فيهِ نجاتَكَ ، قالَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ: (ويَدْعُ الإِنسانُ بِالشَّرِّ دُعاءَهُ بِالخَيرِ وَ كَانَ الإنسانُ عَجولاً)
hadiths.english: 2166. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Know the ways of your salvation and destruction, so that you would not ask Allah for something that you believe your salvation lies in it, while it brings your destruction. Allah [the Glorious, the Exalted] has said: 'Man prays for evil as he prays for good; for man is given to hasty.'

hadiths.arabic: 2167. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّما سُمِّيَتِ الدُّنيا دُنيا لأ نّها أدنى‏ مِن كلِّ شي‏ءٍ ، وسُمِّيَت الآخِرةُ آخِرةً لأنّ فيها الجزاءَ والثوابَ
hadiths.english: 2167. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world has been named dunya because it is lower than every thing, and the Hereafter has been named akhira because it contains recompense and reward.'

sections.section_title_en: THE WORLD IS THE PLANTATION FOR THE HEREAFTER

hadiths.arabic: 2168. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: الدنيا مَزرَعةُ الآخِرَةِ
hadiths.english: 2168. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The world is the plantation for the Hereafter.'

hadiths.arabic: 2169. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : بالدنيا تُحرَزُ الآخِرَةُ
hadiths.english: 2169. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The Hereafter is secured through the world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2170. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّ اللَّهَ سبحانَهُ قد جَعَلَ الدنيا لِما بعدَها ، وابتَلى‏ فيها أهلَها ، لِيُعلَمَ أيُّهُم أحسَنُ عَمَلاً ، ولَسنا للدنيا خُلِقنا ، ولا بالسَّعي فيها اُمِرنا
hadiths.english: 2170. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily Allah - glory be to Him - has made this world for what is after it and has put its inhabitants to trial so that He may know who from among them has the best deeds, and we have not been created for this world, nor have we been commanded to strive for it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2171. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : نِعمَ العَونُ الدنيا علَى الآخِرَةِ
hadiths.english: 2171. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'The world is the best aid for the Hereafter.'

hadiths.arabic: 2172. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الدنيا ملعونةٌ وملعونٌ ما فيها ، إلّا ما ابتُغِيَ به وَجهُ اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ
hadiths.english: 2172. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The world is cursed along with what is in it, except that through which the pleasure of Allah is sought.'

hadiths.arabic: 2173. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : الدنيا دُنياءانِ : دنيا بلاغٍ ودنيا ملعونةٌ
hadiths.english: 2173. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'The world is of two types: that which causes one to attain [success in the Hereafter] and that which is cursed.'

sections.section_title_en: TAKING ONLY WHAT IS NECESSARY FROM THE WORLD

hadiths.arabic: 2174. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - لرجلٍ‏شكا إليه الحاجةَ - : اِعلَم أنّ كلَّ شي‏ءٍ تُصيبُهُ مِن الدنيا فوقَ قُوتِكَ فإنّما أنتَ فيهِ خازنٌ لِغيرِكَ
hadiths.english: 2174. Imam Ali (AS) said to a man who complained regarding his needs, 'Know that everything that you attain in this world that super-sedes your required provision, you are considered to be its treasurer for someone else.'

hadiths.arabic: 2175. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا تَسألُوا فيها فوقَ الكَفافِ ، ولا تَطلُبُوا منها أكثرَ مِن البلاغِ
hadiths.english: 2175. Imam Ali (AS) said [regarding the world], 'Do not ask in it for what is more than a sufficient means of living and do not seek from it more than what you need.'

hadiths.arabic: 2176. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدنيا دارُ المُنافِقينَ ولَيست بدارِ المُتّقينَ ، فَليكُنْ حظُّكَ مِن الدنيا قِوامَ صُلْبِكَ ، وإمساكَ نَفْسِكَ ، والتَزَوّدَ لمَعادِكَ
hadiths.english: 2176. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world is the abode of the hypocrites and it is not the abode of the pious ones, so take from the world enough to keep your body strong, to keep yourself alive and to gain provision for your Resurrection.'

hadiths.arabic: 2177. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : ما منزلةُ الدنيا مِن نفسي إلّا بمنزلةِ الميتةِ ، إذا اضطُرِرتُ إليها أكَلتُ مِنها
hadiths.english: 2177. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The status of this world according to me is just as a dead body, where I will only eat from it if I am compelled to do so.'

sections.section_title_en: THE WORLD BELONGS TO ONE WHO HAS ABANDONED IT

hadiths.arabic: 2178. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أوحَى اللَّهُ تَبارَكَ وَتَعالى‏ إلى الدنيا : اِخْدِمي مَن خَدَمَنِي ، وأتْعِبي مَن خَدَمَكِ
hadiths.english: 2178. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah revealed to the world, 'Tire and wear out the one who serves you, and serve the one who serves me you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2179. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدنيا لِمَن تَرَكَها والآخرةُ لِمَن طَلَبَها
hadiths.english: 2179. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world is for the one who abandons it and the Hereafter is for the one who seeks it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2180. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَثَلُ الدنيا كَظِلِّكَ؛ إن وَقَفتَ وَقَفَ ، وإن طَلَبتَهُ بَعُدَ
hadiths.english: 2180. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The example of this world is like your shadow for if you stand still, it stands still and if you chase it, it distances itself.'

hadiths.arabic: 2181. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تَسُبُّوا الدنيا فَنِعمَتْ مَطِيَّةُ المؤمنِ ، فعلَيها يَبلُغُ الخيرَ وبها يَنجو مِن الشرِّ ، إنّهُ إذا قالَ العبدُ : لَعَنَ اللَّهُ الدنيا قالَتِ الدُّنيا : لَعَنَ اللَّهُ أعصانا لِرَبِّهِ !
hadiths.english: 2181. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not insult the world for it is the best mount for the believer, because by means of it he attains good and through it he is saved from evil. If a servant [of Allah] says:“May Allah curse the world” , the world replies:“May Allah curse the most disobedient one towards his Lord from among us!” .'

hadiths.arabic: 2182. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أيُّها الذامُّ للدنيا المُغتَرُّ بِغُرورِها المَخدُوعُ بِأباطيلِها ، أتَغتَرُّ بالدنيا ثُمّ تَذُمُّها ؟ ! أنتَ المُتَجرِّمُ علَيها أم هي المُتجَرِّمَةُ علَيكَ ؟ ! متى‏ استَهوَتْكَ أم متى‏ غَرَّتكَ؟ !... إنَّ الدنيا دارُ صِدقٍ لِمَن صَدَقَها ، ودارُ عافيةٍ لِمَن فَهِمَ عنها ، ودارُ غِنىً لِمَن تَزَوَّدَ مِنها
hadiths.english: 2182. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'O you who insult the world, who have been deceived by its deceit and cheated by its falsities, do you covet the world and then insult it? Should you accuse it or should it accuse you? When did it bewilder it or deceive you?!... Verily the world is an abode of truth for he who is truthful to it, an abode of wellbeing for hewho understands it, and an abode of riches for he who collects provision from it [for the next world].'

sections.section_title_en: Characteristics of the Condemned Aspect of the World

hadiths.arabic: 2183. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: الدنيا سُوقُ الخُسرانِ.
hadiths.english: 2183. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world is the marketplace of the losers.'

hadiths.arabic: 2184. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدنيا مَصرَعُ العقولِ
hadiths.english: 2184. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world is the ground of ruin for the intellects.'

hadiths.arabic: 2185. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدنيا مَعدِنُ الشرِّ ومحلُّ الغُرورِ
hadiths.english: 2185. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world is the origin of evil and the place of deceit.'

hadiths.arabic: 2186. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدنيا مَزرعةُ الشَّرِّ
hadiths.english: 2186. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world is a plantation of evil.'

hadiths.arabic: 2187. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدنيا تُذِلُّ
hadiths.english: 2187. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world lowers and abases [mankind].'

sections.section_title_en: Love of the World is the FOUNTAINHEAD OF EVERY MISTAKE

hadiths.arabic: 2188. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أكبَرُ الكبائرِ حُبُّ الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2188. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The gravest of the grave sins is love of the world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2189. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : حُبُّ الدنيا أصلُ كلِّ مَعصيَةٍ وأوّلُ كُلِّ ذَنبٍ
hadiths.english: 2189. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Love of the world is the origin of every act of disobedience and the beginning of every sin.'

hadiths.arabic: 2190. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَيْسَ مِن حُبِّ الدنيا طَلَبُ ما يُصْلِحُكَ
hadiths.english: 2190. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Searching for what will improve you is not considered love of the world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2191. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : رأسُ كلِّ خطيئةٍ حُبُّ الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2191. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The fountainhead of every mistake is love of the world.'

sections.section_title_en: The Effects of Love of the World

hadiths.arabic: 2192. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : حُبُّ الدنيا يُفسِدُ العقلَ، وَيُصِمُ‏ القلبَ عن سَماعِ الحكمةِ ، ويوجِبُ أليمَ العِقابِ
hadiths.english: 2192. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Love of the world corrupts the intellect, it deafens the heart from hearing wisdom and it brings about a painful chastisement.'

hadiths.arabic: 2193. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: حُبُّ الدنيا يُوجِب الطَّمَعَ
hadiths.english: 2193. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Love of the world engenders greed.'

hadiths.arabic: 2194. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن تَعَلَّقَ قلبُهُ بالدنيا تَعَلَّقَ قلبُهُ بثلاثِ خصالٍ : هَمٍّ لا يَفنى‏ ، وأمَلٍ لا يُدرَكُ ، ورجاءٍ لا يُنالُ
hadiths.english: 2194. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The one who attaches his heart to the world has attached his heart to three things, endless worry, false expectation and an unattainable hope.'

hadiths.arabic: 2195. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن كَثُرَ اشتِباكُهُ بالدنيا كانَ أشَدَّ لحَسرَتِهِ عند فِراقِها
hadiths.english: 2195. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Whoever increasingly becomes ensnared by the world, his distress will be greater when separating from it.'

sections.section_title_ar: الدُّنيا مِن وجهَةِ نَظَرِ الإمام عَلِيٍّ عليه السلام‏
sections.section_title_en: The World from the Viewpoint of Imam Ali (AS)

hadiths.arabic: 2196. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : واللَّهِ لَدُنياكُم هذهِ أهوَنُ في عَينِي مِن عِرَاقِ خِنزيرٍ في يَدِ مَجذومٍ
hadiths.english: 2196. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'By Allah, this world of yours is worse in my eyes than the sweat of a pig in the palm of a leper.'

hadiths.arabic: 2197. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : دُنياكُم هذِهِ أزهَدُ عِندي مِن عَفْطَةِ عَنزٍ
hadiths.english: 2197. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'This world of yours is more forsaken [worthless] to me than the sneezing of a goat.'

hadiths.arabic: 2198. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لَدُنياكُم أهوَنُ عِندي مِن وَرَقَةٍ (في) فِي جَرادَةٍ تَقضِمُها ، ما لِعَلِيّ ونعيمٍ يَفْنى‏
hadiths.english: 2198. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily your world to me is more worthless than a leaf being gnawed at in the mouth of a locust. What has Ali got to do with perishable things?!'

hadiths.arabic: 2199. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إليكِ عَنِّي يا دنيا ، فحَبلُكِ على‏ غارِبِكِ ، قدِ انسَلَلتُ مِن مَخالِبِكِ ، وأفلَتُّ مِن حَبائلِكِ ، واجتَنَبتُ الذَّهابَ في مداحِضِكِ...
hadiths.english: 2199. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Get away from me, O World! Your rein is on your own shoulders as I have released myself from your ditches, removed myself from your snares and avoided walking into your slippery places.'

sections.section_title_en: WARNING AGAINST THE DECEPTION of the World

hadiths.arabic: 2200. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ألا وإنّ الدنيا دارٌ غَرّارةٌ خَدّاعةٌ ، تَنكِحُ في كلِّ يومٍ بَعْلاً ، وتَقتُلُ في كلِّ ليلةٍ أهلاً ، وتُفَرِّقُ في كلِّ ساعةٍ شَملاً
hadiths.english: 2200. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily the world is a house of deception and deceit, it takes a spouse everyday, kills a family every night and splits up a group every hour.'

hadiths.arabic: 2201. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فلا يَغُرَّنَّكُم كَثرَةُ ما يُعجِبُكُم فيها لِقِلَّةِ ما يَصحَبُكُم مِنها
hadiths.english: 2201. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Do not allow the abundance of what amazes you in it to deceive you because it will be only a little that you take from it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2202. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : غَرّارةٌ غَرورٌ ما فيها ، فانيةٌ فانٍ مَن علَيها، لا خَيرَ في شي‏ءٍ مِن أزوادِها إلّا التَّقوى‏
hadiths.english: 2202. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'It is deceitful, and all that is in it is deceptive. It is perishable and all that is on it will perish. There is no good in any of its provisions except in piety and Godwariness.'

hadiths.arabic: 2203. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اُحَذِّرُكُمُ الدنيا ، فإنّها حُلوَةٌ خَضِرَةٌ حُفَّتْ بِالشَّهَواتِ
hadiths.english: 2203. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Beware of the world, for verily it appears sweet and green, surrounded by carnal and base desires.'

hadiths.arabic: 2204. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إحذَرُوا الدنيا ، فإنَّ في حلالِها حِساب[اً] ، وفي حَرامِها عقاب[اً] ، وأوّلُها عَناءٌ ، وآخِرُها فَناءٌ
hadiths.english: 2204. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Beware of the world, for verily with regards to its lawful things there is accountability and with regards to its unlawful things there is punishment, its beginning is hardship and its end is annihilation.'

hadiths.arabic: 2205. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِحذَروا هَذِهِ الدنيا الخَدَّاعةَ الغَدّارةَ ، التي قد تَزَيّنَتْ بِحُلِيِّها ، وفَتَنَتْ بِغُرورِها... فأصبَحَتْ كالعَروسِ المَجْلُوَّةِ ، والعُيونُ إلَيها ناظِرَةٌ
hadiths.english: 2205. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Beware of this deceptive and deceitful world that has been beautified by its ornaments and has seduced through its delusions... such that it has become like an unveiled bride upon whom everyone's eyes are gazing.'

hadiths.arabic: 2206. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إحذَروا الدنيا ، فإنّها غَدّارةٌ غَرّارةٌ خَدُوعٌ ، مُعطِيَةٌ مَنوعٌ ، مُلبِسةٌ نَزُوعٌ
hadiths.english: 2206. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Beware of the world, for verily it is deceptive, delusive and deceitful, it is a giver that deprives, and one who clothes yet leaves you naked.'

hadiths.arabic: 2207. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِحذَروا الدنيا ، فإنّها عَدُوّةُ أولياءِ اللَّهِ ، وعَدُوّةُ أعدائهِ ، أمّا أولياؤهُ فَغَمَّتهُم ، وأمّا أعداؤهُ فَغَرَّتهُم
hadiths.english: 2207. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Beware of the world, for verily it is the enemy of the friends of Allah and the enemy of His enemies too. As for the friends of Allah, it fills them with grief and as for Allah's enemies, it deludes them.'

sections.section_title_en: VERILY THE WORLD DECEIVES THE IGNORANT

hadiths.arabic: 2208. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : غُرّي يا دنيا مَن جَهِلَ حِيَلَكِ وخَفِيَ علَيهِ حبائلُ كَيدِكِ
hadiths.english: 2208. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'O World, deceive those who are ignorant of your tricks and who are unaware of the snares of your sly deceptions.'

hadiths.arabic: 2209. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العاجِلَةُ غُرورُ الحَمقى‏
hadiths.english: 2209. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The transient world is the booty of the foolish.'

hadiths.arabic: 2210. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الفَرَحُ بالدُّنيا حُمقٌ
hadiths.english: 2210. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Being happy with the world is foolishness.'

sections.section_title_en: Warning against Being Satisfied with the World

hadiths.arabic: 2211. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في قولهِ تعالى‏ : (وكانَ تَحتَهُ كَنْزٌ لَهُما) - : كانَ ذلكَ الكنزُ لَوحاً مِن ذهبٍ فيه مَكتوبٌ : عَجِبتُ لِمَن يَرَى الدنيا وتَصَرُّفَ أهلِها حالاً بعدَ حالٍ كيفَ يَطمئنُّ إلَيها؟!
hadiths.english: 2211. Imam Ali (AS) with regards to Allah's verse:“Under it there was a treasure belonging to them” , said, 'that (the treasure) was a golden tablet upon which was written... : I wonder at those who see the world and the fluctuating states that people experience, how can they be satisfied with it?'

hadiths.arabic: 2212. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اُنظُرُوا إلى الدنيا نَظَرَ الزاهدِينَ فيها ، فإنّها عَن قليلٍ تُزيلُ الساكنَ ، وتَفجَعُ المُترَفَ فلا تَغُرَّنّكُم كَثرَةُ ما يُعجِبُكُم فيها لِقلَّةِ ما يَصحَبُكُم مِنها
hadiths.english: 2212. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Look at the world through the eyes of those who have renounced it, for verily its inhabitants are quick to depart it and its opulence inflicts distress. So do not allow the abundance of what amazes you therein to deceive you, for it is but a little that you will take with you thereof.'

hadiths.arabic: 2213. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اُنظُرْ إلى الدنيا نَظَرَ الزاهدِ المُفارقِ ، ولا تَنظُرْ إلَيها نَظَرَ العاشِقِ الوامِقِ
hadiths.english: 2213. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'View the world through the eyes of one who has renounced it and separated from it, and do not view it through the eyes of one who loves it passionately and tenderly.'

hadiths.arabic: 2214. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إن كانتِ الدنيا فانيَةً فالطُّمأنينَةُ إلَيها لِماذا ؟!
hadiths.english: 2214. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'If this world is transient, then why be satisfied with it?'

sections.section_title_en: The Danger of Preferring THE WORLD [OVER THE HEREAFTER]

hadiths.arabic: 2215. لقمانُ عليه السلام - لابنِهِ وهو يَعِظُهُ - : بِعْ دُنياكَ بِآخِرَتِكَ تَربَحْهُما جميعاً ، ولا تَبِعْ آخِرَتَكَ بدُنياكَ تَخْسَرهما جميعاً
hadiths.english: 2215. Luqman (AS) said in counsel to his son, 'Sell your world for your Hereafter and you will attain both of them, but do not sell your Hereafter for your world for you will lose them both.'

hadiths.arabic: 2216. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن عَبَدَ الدنيا وآثَرَها على الآخرةِ استَوخَمَ العاقِبةَ
hadiths.english: 2216. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The one who worships the world and prefers it over the Hereafter seeks an unhealthy outcome.'

hadiths.arabic: 2217. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا يَترُكُ الناسُ شيئاً مِن أمرِ دينِهِم لاستِصلاحِ دُنياهُم إلّا فَتَحَ اللَّهُ علَيهِم ما هو أضَرُّ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 2217. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'No sooner do people abandon an aspect of their religion in order to advance their worldly affairs than Allah will inflict them with something that is more detrimental than that.'

sections.section_title_en: THE WORLD IS THE PRISON OF THE BELIEVER

hadiths.arabic: 2218. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الدنيا لا تَصفو لِمُؤمنٍ ، كيفَ وهِي سِجنُهُ وبلاؤهُ ؟!
hadiths.english: 2218. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The world is not trouble-free for the believer, how can it be when it is his prison and his trial?'

hadiths.arabic: 2219. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الدنيا سِجنُ المؤمنِ والقَبرُ حِصنُهُ والجنّةُ مَأواهُ ، والدنيا جَنَّةُ الكافِرِ والقبرُ سِجنُهُ والنارُ مَأواهُ
hadiths.english: 2219. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The world is the prison of the believer, the grave is his fortress and Paradise is his final abode. The world is the Paradise of the disbeliever, the grave is his prison and the Fire is his final abode.'

sections.section_title_en: The Danger of Making Worldly AFFAIRS ONE'S GREATEST CONCERN

hadiths.arabic: 2220. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن كانَتِ الدنيا أكبرَ هَمِّهِ طالَ شَقاؤهُ وغَمُّهُ
hadiths.english: 2220. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The one who regards the worldly affairs as his greatest concern, his grief and distress are lengthened.'

hadiths.arabic: 2221. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن أصبَحَ وأمسى‏ والدنيا أكبَرُ هَمِّهِ جَعَلَ اللَّهُ تعالى الفَقرَ بينَ عَينَيهِ وشَتَّتَ أمرَهُ ولم يَنَلْ مِن الدنيا إلّا ما قَسَمَ اللَّهُ له ، ومَن أصبَحَ وأمسى‏ والآخرةُ أكبَرُ هَمِّهِ جَعَلَ اللَّهُ تعالى الغِنى‏ في قلبِهِ وجَمَعَ لَهُ أمرَهُ
hadiths.english: 2221. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The person who wakes up in the morning and retires at night having worldly affairs as his greatest concern, Allah places poverty between his eyes, scatters his affairs, and he will not take from this world except what Allah has apportioned for him. As for the one who wakes up in the morning and retires at night having the Hereafter as his greatest concern, Allah places needlessness in his heart and brings together his affairs for him.'

sections.section_title_en: THE LOWLINESS OF THE WORLD IN ALLAH'S EYES

hadiths.arabic: 2222. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يقولُ اللَّهُ : لولا عَبدي المؤمنُ لَعَصَّبْتُ رأسَ الكافِرِ بعِصابةٍ مِن جَوهَرٍ
hadiths.english: 2222. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Allah says, 'Were it not for My believing servant, I would have tied a headband of jewels around the head of the disbeliever.'

hadiths.arabic: 2223. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لو أنّ الدنيا كانَت تَعدِلُ عند اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ جَناحَ بَعوضَةٍ ما سَقَى الكافِرَ والفاجرَ مِنها شَربَةً مِن ماءٍ
hadiths.english: 2223. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If the world was worth the same as the wing of a mosquito in Allah's eyes, the disbeliever and the insolent person would never get to drink a sip of water from it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2224. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مِن هَوانِ الدنيا على اللَّهِ أ نّهُ لا يُعصى‏ إلّا فيها ، ولا يُنالُ ما عندَهُ إلّا بتَركِها
hadiths.english: 2224. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The lowliness of the world in Allah's eyes can be seen by the fact that He is not disobeyed except in it, and what is with Him cannot be attained except by abandoning the world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2225. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : إنَّ مِن هَوانِ الدنيا على‏ اللَّه تعالى‏ أنَّ رَأسَ يحيى بنِ زكريّا اُهدِيَ إلى‏ بَغِيٍّ مِن بَغايا بني إسرائيلَ
hadiths.english: 2225. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, 'Verily the lowliness of this world in Allah's eyes can be seen by the fact that the head of Prophet John, son of Prophet Zacharias was gifted to a whore from the whores of the Israelites.'

sections.section_title_en: The Difference between THE CENSURED WORLD AND THE HEREAFTER

hadiths.arabic: 2226. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أحَبَّ دُنياهُ أضَرَّ بآخرَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 2226. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He who loves his world has harmed his Hereafter.'

hadiths.arabic: 2227. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنَّ الدنيا والآخِرَةَ عَدُوّانِ مُتَفاوِتانِ ، وسَبيلانِ مُختَلِفانِ ، فَمَن أحَبَّ الدنيا وتَولَّاها أبغضَ الآخِرَةَ وعاداها ، وهُما بمَنزِلَةِ المَشرِقِ والمَغرِبِ وماشٍ بَينَهُما ، كُلَّما قَرُبَ مِن واحدٍ بَعُدَ مِنَ الآخَرِ ، وهُما بَعدُ ضَرَّتانِ
hadiths.english: 2227. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily the world and the Hereafter are two opposing enemies and two different paths, so whoever loves and befriends the world has despised the Hereafter and has made it his enemy. They [the world and the Hereafter] are like the east and the west and whoever walks between them, however much he gets closer to one, he distances himself from the other. After all, they are like two wives of the same husband.'

hadiths.arabic: 2228. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَرارةُ الدنيا حَلاوةُ الآخِرَةِ ، وحَلاوَةُ الدنيا مَرارَةُ الآخِرَةِ
hadiths.english: 2228. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The bitterness of the world is the sweetness of the Hereafter, and the sweetness of the world is the bitterness of the Hereafter.'

hadiths.arabic: 2229. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : طَلَبُ الجمعِ بينَ الدنيا والآخِرةِ مِن خِداعِ النَّفْسِ
hadiths.english: 2229. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Seeking to bring together this world and the next is from the deception of the soul.'

hadiths.arabic: 2230. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما التَذَّ أحدٌ مِنَ الدنيا لَذَّةً إلّا كانتْ لَهُ يومَ القيامةِ غُصّةً
hadiths.english: 2230. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'No one tastes a worldly pleasure except that he will face a torment on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.arabic: 2231. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ثَروَةُ الدنيا فَقرُ الآخِرَةِ
hadiths.english: 2231. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The wealth of this world is the poverty of the Hereafter.'

hadiths.arabic: 2232. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : واللَّهِ ما الدُّنيا والآخِرَةُ إلّا كَكِفَّتَيِ المِيزانِ ، فأيُّهما رَجَحَ ذَهَبَ بالآخَرِ
hadiths.english: 2232. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'By Allah, this world and the next are naught but two scales of a balance, so whichever scale is weightier, it will overpower the other.'

hadiths.arabic: 2233. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : آخِرُ نبيٍّ يَدخُلُ الجنّةَ سُليمانُ بنُ داوود عليه السلام ، وذلك لِما اُعطِيَ في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2233. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The last prophet to enter paradise will be Solomon son of David (AS) due to what he was given in this world.'

sections.section_title_en: COMBINING THE WORLD AND THE HEREAFTER

hadiths.arabic: 2234. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الحَرثُ حَرثانِ : فحَرثُ الدنيا المالُ والبَنونُ، وحَرثُ الآخرةِ الباقياتُ الصالحاتُ ، وقد يَجمَعُهُم اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ لأقوامٍ
hadiths.english: 2234. Imam Ali (AS) said, Cultivation is of two kinds. Wealth and children are the cultivation of the world and righteous deeds are the cultivation of the Hereafter, and sometimes Allah combines the two for some people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2235. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إن جَعَلتَ دِينَكَ تَبَعاً لدُنياكَ أهلَكتَ دينَكَ ودُنياكَ وكُنتَ في الآخرةِ مِن الخاسِرينَ ، إن جَعَلتَ دُنياكَ تَبَعاً لِدينِكَ أحرَزْتَ دِينَكَ ودُنياكَ وكُنتَ في الآخرةِ مِن الفائزينَ
hadiths.english: 2235. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'If you make your religion secondary to your worldly affairs, you have destroyed both your religion and your worldly affairs, and thus you will be among the losers in the Hereafter. But if you make your worldly affairs secondary to your religion, you have safeguarded your religion and your worldly affairs and you will be among the victorious ones in the Hereafter.'

hadiths.arabic: 2236. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إجعَلوا لِأنفُسِكُم حظّاً مِن الدنيا بِإعطائها ما تَشتَهي مِن الحلالِ وما لا يَثلِمُ المُروّةَ وما لا سَرَفَ فيهِ ، واستَعِينوا بذلكَ على‏ اُمورِ الدِّينِ ، فإنّهُ رُوِيَ : ليسَ مِنّا مَن تَرَكَ دُنياهُ لدِينِهِ ، أو تَرَكَ دِينَهُ لِدُنياهُ
hadiths.english: 2236. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Allocate for yourselves a portion of the world by taking from it that which is lawful of what you desire, and that which does not breach the honourable virtues and that wherein there is no extravagance. And in this way, use it to assist [and improve] the matters of religion, for it has been narrated that, 'The one who abandons their worldly affairs for their religion is not from us, and neither is the one who abandons their religion for their worldly affairs.'

hadiths.arabic: 2237. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما الدنيا في الآخِرَةِ إلّا مِثلُ ما يَجعَلُ أحدُكُم إصبَعَهُ في اليَمِّ فليَنظُرْ بِمَ يَرجِعُ
hadiths.english: 2237. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'This world when compared to the Hereafter is just as if one of you dips his finger in the sea and sees what he comes out with.'

hadiths.arabic: 2238. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَثَلُ الدنيا كَظِلِّكَ ؛ إن وَقَفتَ وَقَفَ ، وإن طَلَبتَهُ بَعُدَ
hadiths.english: 2238. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The parable of this world is like your shadow - if you stop, it stands still, and if you chase it, it distances itself from you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2239. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : أنزِلِ الدنيا كمَنزِلٍ نَزَلتَهُ ثُمّ ارتَحَلتَ عَنهُ ، أو كمالٍ وَجَدتَهُ في مَنامِكَ فاستَيقَظتَ ولَيس مَعكَ مِنهُ شي‏ءٌ ، إنّي (إنّما) ضَرَبتُ لكَ هذا مَثَلاً لأ نّها عِندَ أهلِ اللُبِّ والعِلمِ باللَّهِ كَفَيْ‏ءِ الظِّلالِ
hadiths.english: 2239. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, '[Consider] your sojourn in this world just as a house that you stayed in and [soon] departed from, or an object of perfection that you witnessed in a dream then you awoke and not a thing from it remained with you. I have given you this parable because this world, according to the people of intellect and knowledge of Allah, is just as the shadow in the shade.'

hadiths.arabic: 2240. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنّ الدنيا عِندَ العُلَماءِ مِثلُ الظِلِّ
hadiths.english: 2240. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'The world in the eyes of the learned ones is like a shadow.'

hadiths.arabic: 2241. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : مَثَلُ الدنيا مَثَلُ الحَيّةِ؛ مَسُّها لَيِّنٌ وفي جَوفِها السُّمُّ القاتِلُ ، يَحذَرُها الرِّجالُ ذَوُو العُقولِ ، ويَهوِي إلَيها الصِّبيانُ بأيديهِم
hadiths.english: 2241. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'The parable of this world is like that of a snake, it is soft to touch but it contains a deadly poison. Men of intellect are cautious whereas children extend their arms towards it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2242. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : مَثَلُ الدنيا مَثَلُ ماءِ البحرِ ؛ كُلَّما شَرِبَ مِنهُ العَطشانُ ازدادَ عَطَشاً حتّى‏ يَقتُلَهُ
hadiths.english: 2242. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'The parable of this world is that of sea water, however much the thirsty man drinks from it, his thirst intensifies until it kills him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2243. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : تَمَثَّلَتِ الدنيا للمسيحِ عليه السلام في صُورةِ امرأةٍ زَرْقاءَ ، فقالَ لَها : كَم تَزَوَّجتِ؟ فقالَت : كثيراً ، قالَ : فَكُلٌّ طَلَّقَكِ؟ قالَت : لا ، بَل كُلّاً قَتَلتُ ، قالَ المسيحُ عليه السلام : فَوَيحٌ لأزواجِكِ الباقينَ ، كيفَ لا يَعتَبِروُنَ بالماضينَ ؟ !
hadiths.english: 2243. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'The world was embodied to Jesus (AS) in the form of a blue-eyed woman, and he said to her, 'How many have you married?' she said, 'Lots', so he asked, 'So all of them divorced you?', she replied, 'No, rather I killed all of them', then Jesus (AS) said, 'Woe upon your current spouses, for how do they not take a lesson from your previous ones?!'

hadiths.arabic: 2244. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنّ لُقمانَ قالَ لِابنِهِ: إنّ الدنيا بحرٌ عميقٌ ، قد غَرِقَ فيها عالَمٌ كثيرٌ ، فلتَكُنْ سَفينتُكَ فيها تَقوَى اللَّهِ ، وحَشوُها الإيمانُ وشِراعُها التوكُّلُ ، وقَيِّمُها العقلُ ، ودليلُها العِلمُ ، وسُكّانُها الصَّبرُ
hadiths.english: 2244. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Luqman said to his son:...the world is a deep ocean in which many worlds have already drowned, so make Godwariness your boat, faith its content, trust in Allah its sail, reason its custodian, knowledge its guide and patience its inhabitants.'

sections.section_title_en: THE WORLD IS THE HOUSE OF [TRIFLING] ENJOYMENT

hadiths.arabic: 2245. تنبيه الخواطر : رُوِيَ أنّ جَبرئيلَ عليه السلام قالَ لِنوحٍ عليه السلام : يا أطوَلَ الأنبياءِ عُمراً ، كيفَ وَجَدتَ الدنيا؟ قال : كَدارٍ لَها بابانِ دَخَلتُ مِن أحَدِهما وخَرَجتُ مِنَ الآخَرِ
hadiths.english: 2245. It is narrated in Tanbih al-Khawatir that the archangel Gabriel (AS) said to Prophet Noah (AS), 'O prophet who has lived for the longest number of years, how did you find this world?' he replied, 'Like a house which has two doors, I entered through one and then left through the other.'

hadiths.arabic: 2246. عيسى عليه السلام : إنّما الدنيا قَنطَرةٌ ، فاعبُرُوها ولا تَعمُروها
hadiths.english: 2246. Prophet Jesus (AS) said, 'Verily this world is a bridge, so cross over it but do not build on it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2247. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الدنيا ساعةٌ فاجعَلوها طاعةً
hadiths.english: 2247. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The world is only an hour [long] so use it in obedience.'

hadiths.arabic: 2248. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدنيا مُنتَقِلَةٌ فانيةٌ ، إن بَقِيَتْ لَكَ لَم تَبقَ لَها
hadiths.english: 2248. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The world is a transitory and mobile thing, even if it remains for you, you will not remain for it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2249. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أيّها الناسُ ، إنّما الدنيا دارُ مَجازٍ والآخِرةُ دارُ قَرارٍ ، فخُذوا مِن مَمَرِّكُم لِمَقَرِّكُم
hadiths.english: 2249. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'O people, verily the world is a passage while the Hereafter is a permanent abode, so take [as much as you can] from the passage for the permanent abode.'

hadiths.arabic: 2250. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدنيا دارُ مَمَرٍّ لا دارُ مَقَرٍّ ، والناسُ فيها رجُلانِ : رجلٌ باعَ فيها نفسَهُ فأوبَقَها ، ورَجُلٌ ابتاعَ نفسَهُ فَأعتَقَها
hadiths.english: 2250. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'This world is a transitory place and not a permanent one. The people therein are of two types, the man who has sold his self [to his passions] and thus ruined it, and the man who has purchased his self [by control against his passions] and thus freed it.'

sections.section_title_en: THE WORLD IS A PLACE SURROUNDED BY TRIALS

hadiths.arabic: 2251. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : دارٌ بالبلاءِ مَحفوفَةٌ ، وبالغَدْرِ مَعروفَةٌ ، لا تَدومُ أحوالُها ، ولا يَسلَمُ نُزّالُها ، أحوالٌ مُختَلِفةٌ ، تاراتٌ مُتَصَرِّفَةٌ ، العَيشُ فيها مَذمومٌ ، والأمانُ مِنها مَعدومٌ
hadiths.english: 2251. Imam Ali (AS) said, '[The world] is a house surrounded by trials, well-known for treachery, whose conditions do not last, whose inhabitants do not remain safe, its states are variable, its ways are changing, life in it is shameful and security in it is non-existent.'

hadiths.arabic: 2252. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : أوحَى اللَّهُ تعالى‏ إلى‏ شُعَيبٍ النبيِّ : إنّي مُعَذِّبٌ مِن قومِكَ مائَةَ ألفٍ : أربعينَ ألفاً مِن شِرارِهِم وسِتّينَ ألفاً مِن خِيارِهم ، فقالَ : يا ربِّ ، هؤلاءِ الأشرارُ فما بالُ الأخيارِ ؟! فَأوحَى اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ إلَيهِ : داهَنوا أهلَ المعاصِي فلَم يَغضَبُوا لِغَضَبِي
hadiths.english: 2252. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Allah revealed to Prophet Shuayb , 'Verily I am punishing one hundred thousand members of your community: forty thousand from among the evil doers and sixty thousand from among the good doers.' He said, 'My Lord, evil doers fine, but what about the good doers?' Then Allah, Mighty and Exalted, revealed to him, 'They were pliable with the transgressors and did not express any anger at what angers Me'.'

hadiths.arabic: 2253. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : شَرُّ إخوانِكَ مَن داهَنَكَ في نفسِكَ وساتَرَكَ عَيبَكَ
hadiths.english: 2253. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The worst of your brothers is he who flatters you and conceals [from you] your faults.'

hadiths.arabic: 2254. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن داهَنَ نفسَهُ هَجَمَت بهِ على المعاصِي المُحَرَّمَةِ
hadiths.english: 2254. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever flatters himself trespasses into the forbidden transgressions.'

sections.section_title_en: The Prohibition of Compromising the Truth

hadiths.arabic: 2255. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا تُداهِنُوا في الحقِّ إذا وَرَدَ علَيكُم وعَرَفتُمُوهُ فَتَخسَرُوا خُسراناً مُبِيناً
hadiths.english: 2255. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Do not compromise the truth when you come across it and you recognize that it is the truth, lest you suffer clear loss.'

hadiths.arabic: 2256. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ولَعَمْرِي ما عَلَيَّ مِن قِتالِ مَن خالَفَ الحَقَّ ، وخابَطَ الغَيَّ ، مِن إدهانٍ ولا إيهانٍ
hadiths.english: 2256. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'By my life, never will I compromise with or be slack when fighting anyone who opposes the truth or one who has fallen into transgression.'

sections.section_title_en: THE STATE [I.E. GOVERNANCE] OF SENIOR PEOPLE

hadiths.arabic: 2257. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : دَولةُ الأكابِرِ مِن أفضَلِ المَغانِمِ ، دَولةُ اللِئامِ مَذَلَّةُ الكِرامِ
hadiths.english: 2257. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The governance of senior people [of greater expertise] is one of the greatest advantages whereas the governance of wicked people humiliates noble people.'

sections.section_title_en: Sign of the Fall of States

hadiths.arabic: 2258. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يُستدَلُّ على‏ إدبارِ الدُّوَلِ بأربَعٍ : تَضييعِ الاُصولِ ، والتمسُّكِ بالفروعِ‏ ، وتَقديمِ الأراذلِ ، وتأخيرِ الأفاضِلِ
hadiths.english: 2258. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The fall of states can be discerned by four things: neglect of the fundamentals, embracing peripheral matters, bringing contemptible ones to the forefront and relegating the virtuous ones.'

sections.section_title_en: Reasons for the Stability of States

hadiths.arabic: 2259. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : وأعظَمُ ما افتَرَضَ سبحانَهُ مِن تِلكَ الحُقوقِ حَقُّ الوالِي على الرَّعِيَّةِ ، وحقُّ الرعيّةِ على الوالِي فإذا أدَّتِ الرعيّةُ إلى الوالي حقَّهُ وأدَّى الوالِي إلَيها حَقَّها عَزَّ الحَقُّ بينهم ، وقامَت مناهِجُ الدِّينِ ، واعتَدَلَتْ مَعالِمُ العَدلِ ، وجَرَت على‏ أذلالِها السُّنَنُ ، فَصَلَحَ بذلك الزمانُ ، وطُمِعَ في بَقاءِ الدَّولةِ ، ويَئسَت مطامِعُ الأعداءِ
hadiths.english: 2259. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The greatest of the rights that the Glorified [Allah] has made obligatory on man is the right of the ruler over the ruled and the right of the ruled over the ruler... so if the ruled fulfil the rights of the ruler and the ruler fulfils their rights, then the truth attains the position of honour among them, the ways of religion become established, the marks of justice affirmed, the traditions and practices gets implemented correctly, current times improve, the continuance of the state is desired and the ambitions of the enemies are thwarted.'

hadiths.arabic: 2260. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما حُصِّنَ الدُّوَلُ بمِثلِ العَدلِ.
hadiths.english: 2260. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Nothing fortifies states like justice.'

hadiths.arabic: 2261. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : صَيِّرِ الدِّينَ حِصنَ دَولَتِكَ ، والشُّكرَ حِرزَ نِعمَتِكَ ، فَكُلُّ دَولَةٍ يَحوطُها الدِّينُ لا تُغلَبُ ، وكلُّ نِعمَةٍ يَحرُزُها الشُّكرُ لا تُسلَبُ
hadiths.english: 2261. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Make religion the fortress of your state, and thankfulness a protection for your bounties, because every state whose fortress is religion is invincible and every bounty encompassed by thankfulness remains.'

hadiths.arabic: 2262. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مِن أماراتِ الدَّولةِ اليَقَظَةُ لِحراسَةِ الاُمورِ
hadiths.english: 2262. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'One of the signs of a [stable] government is vigilance in safeguarding matters.'

hadiths.arabic: 2263. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّ نبيّاً مِنَ الأنبياءِ مَرِضَ ، فقالَ : لا أتَداوى‏ حتّى‏ يكونَ الذي أمرَضَنِي هُو الذي يَشفينِي ، فأوحَى اللَّهُ تعالى‏ إلَيهِ: لا أشفِيكَ حتّى‏ تَتَداوى‏ ، فإنَّ الشِّفاءَ مِنّي
hadiths.english: 2263. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'A prophet from among the prophets fell sick and said, 'I will not treat myself [with medicine] until the One who made me sick heals me'. Then Allah revealed to him saying, 'I will not heal you until you treat yourself [with medicine] for verily the healing is from Me.'

sections.section_title_en: There is a Cure for Every Ailment

hadiths.arabic: 2264. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : تَداوَوا فإنَّ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ لَم يُنزِلْ داءً إلّا وقد أنزَلَ اللَّهُ لَهُ شِفاءً ، إلّا السّامَ والهَرَمَ
hadiths.english: 2264. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Treat yourselves with medicine, for verily Allah has not sent down any ailment except that he has sent down a cure for it with the exception of death and old age.'

hadiths.arabic: 2265. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لِكُلِّ عِلّةٍ دَواءٌ
hadiths.english: 2265. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'For every ailment, there is a cure.'

sections.section_title_en: Beware of Hastening towards RESORTING TO MEDICINE

hadiths.arabic: 2266. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : تَجَنَّبِ الدَّواءَ ما احتَمَلَ بَدنُكَ الداءَ ، فإذا لم يَحتَمِلِ الداءَ فالدواءُ
hadiths.english: 2266. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Avoid medicine as long as your body can bear the ailment, but if it cannot bear the ailment, then resort to medicine.'

hadiths.arabic: 2267. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا يَتَداوَى المُسلمُ حتّى‏ يَغلِبَ مَرَضُهُ صِحَّتَهُ
hadiths.english: 2267. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'A Muslim does not seek to treat himself [with medicine] until the ailment overcomes his health.'

hadiths.arabic: 2268. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : لَيسَ مِن دواءٍ إلّا وهو يُهَيِّجُ داءً ، وليسَ شي‏ءٌ في البَدنِ أنفَعَ مِن إمساكِ اليدِ إلّا عمّا يَحتاجُ إلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2268. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'There is no medicine except that it exacerbates another ailment, and there is nothing more beneficial to the body than self-restraint from all except that which the body needs.'

sections.section_title_en: Diet Control is the Fountainhead OF REMEDIES

hadiths.arabic: 2269. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : التَّجوُّعُ أنفَعُ الدواءِ
hadiths.english: 2269. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Starving out is the best of remedies.'

hadiths.arabic: 2270. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لا يَضُرُّ المَريضَ ما حَمَيتَ عنهُ الطَّعامَ
hadiths.english: 2270. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Dieting from food causes no harm to the sick person.'

hadiths.arabic: 2271. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لا تَنفَعُ الحِميَةُ لمريضٍ بعدَ سبعَةِ أيّامٍ
hadiths.english: 2271. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, '[Starting to] Diet from food is of no benefit to the sick person after seven days.'

hadiths.arabic: 2272. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : الحِميةُ رأسُ الدواءِ ، والمَعِدةُ بيتُ الداءِ ، عَوِّدْ بَدَناً ما تَعَوّدَ
hadiths.english: 2272. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Diet control is the fountainhead of remedies and the stomach is the house of all ailments, so condition your body while it can be conditioned.'

hadiths.arabic: 2273. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : لَيسَ الحِميةُ أن تَدَعَ الشي‏ءَ أصلاً لا تَأكُلَهُ، ولكنَّ الحِميَةَ أن تَأكُلَ مِنَ الشي‏ءِ وتُخَفِّفَ
hadiths.english: 2273. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Diet control is not to avoid eating absolutely anything, rather diet control is to eat lightly.'

hadiths.arabic: 2274. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : في طِينِ قبرِ الحسينِ عليه السلام الشِّفاءُ مِن كلِّ داءٍ وهُوَ الدواءُ الأكبَرُ
hadiths.english: 2274. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'In the soil of the grave of Husayn (AS) is a healing for every disease, for it is the greatest remedy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2275. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ربّما كانَ الدَّواءُ داءً والدّاءُ دواءً
hadiths.english: 2275. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'It is possible for a medicine to be an ailment and an ailment to be a medicine.'

hadiths.arabic: 2276. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن لم يَحتَمِلْ مَرارَةَ الدواءِ دامَ ألَمُهُ
hadiths.english: 2276. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The pain of one who cannot bear the bitterness of a remedy will continue.'

hadiths.arabic: 2277. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : لا تَصِفَنَّ لِمَلِكٍ دواءً ، فإن نَفَعَهُ لَم يَحمَدْكَ ، وإن ضَرَّهُ اتَّهَمَكَ
hadiths.english: 2277. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, 'Do not prescribe any remedy for a [arrogant] ruler, for if it benefits him, he will fail to show gratitude to you, and if it harms him he will accuse you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2278. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن دَقَّ في الدِّينِ نَظَرُهُ جَلَّ يومَ القِيامَةِ خَطَرُهُ
hadiths.english: 2278. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever gives acute attention to their religion will have a lofty station on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.arabic: 2279. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدِّينُ نورٌ
hadiths.english: 2279. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Religion is light.'

hadiths.arabic: 2280. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا حياةَ إلّا بالدِّينِ ، ولا مَوتَ إلّا بجُحُودِ اليقينِ
hadiths.english: 2280. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'There is no life but with religion and no death but with denial of sincere belief.'

hadiths.arabic: 2281. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدِّينُ يَعصِمُ
hadiths.english: 2281. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Religion immunizes.'

hadiths.arabic: 2282. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الدِّينُ أقوَى عِمادٍ
hadiths.english: 2282. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Religion is the strongest support.'

hadiths.arabic: 2283. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : كانَ أميرُالمؤمنينَ عليه السلام كثيراً مّا يقولُ في خُطبتِهِ : يا أيّها الناسُ ، دِينَكُم دِينَكم !! فإنّ السيّئةَ فيهِ خيرٌ مِن الحَسَنةِ في غَيرِهِ ، والسيّئةَ فيهِ تُغفَرُ ، والحَسَنةَ في غيرِهِ لا تُقبَلُ
hadiths.english: 2283. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The Commander of the Faithful (AS) would frequently say in his sermons, 'O people! Preserve your religion, for the bad deed of a religious person is better than the good deed of a religion-less person, because the bad deed of a religious person can be forgiven but the good deed of a religion-less person is not accepted.'

hadiths.arabic: 2284. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : آفَةُ الدِّينِ سُوءُ الظنِّ.
hadiths.english: 2284. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The bane of religion is suspiciousness.'

hadiths.arabic: 2285. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فسادُ الدِّينِ الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2285. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The corruption of religion lies in [the vanities of] this world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2286. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : آفَةُ الدِّينِ : الحَسَدُ والعُجبُ والفَخرُ
hadiths.english: 2286. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The bane of religion is in jealousy, self-conceit and pride.'

hadiths.arabic: 2287. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا حَضَرَت بَلِيَّةٌ فاجعَلُوا أموالَكُم دونَ أنفسِكُم ، وإذا نَزَلَت نازلةٌ فاجعَلُوا أنفسَكُم دونَ دِينِكُم ، واعلَمُوا أنَّ الهالِكَ مَن هَلَكَ دِينُهُ ، والحَريبَ مَن حُرِبَ دِينُهُ
hadiths.english: 2287. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'If you are faced with a tribulation, shield your life with your wealth. If you are faced with a calamity, then shield your religion with your life, and know that the ruined man is he who destroys his religion himself and that the corrupted one is he who spoils his religion himself.'

hadiths.arabic: 2288. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - كانَ يقولُ عندَ المُصيبةِ - : الحمدُ للَّهِ‏ِ الذي لم يَجعَلْ مُصِيبَتِي في دِينِي
hadiths.english: 2288. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) would say when struck with an affliction, 'All praise be to Allah who did not allow my religion to be afflicted.'

hadiths.arabic: 2289. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : لا دِينَ لِمَن دانَ بطاعةِ مَن عَصَى اللَّهَ ، ولا دِينَ لِمَن دانَ بِفِريَةِ باطلٍ على اللَّهِ ، ولا دِينَ لِمَن دانَ بجُحُودِ شَي‏ءٍ مِن آياتِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2289. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'One who subjects himself to the obedience of someone who disobeys Allah has no religion, and the one who subjects himself to attributing a lie or falsity to Allah has no religion, and the one who subjects himself to denying any of Allah's signs has no religion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2290. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لا دِينَ لِمَن دانَ بولايةِ إمامٍ جائرٍ لَيسَ مِنَ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2290. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'He who subjects himself to following an oppressive leader unendorsed by Allah has no religion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2291. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لادِينَ لِمَن لاعَهدَله
hadiths.english: 2291. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The one who has no covenant has no religion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2292. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : كُلُّ مَن لم يُحِبَّ على الدِّينِ ولم يُبغِضْ على الدِّينِ فلا دينَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2292. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Anyone whose love and hate is not based on religion, has no religion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2293. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : لادِينَ لِمَن لا مُرُوَّةَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2293. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'He who has no valorous qualities has no religion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2294. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : لادِينَ لِمَن‏لاوَرَعَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2294. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'He who has no piety has no religion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2295. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يا أيّها الناسُ ، إنَّ دِينَ اللَّهِ يُسرٌ
hadiths.english: 2295. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O people, verily the religion of Allah is easy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2296. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : بُعِثتُ بِالحَنِيفِيَّةِ السَّمْحَةِ ، ومَن خالَفَ سُنَّتِي فلَيسَ مِنّي
hadiths.english: 2296. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'I have been sent [to you] with the upright and liberal religion and whoever defies my prophetic practice is not from me.'

hadiths.arabic: 2297. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ اللَّهَ لم يَبعَثْنِي بالرَّهبانِيَّةِ ، وإنّ خيرَ الدِينِ عندَ اللَّهِ الحنيفيّةُ السَّمْحَةُ
hadiths.english: 2297. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah has not sent me with monasticism, rather the best religion with Allah is the upright and liberal one.'

sections.section_title_ar: الدِّينُ الَّذي لا تُقبَلُ الأعمالُ إلّا بِهِ‏
sections.section_title_en: THE ONLY RELIGION THROUGH WHICH DEEDS ARE ACCEPTED

hadiths.arabic: 2298. الكافي عن عليِّ بنِ أبي حمزَةَ عن أبي بصيرٍ، قال : سمعتُهُ يسألُ أبا عبدِاللَّهِ عليه السلام فقالَ له : جُعِلتُ فِداكَ أخبِرْني عنِ الدِّينِ الذي افتَرَضَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ عَلى العبادِ ما لا يَسَعُهُم جَهلُهُ ، ولا يُقبَلُ مِنهُم غيرُهُ ماهو ؟ فقالَ : شهادةُ أن لا إلهَ إلّا اللَّهُ ، وأنّ محمّداً رسولُ‏اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله، وإقامُ الصلاةِ ، وإيتاءُ الزكاةِ ، وحجُّ البيتِ مَنِ استَطاعَ إلَيهِ سبيلاً ، وصومُ شَهرِ رمضانَ ثُمّ سَكَتَ قليلاً ثُمّ قالَ : والوَلايةُ - مَرّتَينِ -
hadiths.english: 2298. It is narrated in al-Kafi that Ali b. Abi Hamza narrated from Abu Basir that he said: 'I heard him asking Abu Abdullah [al-Sadiq] (AS): 'May I be sacrificed for you, please inform me about the religion that Allah has obligated upon His servants. The religion that they cannot afford to be ignorant of and the only religion that will be accepted from them. What is it?' The Imam (AS) replied, 'Bearing witness that there is no god except Allah and that Muhammad (SAWA) is the Messenger of Allah, establishing the prayer, paying the alms-tax, pilgrimage to the House for those who are able to do so, fasting the month of Ramadan.' Then the Imam momentarily paused and then repeated twice, 'and divine guardianship [of the divinely appointed Imams] (al-wilaya).'

sections.section_title_en: The Correct Way to UNDERSTANDING RELIGION

hadiths.arabic: 2299. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن عَرَفَ دينَهُ مِن كتابِ اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ زالَتِ الجِبالُ قبلَ أن يَزُولَ ، ومَن‏دَخَلَ في‏أمرٍ بِجَهلٍ‏خَرَجَ منهُ بِجَهلٍ.
hadiths.english: 2299. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The one who understands his religion from the Book of Allah, mountains will move before he does [in his faith], and the one who enters a matter with ignorance [i.e. accepts religion ignorantly] will leave it in ignorance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2300. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن دَخَلَ في هذا الدِّينِ بالرِّجالِ أخرَجَهُ مِنهُ الرِّجالُ كما أدخَلُوهُ فيهِ ، ومَن دَخَلَ فيهِ بِالكِتابِ والسُّنَّةِ زالَتِ الجبالُ قَبلَ أن يَزولَ
hadiths.english: 2300. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The one who enters this religion through men will exit it through men just as they caused him to enter it. And whoever enters this religion through the Book and the prophetic practice, mountains will move before he does [in his faith].'

sections.section_title_en: PROTECTING THE RELIGION BY MEANS OF THE WORLD

hadiths.arabic: 2301. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : صُن دِينَكَ بدُنياكَ تَربَحْهُما ، ولا تَصُنْ دنياكَ بِدِينِكَ فَتَخسَرَهُما
hadiths.english: 2301. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Protect your religion by means of your worldly affairs and you will profit in both, but do not use your religion to protect your worldly affairs as you will lose them both.'

hadiths.arabic: 2302. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا يَترُكُ الناسُ شيئاً مِن دِينِهِم لِإصلاحِ دُنياهُم إلّا فَتَحَ اللَّهُ عَليهِم ما هُوَ أضَرُّ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 2302. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'No sooner do people omit any aspect of their religion for the sake of improving their worldly affairs than Allah will open for them something that will be more detrimental to them [than the improvement of their worldly affairs].'

sections.section_title_en: Supplication for Affirming THE HEART TOWARDS RELIGION

hadiths.arabic: 2303. كمال الدين عن عبد اللَّه بن سنان : قال أبو عبد اللَّه عليه السلام : سَتُصيبُكُم شُبهَةٌ فَتَبقُونَ بِلا عَلَمٍ يُرى‏ ولا إمامٍ هدى‏ ، ولا يَنجُو مِنها إلّا مَن دَعا بدُعاءِ الغَريقِ. قلتُ : كيفَ دعاءُ الغَريقِ ؟ قالَ : يقولُ : «يا اللَّهُ يا رحمنُ يا رحيمُ يا مُقَلِّبَ القُلوبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلبِي على‏ دِينِكَ»
hadiths.english: 2303. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'You will be afflicted with an obscure matter that will leave you with no sign to indicate to the solution, nor a leader to guide the way. None shall be saved from it except the one who recites the 'Supplication of the Drowning Person'. [The narrator says] I asked the Imam, 'What is the Supplication of the Drowning Person?' The Imam replied, 'O Allah, O the Beneficent, O the Merciful, O He who causes the hearts to fluctuate, affirm my heart upon Your religion.'

sections.section_title_en: CHARACTERISTICS OF THE PRESERVERS OF ALLAH'S RELIGION

hadiths.arabic: 2304. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّما المُستَحفِظُونَ لِدِينِ اللَّهِ هُمُ الذينَ أقامُوا الدِّينَ ونَصَرُوهُ ، وحاطُوهُ مِن جميعِ جَوانِبِهِ ، وحَفِظُوهُ على‏ عِبادِ اللَّهِ ورَعَوهُ
hadiths.english: 2304. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily the preservers of Allah's religion are the same people who established the religion and helped it, they guarded it from all sides, they preserved it for the servants of Allah and carefully watched over it.'

sections.section_title_ar: تَأييدُ الدِّينِ بِأقوامٍ لا خَلاقَ لَهُم‏
sections.section_title_en: The Strengthening of Religion THROUGH A DISGRACEFUL PEOPLE

hadiths.arabic: 2305. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ اللَّهَ لَيُؤَيِّدُ هذا الدِّينَ بالرَّجُلِ الفاجِرِ
hadiths.english: 2305. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah strengthens this religion through an oppressive man.'

hadiths.arabic: 2306. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ اللَّهَ تَبارَكَ وَتَعالى‏ يُؤَيِّدُ هذا الدِّينَ بِأقوامٍ لا خَلَاقَ لَهُم
hadiths.english: 2306. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah, Blessed and most High, strengthens this religion through a disgraceful people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2307. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إيّاكم والدَّينَ ، فإنّه هَمٌّ بِالليلِ وذُلٌّ بالنهارِ
hadiths.english: 2307. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Beware of debt for verily it is a source of anxiety in the night and a source of disgrace during the day.'

hadiths.arabic: 2308. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كَثرَةُ الدَّينِ تُصَيِّرُ الصادِقَ كاذِباً والمُنجِزَ مُخْلِفاً
hadiths.english: 2308. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Copious debts transform the truthful man into a liar and an achiever into one who is unreliable.'

hadiths.arabic: 2309. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : خَفِّفوا الدَّينَ ، فإنّ في خِفَّةِ الدَّينِ زيادَةَ العُمُرِ
hadiths.english: 2309. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Lighten your debts, for verily with little debt comes longer life.'

sections.section_title_en: PERMISSION TO INCUR DEBT WHEN IN NEED

hadiths.arabic: 2310. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : مَن طَلَبَ هذا الرِّزقَ مِن حِلِّهِ لِيَعودَ بهِ عَلى‏ نفسِهِ وعِيالِهِ كانَ كالمُجاهِدِ في سبيلِ اللَّهِ عزّ وجلّ ، فإن غَلَبَ علَيهِ فَلْيَستَدِنْ عَلَى اللَّهِ وعَلى‏ رسولِهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله ما يَقوتُ بهِ عِيالَهُ
hadiths.english: 2310. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'One who seeks to gain sustenance for himself and his family in a lawful manner is as the one who fights in the way of Allah. But if he is unable to do so he may incur debt, trusting in Allah and His Prophet, in order to ensure provisions for his family.'

sections.section_title_en: ENCOURAGEMENT TO WRITE A CONTRACT FOR ANY LOAN

hadiths.arabic: 2311. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أصنافٌ لا يُستَجابُ لَهُم ، مِنهُم مَن أدانَ رَجُلاً دَيناً إلى‏ أجَلٍ فلَم يَكتُبْ علَيهِ كِتاباً ولَم يُشهِدْ علَيهِ شُهُوداً
hadiths.english: 2311. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There are certain types of people whose supplications are not answered. From among them is the man who lends money to someone for a specified time and neither writes it down nor has anyone witness it.'

sections.section_title_en: PROHIBITION OF THE POSTPONEMENT OF REPAYING DEBTS

hadiths.arabic: 2312. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن يَمطُلْ على‏ ذِي حَقٍّ حَقَّهُ وهُو يَقدِرُ على‏ أداءِ حَقِّهِ فعلَيهِ كُلَّ يومٍ خَطيئةُ عَشّارٍ
hadiths.english: 2312. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever postpones repaying someone their right while he is capable of doing has the sin of an extortionist written down for him as every day passes by.'

hadiths.arabic: 2313. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَطْلُ الغَنِيِّ ظُلمٌ
hadiths.english: 2313. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A wealthy man's postponement [in repayment of a debt] is oppression.'

hadiths.arabic: 2314. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أبخَلُ الناسِ بِعَرَضِهِ أسخاهُم بِعِرضِهِ
hadiths.english: 2314. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The most miserly person with regards to his wealth is the most liberal in squandering away his reputation.'

sections.section_title_en: THE VIRTUE OF THE REMEMBRANCE OF ALLAH

hadiths.arabic: 2315. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تَختارَنَّ عَلى‏ ذِكرِ اللَّهِ شَيئاً فإنّهُ يقولُ : (وَلَذِكْرُ اللَّهِ أكْبَرُ)
hadiths.english: 2315. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Never prefer anything above the remembrance of Allah for verily He says,“and the remembrance of Allah is surely greater.” '

hadiths.arabic: 2316. كنز العمّال عن معاذ رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَيسَ عَمَلٌ أحَبَّ إلى اللَّهِ تعالى‏ ولا أنجى‏ لِعَبدٍ مِن كُلِّ سيّئةٍ في الدنيا والآخِرَةِ مِن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ قيلَ : ولا القتالُ في سبيلِ اللَّهِ ؟ قالَ : لولا ذِكرُ اللَّهِ لم يُؤمَرْ بالقِتالِ
hadiths.english: 2316. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There is no action more beloved to Allah Almighty, or more successful as a means of salvation for a servant of Allah from all the evil of this world and the next than the remembrance of Allah.' Someone then asked, 'Not even fighting in the way of Allah?' The Prophet (SAWA) replied, 'If it was not for the remembrance of Allah, there would be no command to fight in the way of Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2317. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الذِّكرُ لَذَّةُ المُحِبِّينَ
hadiths.english: 2317. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Remembrance is a source of great pleasure for the lovers [of Allah].'

hadiths.arabic: 2318. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الذِّكرُ مُجالَسَةُ المَحبوبِ
hadiths.english: 2318. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Remembrance is sitting in the company of the Beloved One.'

hadiths.arabic: 2319. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ذِكرُ اللَّهِ سَجِيَّةُ كُلِّ مُحسِنٍ وشِيمَةُ كُلِّ مُؤمنٍ
hadiths.english: 2319. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Remembrance of Allah is the natural disposition of every good-doer and the distinguishing mark of every believer.'

hadiths.arabic: 2320. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : عَليكَ بتِلاوَةِ القرآنِ وذِكرِ اللَّهِ كثيراً ، فإنّهُ ذِكرٌ لكَ في السماءِ ونورٌ لكَ في الأرضِ
hadiths.english: 2320. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'I urge you to recite the Qur'an and remember Allah frequently, for verily it [will result in] a remembrance for you in the heavens and a light for you in the earth.'

hadiths.arabic: 2321. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن ذَكَرَ اللَّهَ في السِرِّ فقد ذَكَرَ اللَّهَ كثيراً
hadiths.english: 2321. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever remembers Allah in private, has surely remembered Allah much.'

hadiths.arabic: 2322. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أكثِرُوا ذِكرَ اللَّهِ ما استَطَعتُم في كُلِّ ساعةٍ مِن ساعاتِ الليلِ والنهارِ ، فإنَّ اللَّهَ أمَرَ بكَثرَةِ الذِكرِ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2322. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Remember Allah frequently as much as you can every hour of the day and night, for verily Allah has commanded [us] to remember Him abundantly.'

hadiths.arabic: 2323. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : تَسبيحُ فاطمةَ الزهراءِ عليها السلام مِنَ الذِكرِ الكثيرِ الذي قالَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ : (اُذْكُرُوا اللَّهَ ذِكْراً كثيراً)
hadiths.english: 2323. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The glorification of Fatima al-Zahra (AS) is from the frequent remembrance which Allah mentions,“Remember Allah with a frequent remembrance.”

sections.section_title_en: Enjoinment of Engaging in CONTINUOUS REMEMBRANCE

hadiths.arabic: 2324. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما مِن ساعةٍ تَمُرُّ بابنِ آدَمَ لَم يَذكُرِ اللَّهَ فيها إلّا حَسِرَ علَيها يَومَ القيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 2324. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Every single hour that passes by the son of Adam, that was devoid of the remembrance of Allah will be grieved for on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.arabic: 2325. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في المُناجاةِ الشَّعبانيّةِ - : إلهي، وألْهِمني وَلَهاً بِذِكرِكَ إلى‏ ذِكرِكَ وهِمَّتي إلى‏ روحِ نَجاحِ أسمائكَ ومَحَلِّ قُدسِكَ
hadiths.english: 2325. Imam Ali (AS) said in the intimate supplication of the month of Sha'ban , 'My God! Inspire me with fervour for Your remembrance until I have become inspired with Your remembrance, and a spiritual zeal for the refreshing salvation of Your Names and the place of Your sanctity.'

hadiths.arabic: 2326. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أسأَ لُكَ أن تُصَلِّيَ على‏ محمّدٍ وآلِ محمّدٍ ، وأن تَجعَلَنِي مِمَّن يُدِيمُ ذِكرَكَ ، ولا يَنقُضُ عَهدَكَ
hadiths.english: 2326. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'I ask You to send blessings on Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, and to make me of those who are continuous in Your remembrance and who do not breach Your covenant.'

sections.section_title_ar: ذِكرُ اللَّهِ حَسَنٌ عَلى‏ كُلِّ حالٍ‏
sections.section_title_en: The Remembrance of Allah is Good at All Times

hadiths.arabic: 2327. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - مِن وَصاياهُ لِابنِهِ الحسنِ عليه السلام عِندَ الوَفاةِ - : وكُن للَّهِ‏ِ ذاكِراً على‏ كلِّ حالٍ
hadiths.english: 2327. Imam Ali (AS) said in counsel to his son Hasan at the time of his death (AS), 'and be one to remember Allah at all times.'

hadiths.arabic: 2328. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : قالَ موسى‏ عليه السلام : يا ربِّ ، إنّي أكونُ في حالٍ اُجِلُّكَ أن أذكُرَكَ فيها قالَ : يا موسى ، اُذكُرْني على‏ كُلِّ حالٍ
hadiths.english: 2328. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) narrated, 'Prophet Moses (AS) said, 'My Lord, I am in a [base] state wherin I esteem You too highly to remember You therein', He said, 'O Moses, remember Me at all times.'

hadiths.arabic: 2329. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الذاكِرُ في الغافِلينَ كالمُقاتِلِ في الفارِّينَ
hadiths.english: 2329. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The one who remembers [Allah] in the midst of the neglectful ones is as one who fights [in the way of Allah] in the midst of others who flee [from the battle].'

hadiths.arabic: 2330. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : كُلُّ أحَدٍ يَموتُ عَطْشانَ إلّا ذاكِرَ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2330. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Everyone will die thirsty except the one who remembers Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2331. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ موسى بنَ عِمرانَ عليه السلام لَمّا ناجى‏ رَبَّهُ عزّوجلّ قالَ : يا ربِّ ، أبَعيدٌ أنتَ مِنّي فَاُنادِيَكَ أمْ قَريبٌ فَاُناجِيَكَ ؟ فأَوحَى اللَّهُ جلّ‏جلالُهُ : أنا جَلِيسُ مَن ذَكَرَني
hadiths.english: 2331. The Prophet (SAWA) narrated, 'Verily when Moses, son of Amran (AS) would engage in intimate supplication with his Lord, he said, 'My Lord, are you so far from me that I should call You, or are You so near to me that I should whisper?' so Allah then revealed to Moses, 'I sit in close proximity with the one who remembers Me.'

hadiths.arabic: 2332. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: مَنِ اشتَغَلَ بذِكرِ اللَّهِ طَيَّبَ اللَّهُ ذِكرَهُ
hadiths.english: 2332. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The one who occupies himself with the remembrance of Allah, Allah beautifies his remembrance [among people].'

hadiths.arabic: 2333. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ذاكِرُ اللَّهِ سبحانَهُ مُجالِسُهُ
hadiths.english: 2333. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The one who remembers Allah, glory be to Him, is sitting closely with Him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2334. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : لا يَزالُ المُؤمنُ في صلاةٍ ما كانَ في ذِكرِ اللَّهِ ، قائماً كانَ أو جالِساً أو مُضطَجِعاً ، إنّ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ يقولُ (اَ لَّذِينَ يَذْكُرُونَ اللَّهَ قِياماً وقُعُوداً وعَلَى جُنوبِهِم ...)11.
hadiths.english: 2334. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'The believer remains in a state of prayer as long as he is remembering Allah, whether he is standing, sitting or lying down, for verily Allah says,“Those who remember Allah standing, sitting and lying on their sides” . 14

hadiths.arabic: 2335. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ الصاعِقَةَ لا تُصِيبُ ذاكِراً للَّهِ‏ِ عزّوجلّ
hadiths.english: 2335. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily the one who remembers Allah will never be struck by lightning.'

sections.section_title_en: REMEMBER ALLAH AND HE WILL REMEMBER YOU

hadiths.arabic: 2336. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : قالَ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ : ابنَ آدمَ ، اُذكُرْني في نَفسِكَ أذكُركَ في نَفسي ابنَ آدمَ اُذكُرني في الخَلاءِ أذكُركَ في خَلاءٍ ابنَ آدمَ اُذكُرني في مَلَأٍ أذكُرْكَ في مَلَأٍ خَيرٍ مِن مَلَئِكَ
hadiths.english: 2336. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Allah Almighty said, 'O son of Adam, remember Me within yourself and I will remember you within Myself. O son of Adam, remember Me in secret and I will remember you when [you are] in secret. O son of Adam, remember Me when in an assembly and I will remember you in an assembly which is better than your assembly.'

hadiths.arabic: 2337. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ذِكرُ اللَّهِ شِفاءُ القُلوبِ
hadiths.english: 2337. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The remembrance of Allah is a healing for the hearts.'

hadiths.arabic: 2338. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أكثَرَ مِن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ فقد بَرِئَ مِنَ النِّفاقِ
hadiths.english: 2338. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The one who remembers Allah abundantly has freed himself from hypocrisy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2339. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أكثَرَ ذِكرَ اللَّهِ أحَبَّهُ
hadiths.english: 2339. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The one who remembers Allah abundantly loves Him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2340. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن عَمَرَ قَلبَهُ بدَوامِ الذِكرِ حَسُنَت أفعالُهُ في السِّرِّ والجَهرِ
hadiths.english: 2340. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The one whose heart thrives with the continuous remembrance of Allah, his actions will always be good whether done in secret or openly.'

hadiths.arabic: 2341. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أصلُ صلاحِ القلبِ اشتِغالُهُ بذِكرِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2341. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The root of reforming the heart is in occupying it with the remembrance of Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2342. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن ذَكَرَ اللَّهَ سبحانَهُ أحيا اللَّهُ قَلبَهُ ونَوَّرَ عَقلَهُ ولُبَّهُ
hadiths.english: 2342. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever remembers Allah, glory be to Him, Allah enlivens his heart and illuminates his intellect and the innermost core of his heart.'

hadiths.arabic: 2343. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ذِكرُ اللَّهِ قُوتُ النُّفوسِ ومُجالَسَةُ المَحبوبِ
hadiths.english: 2343. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The remembrance of Allah is a provision for the souls and a close sitting in the company of the Beloved.'

hadiths.arabic: 2344. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : عَليكَ بِذِكرِ اللَّهِ ، فإنّهُ نورُ القلوبِ
hadiths.english: 2344. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'I urge you to keep up the remembrance of Allah for verily it is the light of the hearts.'

hadiths.arabic: 2345. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : دَوامُ الذِكرِ يُنيرُ القلبَ والفِكرَ
hadiths.english: 2345. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Continuous remembrance [of Allah] enlightens the heart and the mind.'

hadiths.arabic: 2346. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنَّ اللَّهَ سبحانَهُ جَعَلَ الذِّكَر جَلاءً للقُلوبِ ، تَسمَعُ بهِ بَعدَ الوَقْرَةِ ، و تُبصِرُ بهِ بَعدَ العَشْوَةِ ، وتَنقادُ بِهِ بَعدَ المُعانَدَةِ
hadiths.english: 2346. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily Allah, Glory be to Him, has made [His] remembrance a polish for the hearts through which they hear after deafness, see after blindness and yield after resistance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2347. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في الدُّعاءِ - : يا مَنِ اسمُهُ دواءٌ وذِكرُهُ شِفاءٌ
hadiths.english: 2347. Imam Ali (AS) said in supplication, 'O He whose name is a remedy and whose remembrance is a healing.'

hadiths.arabic: 2348. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الذِّكرُ مِفتاحُ الاُنْسِ
hadiths.english: 2348. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Remembrance [of Allah] is the key to intimacy (with Him).'

hadiths.arabic: 2349. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا رَأيتَ اللَّهَ سُبحانَهُ يُؤنِسُكَ بِذِكرِهِ فقد أحَبَّكَ ، إذا رَأيتَ اللَّهَ يُؤنِسُكَ بِخَلقِهِ ويوحِشُكَ مِن ذِكرِهِ فقد أبغَضَكَ
hadiths.english: 2349. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'If you see that Allah, Glory be to Him, has made you intimate with His remembrance, then He loves you. If you see that Allah has made you intimate with His creation and banished you from His remembrance, then He has despised you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2350. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ذِكرُ اللَّهِ مَطرَدَةُ الشيطانِ
hadiths.english: 2350. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The remembrance of Allah is a repellent of Satan.'

hadiths.arabic: 2351. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ذِكرُ اللَّهِ جَلاءُ الصُّدورِ وطُمأنِينَةُ القُلوبِ
hadiths.english: 2351. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The remembrance of Allah is a polish for the breasts and a soothing for the hearts.' 2

hadiths.arabic: 2352. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الذِّكرُ يَشرَحُ الصَّدرَ
hadiths.english: 2352. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Remembrance [of Allah] expands the breasts.'

sections.section_title_ar: الحَثُّ عَلى‏ ذِكرِ اللَّهِ في مَواقِفَ‏
sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT OF REMEMBRANCE OF ALLAH IN CERTAIN SITUATIONS

hadiths.arabic: 2353. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا لَقِيتُم عَدُوَّكُم في الحَربِ فَأَقِلُّوا الكلامَ وأكثِرُوا ذِكرَ اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ
hadiths.english: 2353. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'When you face your enemy in battle, then lessen your speech and increase in the remembrance of Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2354. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أكثِرُوا ذِكرَ اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ إذا دَخَلتُمُ الأسواقَ عِندَ اشتِغالِ الناسِ، فإنّهُ كَفّارةٌ لِلذُّنوبِ وزِيادَةٌ في الحَسَناتِ ، ولاتُكتَبُوا في الغافِلينَ
hadiths.english: 2354. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Increase in the remembrance of Allah when you enter the market while people are busy, for verily it will be an expiation of your sins and an increase in good deeds, and you will not be recorded down as being amongst the neglectful ones.'

hadiths.arabic: 2355. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اُذكُرِ اللَّهَ عِندَ هَمِّكَ إذا هَمَمتَ، وعِندَ لِسانِكَ إذا حَكَمتَ ، وعِندَ يَدِكَ إذا قَسَمتَ
hadiths.english: 2355. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Remember Allah during your distress when you are distressed, with your tongue when you give judgment and with your hand when distributing anything.'

hadiths.arabic: 2356. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أوحَى اللَّهُ إلى‏ نبيٍّ مِن أنبيائهِ : ابنَ آدَمَ ، اذكُرنِي عِندَ غَضَبِكَ أذكُرْكَ عِندَ غَضَبِي ، فلا أمحَقُكَ فيمَن أمحَقُ
hadiths.english: 2356. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Allah revealed to a prophet from among His prophets, 'O son of Adam, remember Me during your anger and I will remember you during My anger, and I will not destroy you as a result with those whom I destroy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2357. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : في التَّوراةِ مَكتوبٌ : يا موسى‏ اُذكُرْني في خَلَواتِكَ وعِندَ سُرورِ لَذَّتِكَ أذكُرْكَ عِندَ غَفَلاتِكَ
hadiths.english: 2357. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'It is written in the Torah: '...O Moses... remember Me in times of loneliness and when enjoying your pleasures and I will remember you in your times of negligence.'

sections.section_title_en: THE REALITY OF THE REMEMBRANCE [OF ALLAH]

hadiths.arabic: 2358. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أطاعَ اللَّهَ عزّوجلّ فَقَد ذَكَرَ اللَّهَ وإن قَلَّتْ صلاتُهُ وصِيامُهُ وتلاوَتُهُ لِلقرآنِ
hadiths.english: 2358. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever obeys Allah has remembered Him, even if his prayers, his fasts and his recitation of the Qur'an are few.'

hadiths.arabic: 2359. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - في قولِهِ تعالى‏ : (ولَذِكْرُ اللَّهِ أَكبَرُ) - : ذِكرُ اللَّهِ تَعالى‏ عِندَ ما أحَلَّ وحَرَّمَ
hadiths.english: 2359. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, with regard to the verse of Allah:“and the remembrance of Allah is greater” , '[It means] Remembering Allah with regards to what He has made lawful and unlawful.'

hadiths.arabic: 2360. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الذِّكرُ ذِكرانِ: ذِكرٌ خالِصٌ يُوافِقُهُ القَلبُ ، وذِكرٌ صارِفٌ يَنفِي ذِكرَ غَيرِهِ
hadiths.english: 2360. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There are two types of remembrance, a sincere remembrance which is harmonious with the heart, and a mere remembrance which negates the remembrance of anyone other than Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2361. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : اِجعَلْ ذِكرَ اللَّهِ مِن أجلِ ذِكرِهِ لكَ ، فإنّهُ ذَكَرَكَ وهُو غَنِيٌّ عنكَ فَذِكرُهُ لكَ أجَلُّ وأشهى‏ وأتَمُّ مِن ذِكرِكَ لَهُ وأسبَقُ فَمَن أرادَ أن يَذكرَ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ فَلْيَعلَمْ أ نَّهُ ما لَم يَذكُرِ اللَّهُ العَبدَ بالتوفيقِ لِذِكرِهِ لا يَقدِرُ العَبدُ عَلى‏ ذِكرِهِ
hadiths.english: 2361. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Make your remembrance of Allah for the sake of the fact that He remembers you, for verily He remembers you even though He is needless of you, so His remembrance of you is loftier, more desirable and more complete than your remembrance of Him and it supersedes it...so whoever wishes to remember Allah, most High, should know that as long as Allah does not remember His servant in the context of granting him divine succour to remember Him [in the first place], the servant will not be capable of remembering Him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2362. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : مَن ذَكَرَ اللَّهَ ولم يَستَبِقْ إلى لِقائهِ فَقدِ استَهزَأ بنَفسِهِ
hadiths.english: 2362. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'Whoever remembers Allah but does not vie to meet Him has mocked himself.'

sections.section_title_en: That Which Brings About CONTINUOUS REMEMBRANCE [OF ALLAH]

hadiths.arabic: 2363. بحار الأنوار : في حديثِ المعراجِ : يا أحمَدُ دُمْ على‏ ذِكرِي ، فقالَ : يا ربِّ ، وكيفَ أدُومُ على‏ ذِكرِكَ ؟ فقالَ : بالخَلوَةِ عنِ الناسِ ، وبُغضِكَ الحُلوَ والحامِضَ ، وفَراغِ بَطنِكَ وبَيتِكَ مِنَ الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2363. In the tradition recounting the Prophet (SAWA)'s Ascension to the Heavens (al-miraj): 'O Ahmad... be continuous in My remembrance.' The Prophet (SAWA) asked, 'O My Lord, how can I be continuous in Your remembrance?' He replied, 'Through seclusion from people, despising the sweet and the sour [of the world], and clearing your stomach and your house of the world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2364. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن أحَبَّ شيئاً لَهِجَ بِذِكرِهِ
hadiths.english: 2364. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever loves something is engaged in remembrance of it.'

sections.section_title_en: Factors that Prevent the Remembrance [OF ALLAH]

hadiths.arabic: 2365. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لَيسَ في المعاصِي أشَدُّ مِنِ اتِّباعِ الشَّهوَةِ ، فلا تُطِيعُوها فَتَشغَلَكُم عَنِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2365. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'There is nothing worse from amongst the transgressions than submitting to one's base desires, so do not obey them as they will preoccupy you from [remembering] Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2366. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كُلُّ ما ألهى‏ عن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ فهو مِن المَيسِرِ
hadiths.english: 2366. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Anything that distracts you from the remembrance of Allah is classified as gambling.'

hadiths.arabic: 2367. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كُلُّ ما ألهى‏ عن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ فهو مِن إبليسَ
hadiths.english: 2367. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Anything that distracts you from the remembrance of Allah is from Iblis [Satan].'

hadiths.arabic: 2368. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : إنَّ قَسوَةَ البِطنَةِ وفَترَةَ المَيلَةِ وسُكرَ الشِّبَعِ وغِرَّةَ المُلكِ مِمّا يُثَبِّطُ ويُبطِئُ عَنِ العَمَلِ ويُنسِي الذِّكرَ
hadiths.english: 2368. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'Verily filling the stomach, weakness of will, the intoxication of being fully satiated and the delusion of power, all hinder and delay one from the performance [of good deeds] and cause one to forget Allah.'

sections.section_title_en: THE EFFECTS OF DISREGARDING THE REMEMBRANCE [OF ALLAH]

hadiths.arabic: 2369. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن نَسِيَ اللَّهَ سبحانَهُ أنساهُ اللَّهُ نفسَهُ وأعمى‏ قَلبَهُ
hadiths.english: 2369. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever forgets Allah, Glory be to Him, Allah makes him forget himself and blinds his heart.'

hadiths.arabic: 2370. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : خيرُ الذِّكرِ الخَفِيُّ
hadiths.english: 2370. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The best remembrance is the silent type.'

hadiths.arabic: 2371. الإمامُ‏الباقرُ أو الإمامُ‏الصّادقُ عليهما السلام: لا يَكتُبُ المَلَكُ إلّا ما يَسمَعُ ، قالَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ : (وَاذْكُرْ رَبَّكَ في نَفسِكَ) : لا يَعلمُ ثوابَ ذلكَ الذِّكرِ في نَفسِ العَبدِ غيرُ اللَّهِ تعالى‏
hadiths.english: 2371. Imam al-Baqir or Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The angel only writes down what he hears, but when Allah, Mighty and Exalted, has said,“And remember your Lord within your heart...” , no one knows the reward of that remembrance in the heart of the servant except Allah, most High.'

hadiths.arabic: 2372. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : التَّقَلُّلُ ولا التَّذَلُّلُ
hadiths.english: 2372. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Make do with little rather than disgracing yourself [by begging].'

hadiths.arabic: 2373. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : المَنِيَّةُ ولا الدَّنِيَّةُ ، والتَّقَلُّلُ ولا التَوَسُّلُ
hadiths.english: 2373. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Death is preferable over a life of disgrace. Frugal living is preferable over begging from others.'

hadiths.arabic: 2374. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ساعَةُ ذُلٍّ لا تَفِي بِعِزِّ الدَّهرِ
hadiths.english: 2374. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'A lifetime of honour can never compensate for an hour of disgrace.'

hadiths.arabic: 2375. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في مُناجاتِهِ - : اللّهُمَّ اجعَل نَفسِي أوَّلَ كريمَةٍ تَنتَزِعُها مِن كرائمِي ، وأوَّلَ وَديعَةٍ تَرتَجِعُها مِن وَدائعِ نِعَمِكَ عِندي
