hadiths.english: 2375. Imam Ali (AS) said in one of his intimate supplications, 'O Allah! Let my soul be the first of those precious objects that you will wrest from me, and the first thing to be reclaimed out of all Your bounties held in trust with me.'

sections.section_title_ar: لا يَنبَغي لِلمُؤمِنِ أن يُذِلَّ نفسَهُ‏
sections.section_title_en: A BELIEVER MUST NEVER DISGRACE HIMSELF

hadiths.arabic: 2377. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أقَرَّ بالذُّلِّ طائعاً فَلَيسَ مِنّا أهلَ البيتِ
hadiths.english: 2377. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever succumbs to degrading himself is not considered from among us, the Ahl al-bayt.'

hadiths.arabic: 2378. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّ اللَّهَ تَبارَكَ وتعالى‏ فَوَّضَ إلى المؤمنِ كُلَّ شي‏ءٍ إلّا إذلالَ نَفسِهِ
hadiths.english: 2378. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily Allah, Blessed and most High, has placed everything at the disposal of the believer except that which brings disgrace upon him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2379. مشكاة الأنوار عن داوود الرَّقّي : سمعتُ أبا عبدِاللَّهِ عليه السلام يقولُ : لا يَنبَغي للمؤمنِ أن يُذِلَّ نفسَهُ ، قيلَ لَهُ : وكيفَ يُذِلُّ نَفسَهُ ؟ قالَ : يَتَعَرَّضُ لِما لايُطيقُ فَيُذِلُّها
hadiths.english: 2379. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'A believer must never disgrace himself.' When asked by someone how this disgrace comes about, he replied, 'By going out of his way to obtain that which is beyond his control, he ends up disgracing himself.'

hadiths.arabic: 2380. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا ضَنَّ الناسُ بالدِّينارِ والدِّرهَمِ وتَبايَعُوا بالعِينَةِ وتَبِعُوا أذنابَ البَقَرِ وتَرَكُوا الجِهادَ في سبيلِ اللَّهِ ، أدخَلَ اللَّهُ علَيهِم ذُلّاً لا يَرفَعُهُ عَنهُم حتّى‏ يُراجِعُوا دِينَهُم
hadiths.english: 2380. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When people are miserly with their dinars and their dirhams [i.e. their wealth] and conclude bargains only upon sampling, and are too busy running after their livestock, and abandon fighting in the way of Allah (jihad), Allah brings down such disgrace upon them that can never be revoked until they turn back to their religion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2381. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أذَلُّ الناسِ مَن أهانَ الناسَ
hadiths.english: 2381. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The most disgraceful of people is he who humiliates others.'

hadiths.arabic: 2382. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الناسُ مِن خَوفِ الذُّلِّ مُتَعَجِّلُو الذُّلِّ
hadiths.english: 2382. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'People, in their effort to avoid disgrace, rush headlong into it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2383. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : رَضِيَ بِالذُّلِّ مَن كَشَفَ عن ضُرِّهِ
hadiths.english: 2383. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who discloses his problems to others resigns himself to disgrace.'

hadiths.arabic: 2384. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : لا ذُلَّ كَذُلِّ الطَّمَعِ
hadiths.english: 2384. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'There is no disgrace worse than that of greed.'

hadiths.arabic: 2385. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن أحَبَّ الحياةَ ذَلَّ
hadiths.english: 2385. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'He who loves life is bound to face disgrace.'

hadiths.arabic: 2386. كشف الغمة : وفي نَقلٍ : شَكا إلى‏ أبي عَبدِ اللَّهِ عليه السلام رجُلٌ جارَهُ فَقالَ : اِصبِرْ عَليهِ ، فقالَ : يَنسُبُنِي الناسُ إلى الذُّلِّ ، فقالَ : إنّما الذليلُ مَن ظَلَمَ
hadiths.english: 2386. Someone once came to one of the Imams (AS) complaining about a man who was wronging him. The Imam (AS) replied, 'Be patient with him.' The man retorted, 'But people are taking me for a disgraced fool.' The Imam replied, 'The disgraced one is actually the one who wrongs others.'

hadiths.arabic: 2387. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الذُّنوبُ الدّاءُ ، والدَّواءُ الاستغِفارُ ، والشِّفاءُ أن لا تَعودَ
hadiths.english: 2387. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Sins are a disease the medicine of which is to seek forgiveness, and the cure lies in never committing them again.'

hadiths.arabic: 2388. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يا أيّها الإنسانُ ، ما جَرَّأكَ على‏ ذَنبِكَ ، وما غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ، وما أنَّسَكَ بِهَلَكَةِ نَفسِكَ ! ؟
hadiths.english: 2388. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'O man, what has emboldened you to commit sins, and what has deceived you about your Lord, and what has rendered you so complacent about the destruction of your soul!?'

hadiths.arabic: 2389. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : عَجِبتُ لأقوامٍ يَحتَمُونَ الطَّعامَ مَخافَةَ الأذى‏ كيفَ لا يَحتَمُونَ الذُّنوبَ مَخافةَ النّارِ ؟!
hadiths.english: 2389. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'How I wonder at people who keep away from certain types of food for fear of harm to themselves, and yet do not keep away from sins for fear of the Fire!?'

hadiths.arabic: 2390. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لَو لَم يَتَوَعَّدِ اللَّهُ على‏ معصِيَتِهِ لَكانَ يَجِبُ ألّا يُعصى‏ شُكراً لِنِعَمِهِ
hadiths.english: 2390. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Even if Allah had not fixed punishments and threats for acts of disobedience to Him, we would still be obliged not to disobey Him, simply by way of gratitude to Him for His bounties.'

hadiths.arabic: 2391. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اجتِنابُ السيّئاتِ أولى‏ مِنِ اكتِسابِ الحَسَناتِ
hadiths.english: 2391. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Refraining from committing evil deeds is better than performing good deeds.'

hadiths.arabic: 2392. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنّ العُقَلاءَ تَرَكُوا فُضولَ الدنيا فكيفَ الذُّنوبُ ؟! وتَركُ الدنيا مِنَ الفَضلِ ، وتَركُ الذُّنوبِ مِنَ الفَرضِ
hadiths.english: 2392. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'The people of intellect have abandoned the excesses of this world, but what about sins? Forsaking worldly excesses is [merely] a virtue whereas abandoning sins is an obligation.'

hadiths.arabic: 2393. بحار الأنوار - عنهم عليهم السلام - : جِدُّوا واجتَهِدُوا، وإن لَم تَعمَلُوا فلا تَعصُوا ، فإنّ مَن يَبنِي ولا يَهدِمُ يَرتَفِعُ بِناؤهُ وإن كانَ يَسيراً ، وإنّ مَن يَبنِي ويَهدِمُ يوشِكُ أن لا يَرتَفِعَ بِناؤهُ
hadiths.english: 2393. Bihar al-Anwar narrating from the Imams (AS) , 'Strive earnestly and work hard, and even if you do not manage to perform good deeds, at least do not sin, for verily the building of one who continuously builds without destroying [at the same time] will rise tall, even if it be plain and unadorned, whilst the building of one who builds but also destroys will almost never rise up.'

hadiths.arabic: 2394. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مُجاهَرَةُ اللَّهِ سبحانَهُ بالمعاصِي تُعَجِّلُ النِّقَمَ
hadiths.english: 2394. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Openly and candidly disobeying Allah - glory be to Him - hastens His wrath.'

hadiths.arabic: 2395. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : المُذِيعُ بالسيّئةِ مَخذُولٌ ، والمُستَتِرُ بالسيّئةِ مَغفورٌ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2395. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'The one who commits an evil deed openly is disgraced [by Allah], and the one who hides his evil deed [feeling ashamed of it] is forgiven by Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2396. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أشَدُّ الذُّنوبِ ما استَخَفَّ بهِ صاحِبُهُ
hadiths.english: 2396. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The worst and gravest of sins is that which its perpetrator takes lightly.'

hadiths.arabic: 2397. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أعظَمُ الذُّنوبِ عِندَ اللَّهِ ذنبٌ أصَرَّ عَليهِ عامِلُهُ
hadiths.english: 2397. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The worst of sins in the sight of Allah is the sin which its perpetrator commits persistently.'

hadiths.arabic: 2398. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : الذُّنوبُ كُلُّها شَديدةٌ وأشَدُّها ما نَبَتَ عَليهِ اللَّحمُ والدمُ
hadiths.english: 2398. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'All sins are severe [in requital], but the severest of them are those that result in the growth of [polluted] flesh and blood.'

hadiths.arabic: 2399. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لِكُلِّ ذَنبٍ تَوبَةٌ إلّا سُوءَ الخُلُقِ ، فإنّ صاحِبَهُ كُلَّما خَرَجَ من ذَنبٍ دَخَلَ في ذَنبٍ
hadiths.english: 2399. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The repentance of every sin is acceptable, except for ill-nature, for indeed the ill-natured person is such that every time he manages to get out of one sin, he plunges into another.'

hadiths.arabic: 2400. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إيّاكُم والذُّنوبَ التي لا تُغفَرُ : الغُلُولَ فَمَن غَلَّ شيئاً يَأْتِي بهِ يومَ القيامةِ ، وأكْلَ الرِّبا فإنّ آكِلَ الرِّبا لا يَقومُ إلّا كما يَقومُ الذي يَتَخَبَّطُهُ الشيطانُ مِنَ المَسِ‏
hadiths.english: 2400. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Beware of the sins that cannot be forgiven: Betraying the spoils, and he who betrays the spoils will be brought with it on Judgment Day, and the consuming of usury, as the consumer of usury will be resurrected from his grave like being deranged by the Devil's touch.'

hadiths.arabic: 2401. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّ مِن عَزائمِ اللَّهِ في الذِّكرِ الحكيمِ أ نّهُ لا يَنفَعُ عَبداً - وإن أجهَدَ نفسَهُ وأخلَصَ فِعلَهُ - أن يَخرُجَ مِنَ الدنيا لاقياً رَبَّهُ بِخَصلةٍ مِن هذهِ الخِصالِ لَم يَتُبْ مِنها : أن يُشرِكَ بِاللَّهِ فيما افتَرَضَ علَيهِ مِن عبادَتِهِ ، أو يَشفِيَ غَيظَهُ بهَلاكِ نَفْسٍ ، أو يَعُرَّ بأمرٍ فَعَلَهُ غيرُهُ ، أو يَستَنجِحَ حاجةً إلى الناسِ بإظهارِ بِدعَةٍ في دِينِهِ ، أو يَلقَى الناسَ بَوَجهَينِ ، أو يَمشِيَ فيهِم بِلِسانَينِ
hadiths.english: 2401. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'One of the firm decisions of Allah in the Wise Reminder (the Qur'an) is that it will be of no avail to man to strive with his soul and to act sincerely, if upon leaving this world to meet his Lord he is still guilty of any of the following sins for which he has not repented: that he associated anything else with Allah in his obligatory worship, or appeased his own anger by killing someone, or exposed acts committed by others, or sought fulfilment of his needs from people by introducing an innovation in his religion, or was two-faced in his encounters with people, or mingled among them deceitfully.'

hadiths.arabic: 2402. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : مِنَ الذُّنوبِ التي لا تُغفَرُ قولُ الرَّجُلِ : يالَيتَنِي لا اُؤَاخَذُ إلّا بهذا !
hadiths.english: 2402. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Among the sins that are unforgivable is when a man says, 'I wish I would only be punished on account of this one sin [deeming the sin so small that he thinks he can bear the punishment].'

sections.section_title_en: WARNING AGAINST COMMITTING ACTS OF DISOBEDIENCE IN SECRET

hadiths.arabic: 2403. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اتَّقوا معاصيَ اللَّهِ في الخَلَواتِ ، فإنّ الشاهِدَ هُو الحاكِمُ
hadiths.english: 2403. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Be on your guard against committing acts of disobedience to Allah in secret, for verily the Witness is the Judge Himself.'

hadiths.arabic: 2404. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : مَنِ ارتَكَبَ الذنبَ في الخَلاءِ لم يَعبَأِ اللَّهُ بهِ
hadiths.english: 2404. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Allah could not care less about the one who goes out of his way to commit a sin in private [thinking he can hide from Allah].'

sections.section_title_en: Taking One's Sins Lightly AND DEEMING THEM INSIGNIFICANT

hadiths.arabic: 2405. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ المؤمنَ لَيَرى‏ ذَنبَهُ كَأَ نَّهُ تحتَ صَخرَةٍ يَخافُ أن تَقَعَ علَيهِ ، والكافِرَ يَرى‏ ذَنبَهُ كأنّهُ ذُبابٌ مَرَّ على‏ أنفِهِ
hadiths.english: 2405. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The believer sees his sin as a big boulder which he fears may fall on him, while the disbeliever sees his sin as a fly that has brushed past him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2406. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ إبليسَ رَضِيَ مِنكُم بالمُحَقَّراتِ
hadiths.english: 2406. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Iblis [Satan] is well-pleased with you when you commit petty sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 2407. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تَنظُرُوا إلى‏ صِغَرِ الذَّنبِ ولكنِ انظُرُوا إلى‏ مَنِ اجتَرَأتُم
hadiths.english: 2407. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not look at the pettiness of the sin, rather look at Who it is you have dared to defy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2408. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أعظَمُ الذُّنوبِ عِندَ اللَّهِ سبحانَهُ ذَنبٌ صَغُرَ عِندَ صاحِبِهِ
hadiths.english: 2408. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The worst of sins in the sight of Allah is the sin which its perpetrator deems insignificant.'

hadiths.arabic: 2409. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : لا مُصيبَةَ كاستِهانَتِكَ بالذنبِ ورِضاكَ بالحالةِ التي أنتَ علَيها
hadiths.english: 2409. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'There is no greater tribulation than your indifference towards your sins and your satisfaction with your current state of affairs.'

hadiths.arabic: 2410. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : لاتَستَقِلُّوا قليلَ الذُّنوبِ، فإنّ قليلَ الذُّنوبِ يَجتَمِعُ حتّى‏ يكونَ كثيراً
hadiths.english: 2410. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Do not deem your petty sins as insignificant, for verily petty sins accumulate and become grave sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 2411. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : الصَّغائرُ مِنَ الذنوبِ طُرُقٌ إلى الكبائرِ ، ومَن لَم يَخَفِ اللَّهَ في القَليلِ لَم يَخَفْهُ في الكثيرِ
hadiths.english: 2411. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'Petty sins lead the way for grave sins, and he who does not fear Allah with regard to small things will not fear Him when it comes to grave things.'

hadiths.arabic: 2412. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الكبائرُ : الإشراكُ بِاللَّهِ ، وعُقُوقُ الوالدَينِ ، وقَتلُ النَّفْسِ ، واليَمينُ الغَمُوسُ
hadiths.english: 2412. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The grave sins are: associating anything with Allah, insolence to one's parents, murdering an innocent soul, and taking an immoral or licentious oath.'

hadiths.arabic: 2413. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئِلَ عن أكبَرِ الكبائرِ - : الأمنُ مِن مَكرِ اللَّهِ ، والإياسُ مِن رَوحِ اللَّهِ ، والقُنُوطُ مِن رَحمَةِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2413. Imam Ali (AS), when asked about the gravest of the grave sins, said, 'Feeling secure from Allah's plan, giving up all hope of Allah's munificence, and despairing of Allah's mercy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2414. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الكبائرُ سَبعٌ : قَتلُ المؤمِنِ مُتَعَمِّداً ، وقذفُ المُحصَنَةِ ، والفِرارُ مِنَ الزَّحفِ ، والتَّعَرُّبُ بعدَ الهِجرَةِ ، وأكلُ مالِ اليتيمِ ظُلماً ، وأكلُ الرِّبا بعدَ البَيِّنَةِ ، وكُلُّ ما أوجَبَ اللَّهُ عليهِ النارَ
hadiths.english: 2414. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There are seven grave sins: intentionally killing a believer, falsely accusing a chaste woman of fornication, fleeing from the midst of a battle, returning to a state of renegation after belief , unjustly usurping the property of the orphan, devouring usury after knowledge of its prohibition, and everything else that Allah has threatened to requite with obligatory punishment in the Fire.'

hadiths.arabic: 2415. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا كبيرَ مَع الاستِغفارِ ، ولا صغيرَ مع الإصرارِ
hadiths.english: 2415. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'No petty sin remains when persisted upon, and no grave sin remains when repented for' [i.e. the petty sin can be cancelled with persistence and furtherance in it, hence becoming a grave sin, and the grave sin can be annulled with repentance].'

hadiths.arabic: 2416. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام - في قولِهِ تعالى‏: (...ولَم يُصِرُّوا ...) : الإصرارُ أن يُذنِبَ العَبدُ ولايَستَغفِرَ ، ولا يُحَدِّثَ نفسَهُ بالتوبةِ فذلكَ الإصرارُ
hadiths.english: 2416. Imam al-Baqir (AS) with reference to Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“those who do not knowingly persist in what they have committed” , said, 'Persistence in sinning is when a person commits a sin, and does not seek forgiveness for it, and moreover, it does not even occur to him to repent for it - that is persistent sinning.'

hadiths.arabic: 2417. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن تَلَذَّذَ بمعاصِي اللَّهِ أورَثَهُ اللَّهُ ذُلّاً
hadiths.english: 2417. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever takes pleasure in committing acts of disobedience to Allah, Allah will bring disgrace down upon him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2418. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : إيّاكَ والابتِهاجَ بالذنبِ ، فإنّ الابتِهاجَ بهِ أعظَمُ مِن رُكوبِهِ
hadiths.english: 2418. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'Beware of enjoying the sin, for verily that enjoyment is worse than the actual perpetration of it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2419. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الذَّنبُ شُؤمٌ على‏ غيرِ فاعِلِهِ ، إن عَيَّرَهُ ابتُلِيَ ، وإنِ اغتابَهُ أثِمَ ، وإن رَضِيَ بهِ شارَكَهُ
hadiths.english: 2419. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The sin is also a [source of] misfortune for people other than the perpetrator, for if someone was to expose that sin, he too is afflicted, and if he was to talk about him behind his back, he is also committing a sin, and if he is content thereof and does not bother with others' actions, then it is as if he also partook in the sin.'

hadiths.arabic: 2420. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما جَفَّتِ الدُّموعُ إلّا لِقَسوَةِ القُلوبِ ، وما قَسَتِ القُلوبُ إلّا لكَثرَةِ الذُّنوبِ
hadiths.english: 2420. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Tears only dry up and fail to flow as a result of hard-heartedness, and the hearts only harden as a result of an abundance of sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 2421. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : الذُّنوبُ التي تَحبِسُ غَيثَ السماءِ : جَورُ الحُكّامِ في القَضاءِ ، وشَهادَةُ الزُّورِ ، وكِتمانُ الشهادَةِ
hadiths.english: 2421. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'The sins that prevent rain from falling are: the judges' unjust rulings, the giving of false testimony and the concealing of one's testimony.'

hadiths.arabic: 2422. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنّه ما مِن سَنَةٍ أقَلَّ مَطَراً مِن سَنَةٍ ، ولكنّ اللَّهَ يَضَعُهُ حيثُ يشاءُ ، إنّ اللَّهَ عزّوجلّ إذا عَمِلَ قَومٌ بالمعاصِي صَرَفَ عَنهُم ما كانَ قَدَّرَ لَهُم مِنَ المَطَرِ
hadiths.english: 2422. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'When the rainfall is less from year to year, it is only because Allah sends it down as and when He wishes, such that when a people commit acts of disobedience to Him, Allah - Mighty and Exalted - withholds the rain that He had ordained for them.'

hadiths.arabic: 2423. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إذا أذنَبَ الرجُلُ خَرَجَ في قَلبِهِ نُكْتَةٌ سَوْداءُ ، فإن تابَ انمَحَتْ ، وإن زادَ زادَتْ حتّى‏ تَغلِبَ على‏ قَلبِهِ فلا يُفلِحُ بَعدَها أبداً
hadiths.english: 2423. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'When a man commits a sin, a black spot appears on his heart. If he repents, it is effaced, but if he continues committing it, the spot increases and grows until it engulfs the whole heart, and he can never again prosper.'

hadiths.arabic: 2424. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : ما أنعَمَ اللَّهُ على‏ عبدٍ نِعمَةً فَسَلَبَها إيّاهُ حتّى‏ يُذنِبَ ذَنباً يَستَحِقُّ بذلكَ السَّلبَ
hadiths.english: 2424. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Allah never bestows bounties on His servant only to take them away again until and unless he commits a sin, whereby he becomes deserving of Allah's deprivation.'

hadiths.arabic: 2425. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ الرَّجُلَ يُذنِبُ الذنبَ فَيُحرَمُ صلاةَ الليلِ ، وإنّ العَمَلَ السَيِ‏ءَ أسرَعُ في صاحِبِهِ مِنَ السِّكِّينِ في اللَّحمِ
hadiths.english: 2425. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Indeed the servant commits a sin, and as a result he is deprived of the Night Prayer. And verily the evil deed pierces into and affects the one who committed it faster than a sharp knife can pierce into meat.'

hadiths.arabic: 2426. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن يَموتُ بالذُّنوبِ أكثَرُ مِمَّن يَموتُ بِالآجالِ
hadiths.english: 2426. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There are more people who die as a result of their sins than who die because they have reached their appointed time.'

hadiths.arabic: 2427. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : إذا كَذَبَ الوُلاةُ حُبِسَ المَطَرُ ، وإذا جارَ السُّلطانُ هانَتِ الدَّولةُ ، وإذا حُبِسَتِ الزكاةُ ماتَتِ المَواشي
hadiths.english: 2427. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'When the governors [of a place] are dishonest, rainfall is withheld [from that place], and when the sultan is unjust the whole country is abased, and when the alms-tax is not paid, livestock die as a result.'

sections.section_title_en: SINS, THE PUNISHMENT OF WHICH IS HASTENED [IN THE LIFE OF THIS WORLD]

hadiths.arabic: 2428. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ثلاثةٌ مِنَ الذُّنوبِ تُعَجَّلُ عُقوبَتُها ولا تُؤَخَّرُ إلى الآخِرَةِ : عُقوقُ الوالِدَينِ ، والبَغيُ على الناسِ ، وكُفرُ الإحسانِ
hadiths.english: 2428. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There are three sins whose punishment is hastened in the life of this world and is not delayed until the Hereafter: insolence to one's parents, intimidation of others and ingratitude for a favour.'

hadiths.arabic: 2429. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : في كِتابِ أميرِ المؤمنينَ عليه السلام: ثلاثُ خِصالٍ لا يَموتُ صاحِبُهُنّ حتّى‏ يَرى‏ وَبالَهُنَّ : البَغيُ، وقَطيعَةُ الرَّحِمِ، واليَمينُ الكاذِبةُ
hadiths.english: 2429. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said that the following was written in the Book of Imam Ali (AS), the Commander of the Faithful, 'The perpetrator of any of the following three misdeeds will not die before seeing their evil consequences in this world. They are: intimidation of others, cutting off one's blood relations and taking false oaths.'

hadiths.arabic: 2430. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لِكُلِّ داءٍ دواءٌ ، ودواءُ الذُّنوبِ الاستِغفارُ
hadiths.english: 2430. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There is a remedy for every ailment, and the remedy for sins is seeking forgiveness.'

hadiths.arabic: 2431. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لِلمؤمنِ اثنانِ وسَبعونَ ستراً ، فإذا أذنَبَ ذنباً انهَتَكَ عَنهُ سِترٌ ، فإن تابَ رَدَّهُ اللَّهُ إلَيهِ وسَبعةً مَعهُ
hadiths.english: 2431. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The believer is given seventy-two veils of which one is torn off every time he sins. When he repents however, Allah returns the veil to its original state and grants him seven more in addition.'

hadiths.arabic: 2432. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا يَزالُ البَلاءُ في المؤمنِ والمؤمنةِ في جَسَدِهِ ومالِهِ وولدِهِ حَتّى يَلقَى اللَّهَ وما علَيهِ مِن خطيئةٍ
hadiths.english: 2432. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A believing man or woman will continuously be in a state of physical, financial or domestic affliction so that when they die, they will meet Allah with a clean slate.'

hadiths.arabic: 2433. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما مِنَ الشِّيعةِ عَبدٌ يُقارِفُ أمراً نَهَينا عَنهُ فيَموتُ حتّى يُبتَلى‏ ببَلِيّةٍ تُمَحَّصُ بها ذنوبُهُ ، إمّا في مالٍ ، وإمّا في ولدٍ ، وإمّا في نفسِهِ ، حتّى يَلقَى اللَّهَ عزّوجلّ وما لَهُ ذنبٌ ، وإنّه لَيَبقى‏ علَيهِ الشي‏ءُ مِن ذنوبِهِ فَيُشَدَّدُ بهِ علَيهِ عِندَ مَوتِهِ
hadiths.english: 2433. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'No servant from amongst our followers (Shia) who commits an act that we have forbidden dies without first being afflicted with a severe calamity which expiates his sins, be it with regard to his wealth, his children or his own soul, such that he meets Allah with a clean slate. Moreover, if any of his sins remain even after that, then they are expiated by the pain and difficulty at the time of death.'

hadiths.arabic: 2434. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إذا أرادَ اللَّهُ بعَبدٍ خيراً عَجَّلَ عُقوبَتَهُ في الدنيا ، وإذا أرادَ بعَبدٍ سوءاً أمسَكَ علَيهِ ذُنوبَهُ حتّى‏ يوافِيَ بها يومَ القيامةِ
hadiths.english: 2434. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'When Allah wishes good for His servant, He hastens his punishment to the life of this world, and when he wishes bad for a servant, He suspends the punishment of his sins to face him on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.arabic: 2435. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : السُّقمُ يَمحُو الذُّنوبَ
hadiths.english: 2435. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Illness wipes away sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 2436. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : حُمّى‏ ليلةٍ كَفّارةُ سَنَةٍ
hadiths.english: 2436. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The fever of a single night is expiation for a whole year's sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 2437. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا ابتَلَى اللَّهُ عَبداً أسقَطَ عنهُ مِنَ الذُّنوبِ بقَدْرِ عِلَّتِهِ
hadiths.english: 2437. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'When Allah afflicts a servant with illness, sins shed away from him in proportion to the severity of his ailment.'

hadiths.arabic: 2438. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في المَرَضِ يُصيبُ الصَّبِيَّ - : كفّارةٌ لوالِدَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2438. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The illness that afflicts a child is expiation for his parents' sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 2439. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما أصابَ المؤمنَ مِن نَصَبٍ ولا وَصَبٍ ولا حَزَنٍ حتّى الهَمُّ يُهِمُّهُ إلّا كَفَّرَ اللَّهُ بهِ عَنهُ مِن سيّئاتِهِ
hadiths.english: 2439. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Every fatigue, hardship or sorrow that a believer undergoes, as well as worries that distress him, are a means by which Allah deletes his evil deeds.'

hadiths.arabic: 2440. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ الهَمَّ لَيَذهَبُ بِذُنوبِ المُسلِمِ
hadiths.english: 2440. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily distress takes away the sins of the Muslim.'

hadiths.arabic: 2441. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : ما أحَدٌ مِن شيعَةِ عَليٍّ أصبَحَ صَبيحةً أتى بِسيّئةٍ أو ارتَكَبَ ذنباً إلّا أمسى‏ وقد نالَهُ غَمٌّ حَطَّ عَنهُ سَيِّئَتَهُ ، فكيف يَجرِي علَيهِ القَلمُ ؟!
hadiths.english: 2441. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'When anyone from among the followers (Shia) of Ali commits a sin or perpetrates an evil deed in the morning, it is expiated by any distress he may undergo by nightfall. So how can the Pen ever write down his evil deeds?!'

hadiths.arabic: 2442. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا عَمِلتَ سيّئةً فَاعمَلْ حَسَنةً تَمْحوها
hadiths.english: 2442. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When you commit an evil deed then follow it with the performance of a good deed to efface it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2443. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أربَعٌ مَن كُنَّ فيهِ وكانَ مِن قَرنِهِ إلى‏ قَدَمِهِ ذُنوباً بَدَّلَها اللَّهُ حَسَناتٍ : الصِّدقُ ، والحَياءُ ، وحُسنُ الخُلُقِ ، والشُّكرُ
hadiths.english: 2443. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Four qualities, when possessed by a person, cause Allah to transform his evil deeds into good deeds, even if he is sinful from head to toe. They are: honesty, modesty, good character and thankfulness.'

hadiths.arabic: 2444. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ حُسنَ الخُلُقِ يُذِيبُ الخَطيئةَ كما تُذِيبُ الشمسُ الجَليدَ ، وإنّ سوءَ الخُلُقِ لَيُفسِدُ العَمَلَ كما يُفسِدُ الخَلُّ العَسَلَ
hadiths.english: 2444. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily good character melts away evil deeds as the sun melts away ice, and verily bad character corrupts one's actions like vinegar corrupts honey.'

hadiths.arabic: 2445. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مِن كفّاراتِ الذُّنوبِ العِظامِ : إغاثَةُ المَلهوفِ ، والتَّنفيسُ عنِ المَكروبِ
hadiths.english: 2445. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Among the things that expiate grave sins are: bringing solace to a grief-stricken person, and providing relief to an anguished person.'

hadiths.arabic: 2446. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّ للَّهِ‏ِ عزّ ذِكرُهُ ملائكةً يُسقِطونَ الذُّنوبَ عن ظُهورِ شِيعَتِنا كما تُسقِطُ الرِّيحُ الوَرَقَ مِنَ الشَّجَرِ في أوانِ سُقُوطِهِ ، وذلكَ قولُهُ عزّوجلّ : (يُسَبِّحُونَ بحَمدِ رَبِّهِم ويَسْتَغْفِرُونَ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنوا) واللَّهِ ماأرادَ بهذا غَيرَكُم
hadiths.english: 2446. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily Allah, Exalted be His Remembrance, has angels who strip off sins from the backs of our followers (Shia) like the wind strips the leaves off the trees in autumn, and this is in accordance with His words in the Qur'an,“they glorify the praise of their Lord and seek forgiveness on behalf of those who believe.” By Allah this verse refers to none other than you [my followers].'

hadiths.arabic: 2447. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : جاءَ رَجُلٌ إلى‏ رسولِ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله فقالَ : يارسولَ‏اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله ، كَثُرَت ذُنُوبي وضَعُفَ عَمَلِي ، فقالَ رسولُ‏اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أكثِرِ السُّجودَ فإنّه يَحُطُّ الذُّنوبَ كما تَحُطُّ الرِّيحُ وَرَقَ الشَّجَرِ
hadiths.english: 2447. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'A man once came to the Prophet (SAWA) and said, 'O Prophet of Allah, my sins have increased and my [performance of] good deeds has weakened', to which the Prophet (SAWA) replied, 'Prostrate yourself to Allah frequently for verily this strips off sins as the wind strips off the leaves from the trees.'

hadiths.arabic: 2448. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : العُمرَةُ إلى العُمرَةِ كَفّارَةُ ما بَينَهُما ، والحجّةُ المُتَقَبَّلَةُ ثوابُها الجَنَّةُ ، ومِنَ الذُّنوبِ ذنوبٌ لا تُغفَرُ إلّا بعَرَفاتَ
hadiths.english: 2448. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The voluntary pilgrimage (umra) expiates all sins committed since the preceding voluntary pilgrimage, and the reward for an accepted obligatory pilgrimage (hajj) is Paradise. There are certain sins that can only be forgiven on the plains of Arafa [an area near Mecca in which part of the obligatory pilgrimage is performed].'

hadiths.arabic: 2449. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : مَن لم يَقدِرْ على‏ ما يُكَفِّرُ بهِ ذُنوبَهُ فَلْيُكثِرْ مِنَ الصَّلاةِ على‏ محمّدٍ وآلِهِ فإنّها تَهدِمُ الذُّنوبَ هَدماً
hadiths.english: 2449. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'Whoever is not capable of performing actions to expiate his sins should abundantly send blessings on Muhammad and his household for verily this completely eradicates sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 2450. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : المَوتُ كفّارةٌ لِذُنوبِ المؤمنينَ
hadiths.english: 2450. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Death acts as a penance for the sins committed by believers.' 2

sections.section_title_en: THE CENSURE OF [THE LOVE OF] LEADERSHIP

hadiths.arabic: 2451. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : لا تَطلُبَنَّ أن تكونَ رَأساً فتكونَ ذَ نَباً
hadiths.english: 2451. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Do not ever desire to be a leader for in doing so you will only be a follower.'

hadiths.arabic: 2452. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: إيّاكُم وهؤلاءِ الرؤساءَ الذينَ يَتَرأّسُونَ ، فَوَاللَّهِ ما خَفَقَتِ النِّعالُ خَلفَ رَجُلٍ إلّا هَلَكَ وأهلَكَ
hadiths.english: 2452. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Beware of those leaders who are taking up the reins of leadership, for by Allah, no sooner does the sound of footsteps from behind them [following them] reach their ears than they themselves perish and destroy others along with them.'

hadiths.arabic: 2453. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن طَلَبَ الرئاسةَ هَلَكَ
hadiths.english: 2453. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'One who seeks after leadership perishes.'

hadiths.arabic: 2454. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام - بعد ما ذَكَرَ الإمامُ عليه السلام رجُلاً وقالَ : إنَّهُ يُحِبُّ الرئاسةَ - : ما ذِئبانِ ضارِيانِ في غَنَمٍ قد تَفَرَّقَ رِعاؤها بِأضَرَّ في دِينِ المُسلمِ مِنَ الرئاسةِ
hadiths.english: 2454. Imam al-Rida (AS) said with reference to someone, 'Indeed he loves leadership', and then said, 'Two rapacious wolves hunting a lamb that has been separated from its shepherd and herd is not nearly as hazardous and perilous as seeking after leadership is to the faith of a Muslim.'

hadiths.arabic: 2455. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : آلَةُ الرئاسةِ سَعَةُ الصَّدرِ
hadiths.english: 2455. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The tool required for leadership is magnanimity.' ,

hadiths.arabic: 2456. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن جادَ سادَ ، ومَن كَثُرَ مالُهُ رَأسَ
hadiths.english: 2456. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who is generous prevails and rules, whilst he who possesses great wealth assumes the reins of leadership for himself.'

hadiths.arabic: 2457. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : طَلَبتُ الرئاسَةَ فَوَجَدتُها في النَّصيحَةِ لِعِبادِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2457. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'I sought for leadership and found it in giving good counsel to Allah's servants [and being benevolent].'

hadiths.arabic: 2458. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - في قولِهِ تعالى‏ : (لَهُمُ الْبُشْرَى‏ فِى الْحَيَوةِ الدُّنْيَا ...) - : هي الرُّؤيا الحَسَنَةُ يَرَى المُؤمنُ فَيُبشَّرُ بها في دُنياهُ
hadiths.english: 2458. The Prophet (SAWA), with regard to Allah's verse in the Qur'an“for them are glad tidings in the life of this world” , said, 'This is in reference to the good dream which a believer has and which gives him good news in this world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2459. بحار الأنوار رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لم يَبقَ مِنَ النبوَّةِ إلّا المُبَشِّراتُ، قالوا : وما المُبَشِّراتُ؟ قال : الرؤيا الصالِحَةُ
hadiths.english: 2459. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'No remnants of prophecy remain today [in people's lives] except glad tidings.' When asked what glad tidings were, he replied, 'True dreams.'

hadiths.arabic: 2460. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : إنّ رسولَ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله كانَ إذا أصبَحَ قالَ لأصحابِهِ : هل مِن مُبَشِّراتٍ؟ يَعنِي بهِ الرُّؤيا
hadiths.english: 2460. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'When the Prophet (SAWA) used to wake up in the morning, he used to first ask his companions, 'Are there any good news?' meaning any good dreams.'

hadiths.arabic: 2461. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنّ العِبادَ إذا نامُوا خَرَجَت أرواحُهُم إلى السماءِ ، فما رَأتِ الرُّوحُ في السماءِ فهُوالحقُّ وما رَأت في الهواءِ فهُو الأضغاثُ
hadiths.english: 2461. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'When people sleep, their spirits go out into the heaven. Whatever the spirit sees while in the heaven is true, and whatever it sees in the air [between earth and the heavens] are just muddled dreams.'

hadiths.arabic: 2462. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الرؤيا على‏ ثلاثةِ وُجوهٍ : بِشارَةٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ للمُؤمنِ ، وتَحذيرٌ مِنَ الشيطانِ ، وأضغاثُ أحلامٍ
hadiths.english: 2462. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There are three types of dreams: glad tidings from Allah for the believer, ominous dreams from Satan, and muddled dreams.'

hadiths.arabic: 2463. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا رَأى‏ أحَدُكُم الرؤيا الحَسَنَةَ فَلْيُفَسِّرْها ولْيُخبِرْ بها ، وإذا رَأى الرؤيا القَبيحَةَ فلا يُفَسِّرْها ولا يُخبِرْ بها
hadiths.english: 2463. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When any of you sees a good dream, then go ahead and interpret it and inform others of it, and if you see a bad dream, then neither interpret it, nor inform others of it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2464. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الرؤيا لا تُقَصُّ إلّا على‏ مؤمنٍ خلا مِن الحَسَدِ والبَغيِ
hadiths.english: 2464. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A dream should only ever be related to a believer who does not harbour jealousy or wrongdoing.'

hadiths.arabic: 2465. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: ويلٌ للذينَ يَجتَلِبُونَ الدنيا بالدِّينِ ، يَلبَسُونَ للناسِ جُلودَ الضَّأنِ مِن لِينِ ألسِنَتِهِم ، كلامُهُم أحلى‏ مِن العَسَلِ وقُلوبُهُم قُلوبُ الذِئابِ ، يقولُ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ : أبي يَغتَرُّونَ ؟!
hadiths.english: 2465. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Woe betide those who trade their religion for the life of this world - in front of people they are soft-spoken and their words are sweeter than honey, but they are wolves in sheep's clothing , and Allah says regarding them, 'Are they too hopeful in me [while doing nothing]?'

hadiths.arabic: 2466. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ المَلَكَ لَيَصعَدُ بعَملِ العَبدِ مُبتَهِجاً بهِ ، فإذا صَعِدَ بحَسَناتِهِ يقولُ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ : اجعَلُوها في سِجِّينٍ إنّهُ لَيسَ إيّايَ أرادَ بِها
hadiths.english: 2466. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily the angel [charged with man's deeds] rises up with man's good deeds, delighted on account of them, but as he is lifting up his good deeds, Allah tells him, 'Go and place them in the Sijjin , as he did not perform these deeds for Me.'

hadiths.arabic: 2467. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ المُرائيَ يُنادى‏ يَومَ القِيامَةِ : يا فاجِرُ ! يا غادِرُ ! يا مُرائي ! ضَلَّ عَمَلُكَ ، وبَطَلَ أجرُكَ ، اذهَبْ فَخُذْ أجرَكَ مِمَّن كُنتَ تَعمَلُ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2467. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The show-off will be called on the Day of Resurrection: O shameless liar! O treacherous one! O show-off! Your deeds are lost, and the reward for your deeds is lost. Go and get your reward from those you intended to please by your actions.'

hadiths.arabic: 2468. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يقولُ اللَّهُ سبحانَهُ : إنّي أغنَى الشُّرَكاءِ فَمَن عَمِلَ عَمَلاً ثُمّ أشرَكَ فيهِ غَيرِي فأنا مِنهُ بَرِي‏ءٌ ، وهو لِلَّذِي أشرَكَ بهِ دُوني
hadiths.english: 2468. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Allah, glory be to Him, says, 'I am the most self-sufficient and richest of partners, for whoever performs a deed for Me as well as for someone else alongside Me, [know that] I am free from need of his action and I leave it for the one that he associated with Me.'

hadiths.arabic: 2469. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ اللَّهَ لا يَقبَلُ عَملاً فيهِ مِثقالُ ذَرَّةٍ مِن رياءٍ
hadiths.english: 2469. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah does not accept a deed that is performed with even an atom's weight of showing off in it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2470. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - حِينَ سَألَهُ رَجُلٌ : يا رسولَ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله ، فِيمَ النَّجاةُ ؟ - : أن لا يَعمَلَ العَبدُ بطاعَةِ اللَّهِ يُريدُ بها الناسَ
hadiths.english: 2470. The Prophet (SAWA) was once asked, 'Where does salvation lie?' to which he replied, 'In that the servant must not perform acts of obedience to Allah whilst intending them for other people [to see].'

hadiths.arabic: 2471. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما أقبَحَ بِالإنسانِ باطِناً عَليلاً وظاهِراً جَميلاً !
hadiths.english: 2471. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'How ugly the man who is sick inwardly and beautiful outwardly.'

hadiths.arabic: 2472. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اللّهُمّ إنّي أعوذُ بكَ مِن أن تَحسُنَ في لامِعَةِ العُيونِ عَلَانِيَتِي ، وتَقبُحَ فيما اُبطِنُ لكَ سَرِيرَتي ، مُحافِظاً على رئاءِ الناسِ مِن نَفسِي بجَميعِ ما أنتَ مُطَّلِعٌ علَيهِ مِنّي ، فَاُبدِيَ لِلناسِ حُسنَ ظاهري واُفضِيَ إليكَ بِسُوءِ عَمَلِي ، تَقَرُّباً إلى‏ عِبادِكَ وتَباعُداً مِن مَرضاتِكَ
hadiths.english: 2472. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'O Allah I seek refuge in You from looking good in the gleaming mirror of people's eyes whilst my inward self that I conceal [from others] be ugly in front of You, and from guarding myself [against sins] only for show in front of people whilst You know all there is to know about me, such that I may display my good side to people, leaving the bad deeds for You, in seeking nearness to mere servants of Yours and getting further and further away from Your good pleasure.'

hadiths.arabic: 2473. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : مَن كانَ ظاهِرُهُ أرجَحَ مِن باطِنِهِ خَفَّ مِيزانُهُ
hadiths.english: 2473. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'He whose outward appearance is superior to his inward self will have a very light scale of good deeds.'

hadiths.arabic: 2474. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إيّاك والرياءَ؛ فإنّهُ مَن عَمِلَ لِغَيرِ اللَّهِ وَكَلَهُ اللَّهُ إلى‏ مَن عَمِلَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2474. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Beware of showing off, for whoever performs good deeds for anyone other than Allah, Allah relegates him to the one he acted for.'

hadiths.arabic: 2475. عدّة الداعي عن رسول اللَّه صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ أخوَفَ ما أخافُ علَيكُمُ الشِّركَ الأصغرَ قالوا : وما الشِّركُ الأصغَرُ يا رسولَ اللَّهِ ؟ قالَ : الرياءُ
hadiths.english: 2475. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The worst thing I fear for you is minor polytheism.' When asked what he meant by this, he replied, 'Showing off.'

hadiths.arabic: 2476. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِعلَمُوا أنَّ يَسِيرَ الرياءِ شِركٌ
hadiths.english: 2476. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Know that even the slightest showing off is tantamount to polytheism.'

hadiths.arabic: 2477. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام: سُئلَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله عن تفسيرِ قَولِ اللَّهِ: (فَمَنْ كانَ يَرْجُو لِقاءَ رَبِّهِ فَلْيَعمَلْ عَمَلاً صَالِحاً وَلَا يُشْرِكْ بِعِبادَةِ رَبِّهِ أَحَداً) فقال : مَن صَلَّى مُراءاةَ الناسِ فهُو مُشرِكٌ ومَن عَمِلَ عَملاً مِمّا أمَرَ اللَّهُ بهِ مُراءاةَ الناسِ فهُو مُشرِكٌ
hadiths.english: 2477. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'The Prophet (SAWA) was once asked about the interpretation of Allah's words in the Qur'an:“So whoever expects to encounter his Lord, let him act righteously, and not associate anyone with the worship of Allah” He replied, 'He who performs prayer in order to show people is a polytheist and he who performs any act commanded by Allah to show people is a polytheist.'

sections.section_title_en: THE EVIL OUTCOME OF THOSE WHO SHOW OFF

hadiths.arabic: 2478. مستدرك الوسائل : قال رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ النارَ وأهلَها يَعِجُّونَ مِن أهلِ الرياءِ ، فقيلَ : يا رسولَ اللَّهِ ، وكيفَ تَعِجُّ النارُ ؟! قالَ : مِن حَرِّ النارِ التي يُعَذَّبُونَ بها
hadiths.english: 2478. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily the Hellfire and its inmates rage on account of those who used to show off.' When asked how the Hellfire rages, he replied, 'It rages on account of the intense heat with which they are being punished.'

hadiths.arabic: 2479. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : يُجاءُ بعَبدٍ يَومَ القِيامَةِ قد صَلّى‏ فيقولُ : يا ربِّ صَلَّيتُ ابتِغاءَ وَجهِكَ فيُقالُ لَهُ : بل صَلَّيتَ لِيُقالَ ما أحسَنَ صلاةَ (فلانٍ) ، اِذهَبُوا بِهِ إلى النارِ
hadiths.english: 2479. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'On the Day of Resurrection, a servant who used to pray regularly will be brought forth, and he will beg, 'O Lord, I prayed in seeking Your pleasure', and he will be told, 'No, you prayed so that people would say how beautiful your prayer was. Take him to the Fire.'

sections.section_title_en: THE DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS OF A SHOW OFF

hadiths.arabic: 2480. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ثلاثُ علاماتٍ لِلمُرائي : يَنشَطُ إذا رَأى الناسَ ، ويَكسَلُ إذا كانَ وَحدَهُ ، ويُحِبُّ أن يُحمَدَ في جَميعِ اُمُورِهِ
hadiths.english: 2480. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Three characteristics distinguish a show off: he is energetic and active whilst in the presence of people, he is lazy when he is by himself, and he loves to be praised for everything.'

hadiths.arabic: 2481. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : السِّرُّ أفضَلُ مِن العَلانِيَةِ، والعلانِيَةُ لِمَن أرادَ الاقتِداءَ
hadiths.english: 2481. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Performing actions in secret is better than performing them publicly, except for the one who wishes to set an example.'

hadiths.arabic: 2482. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام - لمّا سَألَهُ زرارةُ عن الرَّجُلِ يَعمَلُ الشي‏ءَ مِن الخَيرِ فَيَراهُ إنسانٌ فَيَسُرُّهُ ذلكَ - : لا بَأسَ ، ما مِن أحدٍ إلّا وهُو يُحِبُّ أن يَظهَرَ لَهُ في الناسِ الخَيرُ ، إذا لَم يَكُن صَنَعَ ذلكَ لذلكَ
hadiths.english: 2482. Imam al-Baqir (AS) was once asked by his companion Zurara, about a man who performs a good deed which people happen to see, and which he feels good about as a result. Imam replied, 'It does not matter as long as he did not [originally] perform the action for that purpose. Everyone naturally wants people to see them as good.'

hadiths.arabic: 2483. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن عَمِلَ حَسَنَةً سِرّاً كُتِبَت لَهُ سِرّاً ، فإذا أقَرَّ بها مُحِيَتْ وكُتِبَت جَهراً ، فإذا أقَرَّ بها ثانياً مُحِيَت وكُتِبَت رياءً
hadiths.english: 2483. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The deed of one who performs it in secret is recorded down as a secret action. If he admits to having performed it [when asked], the previous record is erased and it is recorded instead as a public action. If he subsequently avers it himself, however, the previous record is erased and it is recorded instead as showing off.'

sections.section_title_en: THAT WHICH RENDERS AN OPINION VALID

hadiths.arabic: 2484. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الرَّأيُ مع الأناةِ ، وبِئسَ الظَّهيرُ الرأيُ الفَطيرُ .
hadiths.english: 2484. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The [valid] opinion comes from balanced judgment, whilst the impetuous and rash opinion is a vile foundation indeed.'

hadiths.arabic: 2485. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِضرِبُوا بعضَ الرأيِ ببعضٍ يَتَوَلَّدْ مِنهُ الصَّوابُ
hadiths.english: 2485. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Use some opinions to attack other opinions and the valid one will emerge thereof.'

hadiths.arabic: 2486. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَنِ استَقبَلَ وُجوهَ الآراءِ عَرَفَ مَواقِعَ الخَطَأِ
hadiths.english: 2486. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who tackles all sides of an opinion [different opinions] will know where the pitfalls lie.'

hadiths.arabic: 2487. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ الناسِ رَأْياً مَن لا يَستَغنِي عن رَأيِ مُشِيرٍ
hadiths.english: 2487. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The man with the best opinion is he who does not write off the need for a second opinion from someone else.'

sections.section_title_en: THE CONSEQUENCES OF OBSTINATELY HOLDING ONE'S OWN OPINION

hadiths.arabic: 2488. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَنِ استَبَدَّ برأيِهِ هَلَكَ ، ومَن شاوَرَ الرِّجالَ شارَكَها في عُقُولِها
hadiths.english: 2488. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who obstinately holds his own opinion is ruined, and he who consults other people shares in their collective understanding.'

hadiths.arabic: 2489. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما اُعجِبَ برأيِهِ إلّا جاهِلٌ
hadiths.english: 2489. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Only an ignorant person is proud of his own opinion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2490. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : المُستَبِدُّ برأيِهِ مَوقوفٌ على‏ مَداحِضِ الزَّلَلِ
hadiths.english: 2490. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The one who adamantly holds his own opinion has based it on a shaky and erroneous argument.'

hadiths.arabic: 2491. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اللَّجاجةُ تَسُلُّ الرأيَ.
hadiths.english: 2491. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Stubbornly insisting upon one's opinion destroys it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2492. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لَيسَ لِحاقِنٍ رأيٌ.
hadiths.english: 2492. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'A recluse does not have any opinions.'

sections.section_title_en: THE GOVERNMENT AND THE VALIDITY OF ITS OPINION

hadiths.arabic: 2493. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : صَوابُ الرَّأيِ بالدُّوَلِ ، يُقبِلُ بِإقبالِها ويَذهَبُ بذَهابِها
hadiths.english: 2493. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The validity of the opinion of the day changes with governments - when a new government arrives on the scene, so does its opinion [and is accepted as being valid], and when it goes, so does that opinion.'

sections.section_title_en: ACTING ON ONE'S OPINION IN RELIGIOUS MATTERS

hadiths.arabic: 2494. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : تَعمَلُ هذهِ الاُمّةُ بُرهَةً مِن كتابِ اللَّهِ ، ثُمّ تَعمَلُ بُرهةً بِسُنَّةِ رسولِ اللَّهِ ، ثُمّ تَعمَلُ بالرأيِ ، فإذا عَمِلُوا بالرأيِ فقد ضَلُّوا وأضَلُّوا
hadiths.english: 2494. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'This community acts upon the Book of Allah for a little while, then it acts upon the practice of the Prophet of Allah for a little while, then it acts upon its own opinion. And when they act based on their own opinion, they themselves go astray and lead others astray too.'

hadiths.arabic: 2495. كنز العمّال : قالَ الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ثلاثةٌ لا يُقبَلُ مَعهُنَّ عَمَلٌ : الشِّركُ ، والكُفرُ ، والرأيُ قالوا : يا أميرَ المؤمنينَ : ما الرَّأْيُ ؟ قالَ : تَدَعُ كتابَ اللَّهِ وسُنَّةَ رسولِهِ وتَعمَلُ بالرَّأيِ
hadiths.english: 2495. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Action is unacceptable when based on any of three things: polytheism, infidelity and one's own opinion. When asked what action based on an opinion meant, he replied, 'It is when you leave the Book of Allah and the practice of His Prophet and act upon your own opinion.'

sections.section_title_en: SINCERE EFFORT REQUIRED IN FORMULATING ONE'S OPINION

hadiths.arabic: 2496. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ الواليَ إذا اجتَهَدَ فَأصابَ الحَقَّ فلَهُ أجرانِ ، وإنِ اجتَهَدَ فَأخطَأَ الحقَّ فلَهُ أجرٌ واحِدٌ
hadiths.english: 2496. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If a governor, sincerely exerts himself when formulating his opinion [on a legal edict], if his ruling is correct, he is rewarded doubly for it, and if in his ruling he is mistaken, he is still rewarded for his effort.'

hadiths.arabic: 2497. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَنِ اجتَهَدَ رَأيَهُ في نَصيحَةِ العامَّةِ فلَهُ ما نَوى‏ ، وقد قَضى‏ ما علَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2497. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'When someone who is in a position to advise people sincerely exerts himself when formulating his opinion, he is rewarded according to his intention, and has done his duty.

hadiths.arabic: 2498. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ اللَّهَ عزّوجلّ لَعَنَ آكِلَ الرِّبا ومُوكِلَهُ وكاتِبَهُ وشاهِدَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2498. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah, Mighty and Exalted, curses the usurer, his agent, his scribe and his two witnesses.'

hadiths.arabic: 2499. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أتَيتُ ليلةَ اُسرِيَ بِي على‏ قَومٍ بُطونُهُم كالبيوتِ فيها الحَيّاتُ تُرى‏ مِن خارجِ بُطونِهِم ، فقلتُ : مَن هؤلاءِ يا جَبرئيلُ ؟ قالَ : هؤلاءِ أكَلَةُ الرِّبا
hadiths.english: 2499. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'During my Night-Journey up to the heavens, I was taken to a people whose bellies were as large as houses and contained serpents that could be seen from outside their bellies. I asked, 'Who are these people, O Gabriel?' He replied, 'They are the usurers.'

hadiths.arabic: 2500. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : أخبَثُ المَكاسِبِ ، كَسبُ الرِّبا
hadiths.english: 2500. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'The most despicable of professions [or profits] is the earning from usury.'

hadiths.arabic: 2501. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : آكِلُ الرِّبا لا يَخرُجُ مِنَ الدنيا حتّى‏ يَتَخَبَّطَهُ الشيطانُ
hadiths.english: 2501. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The usurer only leaves this world after Satan makes him insane.'

hadiths.arabic: 2502. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : دِرهَمُ ربا أعظَمُ عِندَ اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ مِن سَبعينَ زَنيةً كلّها بِذاتِ مَحرمٍ في بيتِ اللَّهِ الحرامِ
hadiths.english: 2502. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'A dirham earned by usury is worse in the sight of Allah than seventy counts of incest in the Holy Sanctuary of Allah.'

sections.section_title_en: The Wisdom Behind the Prohibition OF USURY

hadiths.arabic: 2503. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سَألَهُ هِشامُ بنُ الحَكَمِ عن عِلَّةِ تَحريمِ الرِّبا - : إنّهُ لَو كانَ الرِّبا حلالاً لَتَرَكَ الناسُ التِّجاراتِ وما يَحتاجونَ إلَيهِ فحَرَّمَ اللَّهُ الرِّبا لتَفِرَّ الناسُ عنِ الحرامِ إلى التِّجاراتِ وإلى البَيعِ والشِّراءِ فَيَتَّصِلَ ذلكَ بَينَهُم في القَرضِ
hadiths.english: 2503. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), when asked by Hisham b. al-Hakam about the reason behind the prohibition of usury, replied, 'Were usury to be permissible, people would abandon their trading and other necessities, so Allah prohibited usury in order that man may flee from the unlawful [means of earning] to trade, and resort to buying and selling, and this in turn facilitates borrowing from each other.'

hadiths.arabic: 2504. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمَّا سُئلَ عن عِلَّةِ تحريمِ الرِّبا - : لئلّا يَتَمانَعَ الناسُ المَعروفَ
hadiths.english: 2504. When Imam al-Sadiq (AS) was asked the reason behind the prohibition of usury, he replied, 'So that people may not withhold common courtesy from each other.'

sections.section_title_en: That Which Leads One to Become INVOLVED IN USURY

hadiths.arabic: 2505. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَعاشِرَ الناسِ ، الفِقهَ ثُمَّ المَتجَرَ ، واللَّهِ لَلرِّبا في هذِهِ الاُمَّةِ أخفى‏ من دَبِيبِ النَّملِ عَلى الصَّفا
hadiths.english: 2505. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Engage yourself firstly in communal relations with people, then the law, and subsequently trading, for by Allah, usury creeps into this community more discreetly than an ant creeps onto a rock.'

hadiths.arabic: 2506. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَنِ اتَّجَرَ بغَيرِ فِقهٍ فَقَدِ ارتَطَمَ في الرِّبا
hadiths.english: 2506. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever trades without knowledge of legal rulings gets involved in usury.'

sections.section_title_en: THE USURER WHO JUSTIFIES HIMSELF MUST BE FOUGHT

hadiths.arabic: 2507. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا بلَغهُ أنّ رَجلاً كانَ يَأكُلُ الرِّبا ويُسَمِّيهِ اللِّباءَ - : لئن أمكَنَنِي اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ (مِنهُ) لَأضرِبَنَّ عُنُقَهُ
hadiths.english: 2507. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) was once informed of a man who was extorting usury and calling it liba' instead of riba (usury) to justify his actions, with regards to whom Imam said, 'If Allah gave me the power to, I would have him beheaded.'

hadiths.arabic: 2508. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كلُّ راجٍ طالِبٌ وكُلُّ خائفٍ هارِبٌ
hadiths.english: 2508. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Every hopeful person continues seeking, and every fearful one runs away.'

hadiths.arabic: 2509. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - لِرَجُلٍ سَألَهُ أن يَعِظَهُ - : لا تَكُن مِمَّن يَرجُو الآخِرَةَ بغَيرِ العَمَلِ ويُرَجِّي التَّوبَةَ بطُولِ الأمَلِ ، يَقولُ في الدنيا بقَولِ الزاهِدِينَ ويَعمَلُ فيها بعَمَلِ الراغِبينَ
hadiths.english: 2509. Imam Ali (AS) said to a man soliciting advice from him, 'Do not be of those who hope for [bliss in] the life of the Hereafter without action, and delay repentance by having high expectations, and who utter words like the ascetics with regard to this world, though in practice they behave like those who covet it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2510. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عن قَومٍ يَعمَلُونَ بالمَعاصِي ويَقولونَ : نَرجُو ، فلا يَزالُونَ كذلكَ حتّى‏ يَأتِيَهُمُ الموتُ ؟ - : هؤلاءِ قَومٌ يَتَرَجَّحُونَ في الأمانِيِّ كَذَبوا لَيسُوا بِراجِينَ ، إنّ مَن رَجا شَيئاً طَلَبَهُ ومَن خافَ مِن شي‏ءٍ هَربَ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 2510. Someone came to Imam al-Sadiq (AS) and told him that there was a group of people who were disobeying Allah, but at the same time they were saying that they hoped [in His mercy], and remained thus until death overtook them. Imam (AS) said, 'These are people who swing back and forth between their desires. They are lying and are not really hopeful, for the one who hopes for something seeks it, and the one who fears something flees from it.'

sections.section_title_en: Caution Against Placing One's Hopes IN ANYONE OTHER THAN ALLAH

hadiths.arabic: 2511. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِجعَلُوا كُلَّ رجائكُم للَّهِ‏ِ سبحانَهُ ولا تَرجُوا أحَداً سِواهُ ، فإنّهُ ما رَجا أحَدٌ غَيرَ اللَّهِ تعالى‏ إلّا خابَ
hadiths.english: 2511. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Place all your hope in Allah, glory be to Him, and do not hope from anyone else apart from Him, for no sooner does anyone place his hope in anyone other than Allah than he fails.'

hadiths.arabic: 2512. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : واللَّهِ لا تَذهَبُ الأيّامُ واللّيالي حتّى‏ يُحيِيَ اللَّهُ المَوتى‏ ويُمِيتَ الأحياءَ ، ويَرُدَّ الحَقَّ إلى أهلِهِ ، ويُقِيمَ دينَهُ الذي ارتَضاهُ لِنَفسِهِ
hadiths.english: 2512. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'By Allah, the days and the nights will not come to an end before Allah revives the dead and causes the living to die, and returns rights to those they are due to, and establishes the religion that He has selected for Himself.'

sections.section_title_en: THE MENTION OF SPECIFIC PEOPLE TO BE RETURNED

hadiths.arabic: 2513. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : أكُونُ أوَّلَ مَن يَنشَقُّ الأرضُ عَنهُ ، فَأخرُجُ خَرجَةً يُوافِقُ ذلكَ خَرجَةَ أميرِالمؤمنينَ وقيامَ قائِمِنا
hadiths.english: 2513. Imam al-Husain (AS) said, 'I will be the first to appear at the time of the splitting of the earth. I will come out at the same time of the returning of the Commander of the faithful (AS) and the rising of our Qa?im.'

hadiths.arabic: 2514. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أوَّلُ مَن يَرجِعُ إلى الدنيا ، الحسينُ ابنُ عليٍّ عليه السلام فيُمَلَّكُ حتّى‏ يَسقُطَ حاجِباهُ على‏ عَينَيهِ مِن الكِبَرِ
hadiths.english: 2514. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The first person to return to the life of this world will be Husayn b. Ali (AS), who will be made to rule until his eyebrows will protrude over his eyes as a result of his old age.'

sections.section_title_en: The Return Will Not Be Universal

hadiths.arabic: 2515. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ الرَّجعَةَ لَيست بعامَّةٍ ، وهِي خاصّةٌ لا يَرجِعُ إلّا مَن مَحَضَ الإيمانَ مَحضاً أو مَحَضَ الشِّركَ مَحضاً
hadiths.english: 2515. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily the Return will not be for everyone, but specific. Only those of absolutely pure faith or pure evil [polytheism] will be brought back to life.'

sections.section_title_en: THE ENJOINMENT OF COMPASSION TOWARDS ONE ANOTHER

hadiths.arabic: 2516. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الراحِمونَ يَرحَمُهُم الرّحمنُ تباركَ وتعالى‏ ، اِرحَمُوا مَن في الأرضِ يَرحَمْكُم مَن في السماءِ
hadiths.english: 2516. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The All-Merciful, Blessed and most High, has mercy on those who are merciful (towards others). Have mercy on the dwellers of the earth and the [Lord of the] Heavens will have mercy on you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2517. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يُنادِي مُنادٍ في النارِ : يا حَنّانُ يا مَنّانُ نَجِّني مِنَ النارِ ، فَيَأْمُرُ اللَّهُ مَلَكاً فَيُخرِجُهُ حتّى‏ يَقِفَ بينَ يَدَيهِ ، فيقولُ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ : هل رَحِمتَ عُصفوراً
hadiths.english: 2517. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'One of the inmates of the Fire will call out: O Affectionate One, O Liberal Giver, save me from the Fire. So Allah will command one of His angels to take him out that he may come and stand before Him, and Allah will ask him, 'Were you ever compassionate towards a sparrow?'

hadiths.arabic: 2518. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إرحَمْ تُرحَمْ
hadiths.english: 2518. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Have mercy and you will be had mercy upon.'

hadiths.arabic: 2519. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : عَجِبتُ لِمَن يَرجُو رَحمَةَ مَن فَوقَهُ كيفَ لا يَرحَمُ مَن دُونَهُ؟!
hadiths.english: 2519. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'How I wonder at the one who hopes for the mercy of the One above him and yet himself does not have mercy on the one below him.'

sections.section_title_en: THOSE THAT ARE MOST DESERVING OF COMPASSION

hadiths.arabic: 2520. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اِرحَمُوا عَزيزاً ذَلَّ ، وغَنِيّاً افتَقَرَ ، وعالِماً ضاعَ في زمانِ جُهّالٍ
hadiths.english: 2520. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Be compassionate towards a mighty person who has been dishonoured, a rich man who has become poor, and a scholar who has been forgotten amidst a generation of ignorant people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2521. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اِرحَمِ المَساكينَ
hadiths.english: 2521. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Be compassionate towards the destitute.'

hadiths.arabic: 2522. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِرحَمْ مِن أهلِكَ الصَّغيرَ ووَقِّرْ مِنهُمُ الكَبيرَ
hadiths.english: 2522. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Show compassion to the young in your family and reverence to the old.'

hadiths.arabic: 2523. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ خَلَقَ مِائةَ رَحمَةٍ يَومَ خَلَقَ السماواتِ والأرضَ ، كُلُّ رحمةٍ مِنها طِباقُ ما بينَ السماءِ والأرضِ ، فَأهبَطَ رَحمَةً مِنها إلى الأرضِ فَبِها تَراحَمَ الخَلقُ ، وبها تَعطِفُ الوالِدَةُ على‏ وَلَدِها ، وبها تَشرَبُ الطيرُ والوُحوشُ مِن الماءِ ، وبها تَعِيشُ الخلائقُ
hadiths.english: 2523. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah, most High, created one hundred units of mercy on the day He created the heavens and the earth, each unit of which corresponds to all that is between the sky and the earth. of these He descended one unit of mercy to the earth, and by virtue of that one unit, everything in creation shows understanding for one another, the mother is affectionate towards her child, and by virtue of the same unit, the birds and the beasts are able to drink water, and all creatures are able to subsist.'

hadiths.arabic: 2524. كنز العمّال عن رسولِ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَن يَدخُلَ الجَنَّةَ أحَدٌ إلّا بِرحمَةِ اللَّهِ قالوا : ولا أنتَ؟ قالَ : ولا أنا إلّا أن يَتَغَمَّدَنِيَ اللَّهُ
hadiths.english: 2524. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'No one shall enter Paradise except by intervention of Allah's divine mercy.' His companions asked, 'Not even you?' to which he replied, 'Not even me, unless Allah encompasses me with His mercy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2525. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَو تَعلَمُونَ قَدْرَ رحمَةِ اللَّهِ تعالى‏ لَاتَّكَلتُمْ علَيها
hadiths.english: 2525. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If you knew the worth of Allah's mercy, you would rely solely on that.'

hadiths.arabic: 2526. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : لَيسَ العَجَبُ مِمَّن نَجا كيفَ نَجا ، وأمّا العَجَبُ مِمَّنْ هَلَكَ كَيفَ هَلَكَ مَع سَعَةِ رحمةِ اللَّهِ ؟!
hadiths.english: 2526. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'It is no small wonder if man is given salvation [on the Day of Resurrection], rather what is a wonder is how he manages to end up in eternal damnation in spite of Allah's all-encompassing mercy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2527. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : تَعَرَّضُوا لِرَحمَةِ اللَّهِ بما أمَرَكُم بهِ مِن طاعَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 2527. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Elicit Allah's mercy through the performance of the acts of obedience that He has commanded you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2528. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : بِذِكرِ اللَّهِ تُستَنزَلُ الرحمَةُ
hadiths.english: 2528. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Allah's remembrance elicits the descent of His mercy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2529. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : بِبَذلِ الرحمَةِ تُستَنزَلُ الرحمَةُ
hadiths.english: 2529. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Spreading mercy [to others] elicits the descent of Allah's mercy.'

hadiths.arabic: 2530. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ أعجَلَ الخَيرِ ثَواباً صِلةُ الرَّحِمِ
hadiths.english: 2530. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily the good deed to be rewarded the fastest is reconciliation with one's kin.'

hadiths.arabic: 2531. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : سِرْ سَنَةً صِلْ رَحِمَكَ
hadiths.english: 2531. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If you want to be happy the whole year, reconcile with your kin.'

sections.section_title_en: THE BENEFITS OF MAINTAING RELATIONS WITH ONE'S KIN

hadiths.arabic: 2532. فاطمةُ الزَّهراءُ عليها السلام : فَرَضَ اللَّهُ صِلَةَ الأرحامِ مَنماةً لِلعدَدِ
hadiths.english: 2532. Fatima al-Zahra (AS) said, 'Allah made the maintenance of relations with one's kin obligatory in order to maintain growth in population.'

hadiths.arabic: 2533. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : مَن سَرَّهُ أن يُنسَأ في أجَلِهِ ، ويُزادَ في رِزقِهِ ، فَلْيَصِلْ رَحِمَهُ
hadiths.english: 2533. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, 'Whoever would like an increase in his lifespan and in his sustenance should maintain relations with his kin.'

hadiths.arabic: 2534. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : صِلَةُ الأرحامِ تُزَكِّي الأعمالَ وتُنْمِي الأموالَ ، وتَدفَعُ البَلوى‏ ، وتُيَسِّرُ الحِسابَ وتُنسِئُ في الأجَلِ
hadiths.english: 2534. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Maintaining relations with one's kin purifies one's actions, brings about an increase in wealth, repels misfortunes, eases the account [on the Day of Resurrection], and delays one's appointed time of death .'

hadiths.arabic: 2535. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : صلةُ الأرحامِ تُحَسِّنُ الخُلُقَ وتُسَمِّحُ الكَفَّ وتُطَيِّبُ النَّفْسَ ، وتَزِيدُ في الرّزقِ وتُنسِئُ في الأجَلِ
hadiths.english: 2535. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Maintaining relations with one's kin improves one's character, brings about open-handedness and cheerfulness, increases in one's sustenance, and delays one's appointed time of death.'

hadiths.arabic: 2536. الإمامُ الهاديُّ عليه السلام : لَمّا كَلَّمَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ موسى ابنَ عِمرانَ عليه السلام قالَ موسى‏ : إلهي ما جَزاءُ مَن وَصَلَ رَحِمَهُ ؟ قالَ: يا موسى‏، أنسَأُ لَهُ أجَلَهُ، واُهَوِّنُ علَيهِ سَكَراتِ المَوتِ
hadiths.english: 2536. Imam al-Hadi (AS) said, 'When Allah allowed [Prophet] Moses son of Amran (AS) to converse with Him, Moses (AS) asked, 'My God, what is the reward of one who maintains relations with his kin?' He replied, 'O Moses, I delay the appointed time of his death, and ease the pangs and agonies of death for him.'

sections.section_title_en: RECONCILING WITH ONE WHO CUTS YOU OFF

hadiths.arabic: 2537. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تَقطَعْ رَحِمَكَ وإن قَطَعَتكَ
hadiths.english: 2537. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not cut off your kin even if they cut you off.'

hadiths.arabic: 2538. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : إنّ أوصَلَ الناسِ مَن وَصَلَ مَن قَطَعَهُ
hadiths.english: 2538. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, 'The best reconciler is he who reconciles with one who cut him off.'

sections.section_title_en: Caution Against Cutting Ties WITH ONE'S KIN

hadiths.arabic: 2539. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ الملائكةَ لا تَنزِلُ على‏ قَومٍ فيهِم قاطِعُ رَحِمٍ
hadiths.english: 2539. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily the angels do not go to [visit] a people if among them lives one who has cut ties with his kin.'

hadiths.arabic: 2540. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا قَطَعُوا الأرحامَ جُعِلَتِ الأموالُ في أيدِي الأشرارِ
hadiths.english: 2540. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'If they cut off ties with their kin, their wealth will be placed at the disposal of evil people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2541. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الذُّنوبُ التي تُعَجِّلُ الفَناءَ قَطيعَةُ الرَّحِمِ
hadiths.english: 2541. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The sin that hastens one's death is cutting off ties with one's kin.'

sections.section_title_en: The Least One Can Do To MAINTAIN RELATIONS WITH ONE'S KIN

hadiths.arabic: 2542. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : صِلُوا أرحامَكُم ولو بِالسَّلامِ
hadiths.english: 2542. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Maintain relations with your kin even if it be with a mere greeting (salam).'

hadiths.arabic: 2543. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : صِلْ رَحِمَكَ ولو بِشَربَةٍ مِن ماءٍ، وأفضَلُ ما تُوصَلُ بهِ الرَّحِمُ كَفُّ الأذى‏ عَنها
hadiths.english: 2543. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Maintain relations with your kin even if it be by offering them a drink of water. The best way to maintain relations is to refrain from hurting them in any way.'

hadiths.arabic: 2544. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا يَملِكُ إمساكَ الأرزاقِ وإدرارَها إلّا الرَّزَّاقُ
hadiths.english: 2544. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'No one has the power to withhold or bestow sustenance except the All-Sustainer.'

hadiths.arabic: 2545. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : وقَدَّرَ الأرزاقَ فَكَثَّرَها وقَلَّلَها ، وقَسَّمَها على الضِّيقِ والسَّعَةِ ، فَعَدَلَ فيها لِيَبتَلِيَ مَن أرادَ ، بِمَيسورِها ومَعسورِها ، ولِيَختَبِرَ بذلكَ الشُّكرَ والصَّبرَ مِن غَنِيِّها وفَقيرِها
hadiths.english: 2545. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He apportions sustenance, abundantly and sparingly, and He distributes them to those in need as well as to those who prosper, and He is Just in His allotment in order that he may test whomever He wishes with prosperity or with hardship, and that He may test therewith the gratefulness and perseverance expressed by both rich and poor.'

hadiths.arabic: 2546. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تَتَشاغَلْ عمّا فُرِضَ علَيكَ بِما قد ضُمِنَ لَكَ فإنّهُ لَيسَ بفائتِكَ ما قد قُسِّمَ لَكَ ، ولَستَ بِلاحِقٍ ما قد زُوِيَ عنكَ
hadiths.english: 2546. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not preoccupy yourself away from the duties incumbent upon you in your bid to secure that which is guaranteed to you, for indeed neither will you miss out on that which has been apportioned for you, nor will you attain that which has been placed beyond your reach.'

hadiths.arabic: 2547. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لِكُلِّ ذِي رَمَقٍ قُوتٌ
hadiths.english: 2547. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Every living thing has been given its own provision.'

hadiths.arabic: 2548. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فهذا غُرابٌ وهذا عُقابٌ ، وهذا حَمامٌ وهذا نَعامٌ ، دَعا كُلَّ طائرٍ باسمِهِ ، وكَفَلَ لَهُ برزقِهِ
hadiths.english: 2548. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'This is a crow and this is an eagle, this one a dove and this one an ostrich - He has given each bird an individual name and has guaranteed each one its sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2549. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : عِيالُهُ الخَلائقُ ، ضَمِنَ أَرزاقَهُم، وقَدَّرَ أَقْواتَهُم
hadiths.english: 2549. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'His creatures are His dependants, for whom He has guaranteed the means of subsistence, and apportioned provisions.'

hadiths.arabic: 2550. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اُطلُبُوا الرِّزقَ فإنّهُ مَضمونٌ لِطالِبِهِ
hadiths.english: 2550. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Go out and seek your livelihood for it is guaranteed to the one who goes in search of it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2551. الإمامُ العسكريُّ عليه السلام : لا يَشغَلْكَ رِزقٌ مَضمونٌ عن عَمَلٍ مَفروضٍ
hadiths.english: 2551. Imam al-Askari (AS) said, 'Do not let [preoccupation with] a sustenance that is guaranteed avert you from an act that is incumbent.'

hadiths.arabic: 2552. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ الرِّزقَ لا يَجُرُّهُ حِرصُ حَريصٍ ولا يَصرِفُهُ كَراهِيَةُ كارِهٍ
hadiths.english: 2552. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Sustenance cannot be pulled by the greed of an avaricious person nor repelled by the repugnance of a repugnant person.'

hadiths.arabic: 2553. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِعلَمُوا أنَّ عَبداً وإن ضَعُفَتْ حِيلَتُهُ ، ووَهَنَتْ مَكِيدَتُهُ أنَّهُ لَن يُنقَصَ مِمّا قَدَّرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ ، وإن قَوِيَ عَبدٌ في شِدَّةِ الحِيلَةِ وقُوَّةِ المَكِيدَة أ نّهُ لن يُزادَ عَلى‏ ما قَدَّرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2553. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Know that even if a servant was devoid of shrewdness and was feeble in his schemes, it would not reduce the amount of sustenance that Allah has apportioned for him, and even if a servant were to be skilfully shrewd and crafty, it would not do anything to increase the sustenance that Allah has apportioned for him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2554. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إن كانَ الرِّزقُ مَقسوماً فالحِرصُ لِماذا ؟!
hadiths.english: 2554. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Since sustenance is duly allotted, what is the use of greed?!'

hadiths.arabic: 2555. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ وَسَّعَ أرزاقَ الحَمقى‏ لِيَعتَبِرَ العُقَلاءُ ويَعلَمُوا أنّ الدنيا ليسَ يُنالُ ما فيها بِعَمَلٍ ولا حِيلَةٍ
hadiths.english: 2555. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily Allah, most High, has abundantly distributed sustenance even to the fools, so that intelligent men may take a lesson from this and know that the wealth of this world cannot be obtained by work or cunning.'

sections.section_title_ar: الحَثُّ عَلَى الإجمالِ في طَلَبِ الرِّزقِ‏
sections.section_title_en: Enjoinment of Seeking One's LIVELIHOOD THROUGH DECENT MEANS

hadiths.arabic: 2556. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ألا وإنّ الرُّوحَ الأمينَ نَفَثَ في رُوعِي أ نّهُ لَن تَمُوتَ نفسٌ حتّى‏ تَستَكمِلَ رِزقَها ، فاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وأجمِلُوا في الطَّلَبِ ، ولا يَحمِلْ أحَدَكُم استِبطاءُ شَي‏ءٍ مِنَ الرِّزقِ أن يَطلُبَهُ بغَيرِ حِلِّهِ ، فإنّهُ لا يُدرَكُ ما عِندَ اللَّهِ إلّا بطاعَتِهِ .
hadiths.english: 2556. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily the archangel Gabriel blew into my mind that no soul shall pass away before the depletion of his sustenance in this world, so be wary of your duty to Allah and seek your livelihood through decent means, and let not a delay in your provision cause any of you to seek it through unlawful means, for verily what is with Allah is only acquired through His obedience.'

hadiths.arabic: 2557. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : خُذْ مِن الدنيا ما أتاكَ وتَوَلَّ عمّا تَوَلّى‏ عنك ، فإن أنتَ لَم تَفعَلْ فَأجمِلْ في الطَّلَبِ
hadiths.english: 2557. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Take from [the wealth of] this world that which comes to you, and avoid that which evades you, and if you cannot do this, then at least seek your livelihood through decent means.'

hadiths.arabic: 2558. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لِيَكُن طَلَبُكَ المَعيشَةَ فَوقَ كَسبِ المُضَيِّعِ ، دُونَ طَلَبِ الحَريصِ الراضِي بالدنيا المُطمَئنِّ إلَيها ، ولكنْ أنزِلْ نفسَكَ مِن ذلكَ بمَنزِلَةِ المُنصِفِ المُتَعَفِّفِ تَرفَعُ نفسَكَ عن مَنزِلَةِ الواهِي الضَّعيفِ وتَكتَسِبُ ما لابُدَّ للمُؤمنِ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 2558. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Your quest to secure your means of subsistence should be such that it is neither like the earning of a wasteful squanderer, and nor like the greedy man who loves and depends on this world. Rather, you must raise yourself from the level of weakness and incapacity, and bring yourself down [from the level of greed] to the level of an equitable and virtuous man, and seek your earning the way a believer should.'

hadiths.arabic: 2559. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَو أنَّ ابنَ آدَمَ فَرَّ مِن رِزقِهِ كما يَفِرُّ مِنَ المَوتِ لَأَدرَكَهُ كما يُدرِكُهُ المَوتُ
hadiths.english: 2559. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If man was to flee from his sustenance as he flees from death, it would find him just as death finds him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2560. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الرِّزقُ يَطلُبُ مَن لا يَطلُبُهُ
hadiths.english: 2560. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Sustenance runs after the one who does not run after it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2561. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنَّ الرِّزقَ رِزقانِ : رِزقٌ تَطلُبُهُ ، ورِزقٌ يَطلُبُكَ ، فإن أنتَ لَم تَأتِهِ أتاكَ
hadiths.english: 2561. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'There are two types of sustenance: the sustenance that you seek out, and the sustenance that seeks you out, which even if you do not pursue it, it pursues you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2562. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ اللَّهَ عزّوجلّ جَعَلَ أرزاقَ المؤمنينَ مِن حيثُ لا يَحتَسِبُونَ ، وذلكَ أنَّ العَبدَ إذا لَم يَعرِفْ وَجهَ رِزقِهِ كَثُرَ دُعاؤهُ
hadiths.english: 2562. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily Allah, Mighty and Exalted, has placed the believers' livelihoods whence they do not anticipate it to come, and that is because when the servant does not know the location of his livelihood, his supplication for it increases.

hadiths.arabic: 2563. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تَهتَمَّ لِرِزقِ غَدٍ فإنّ كُلَّ غَدٍ يَأتِي بِرِزقِهِ
hadiths.english: 2563. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not worry about tomorrow's sustenance for every morrow brings its own sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2564. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَنِ اهتَمَّ لِرِزقِهِ كُتِبَ علَيهِ خَطِيئَةٌ
hadiths.english: 2564. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'He who worries about his sustenance is recorded as having sinned.'

sections.section_title_en: Impatience With Regards to One's Sustenance

hadiths.arabic: 2565. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يقولُ اللَّهُ سبحانَهُ وتعالى‏ : لِيَحذَرْ عَبدِي الذي يَستَبطِئُ رزقِي أن أغضَبَ فَأفتَحَ علَيهِ باباً مِن الدنيا !
hadiths.english: 2565. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Allah, Glorified and most High, says,“Let my servant be warned that if he is impatient with regard to My sustenance, then I will get angry and open to him a door of this world [and its temptations]” .'

hadiths.arabic: 2566. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أنعَمَ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ علَيهِ نِعمَةً فَليَحمَدِ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ ، ومَنِ استَبطَأ (علَيهِ) الرِّزقَ فَليَستَغفِرِ اللَّهَ
hadiths.english: 2566. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever Allah bestows His bounties upon must praise Allah, and whoever is impatient with regards to his sustenance must seek Allah's forgiveness.'

hadiths.arabic: 2567. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن استَبطَأ الرِّزقَ فَليُكثِرْ مِن التَّكبيرِ ، ومَن كَثُرَهَمُّهُ وغَمُّهُ فَليُكثِرْ مِن الاستِغفارِ
hadiths.english: 2567. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He who is impatient with regards to his sustenance must increase his proclamation of Allah's greatness , and he who worries and frets much [about his livelihood] must increase his seeking of forgiveness.'

sections.section_title_en: Factors that Elicit the Descent of SUSTENANCE AND INCREASE IT

hadiths.arabic: 2568. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الرِّزقُ أسرَعُ إلى‏ مَن يُطعِمُ الطَّعامَ ، مِن السِّكِّينِ في السَّنامِ
hadiths.english: 2568. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Sustenance comes to those who feed others faster than a knife can cut through flesh.'

hadiths.arabic: 2569. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - لمّا قيلَ لَهُ : اُحِبُّ أن يُوَسَّعَ عَلَيَّ في الرِّزقِ ؟ - : دُمْ على الطَّهارَةِ يُوَسَّعْ علَيكَ في الرِّزقِ
hadiths.english: 2569. The Prophet (SAWA) was once asked how one could bring about an increase in one's sustenance, to which he replied, 'Always remain in the state of purity (tahara) and your sustenance will be plentiful.'

hadiths.arabic: 2570. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أكثِرُوا مِن الصَّدَقَةِ تُرزَقُوا
hadiths.english: 2570. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Increase your charity and you will be provided more.'

hadiths.arabic: 2571. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مُواساةُ الأخِ في اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ تَزِيدُ في الرِّزقِ
hadiths.english: 2571. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Helping out one's brother in faith from one's own wealth, for the sake of Allah, increases sustenance.

hadiths.arabic: 2572. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : استِعمالُ الأمانَةِ يَزِيدُ في الرِّزقِ
hadiths.english: 2572. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Acting with integrity increases one's sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2573. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : استَنزِلُوا الرِّزقَ بالصَّدقَةِ
hadiths.english: 2573. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Attract sustenance by giving in charity.'

hadiths.arabic: 2574. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن حَسُنَتْ نِيّتُهُ ، زِيدَ في رِزقِهِ
hadiths.english: 2574. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who is sincere in his intention receives an increase in sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2575. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : علَيكَ بالدعاءِ لإخوانِكَ بظَهْرِ الغَيبِ فإنّهُ يَهِيلُ الرِّزقَ
hadiths.english: 2575. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'You must pray fervently for your brothers [in faith] in secret, and sustenance will pour down on you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2576. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : الزَّكاةُ تَزِيدُ في الرِّزقِ
hadiths.english: 2576. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Paying the alms-tax (zakat) leads to an increase in one's sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2577. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن حَسَّنَ بِرَّهُ أهلَ بَيتِهِ زِيدَ في رِزقِهِ
hadiths.english: 2577. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Whoever is especially kind to his family is increased in sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2578. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ البِرَّ يَزِيدُ في الرِّزقِ
hadiths.english: 2578. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily kindness leads to an increase in sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2579. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : حُسنُ الخُلُقِ يَزِيدُ في الرِّزقِ.
hadiths.english: 2579. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Being good-natured increases in one's sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2580. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن حَبَسَ عن أخيهِ المسلمِ شيئاً مِن حَقٍّ حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ علَيهِ بَرَكةَ الرِّزقِ إلّا أن يَتوبَ
hadiths.english: 2580. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever deprives a fellow Muslim brother of his right, Allah forbids him the benediction of sustenance until he repents.'

hadiths.arabic: 2581. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنّ العَبدَ لَيُذنِبُ الذَّنبَ فَيُزوى‏ عنهُ الرِّزقُ
hadiths.english: 2581. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Verily when the servant commits a sin, his sustenance eludes him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2582. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : كَثرَةُ السُحتِ يَمحَقُ الرِّزقَ
hadiths.english: 2582. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Obtaining wealth through illegal means cuts off one's sustenance.'

sections.section_title_en: Encouraging to Seek Livelihood Through Lawful (halal) Means

hadiths.arabic: 2583. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : العِبادَةُ عَشرَةُ أجزاءٍ تِسعَةُ أجزاءٍ في طَلَبِ الحَلالِ
hadiths.english: 2583. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Worship consists of ten parts of which nine are to do with earning a lawful livelihood.'

hadiths.arabic: 2584. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الكادُّ على‏ عِيالِهِ كالمُجاهِدِ في سبيلِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2584. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He who works hard to provide his family with [a lawful] livelihood is as one who fights in the way of Allah (jihad).'

hadiths.arabic: 2585. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ يُحِبُّ أن يَرى‏ عَبدَهُ تَعِباً في طَلَبِ الحَلالِ
hadiths.english: 2585. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah, most High, loves to see his servant weary from striving to earn his livelihood [lawfully].'

hadiths.arabic: 2586. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : طَلبُ الحَلالِ فَريضةٌ على‏ كُلِّ مُسلمٍ ومُسلمةٍ
hadiths.english: 2586. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Seeking a lawful livelihood is incumbent upon every Muslim man and woman.'

hadiths.arabic: 2587. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أكَلَ مِن كَدِّ يَدِهِ ، مَرَّ على الصِّراطِ كالبَرقِ الخاطِفِ
hadiths.english: 2587. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He whose daily bread is earned through his own toil and labour will pass across the Sirat as fast as a flash of lightning.'

hadiths.arabic: 2588. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أكَلَ مِن كَدِّ يَدِهِ ، نَظَر اللَّهُ إلَيهِ بالرَّحمَةِ ثُمّ لا يُعَذِّبُهُ أبداً
hadiths.english: 2588. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He whose daily bread is earned through his own toil and labour, Allah will look upon him with mercy and will never expose him to chastisement.'

hadiths.arabic: 2589. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَلعونٌ مَلعونٌ مَن ضَيَّعَ مَن يَعُولُ
hadiths.english: 2589. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Cursed! Cursed is the one who brings deprivation to his dependents.

hadiths.arabic: 2590. بحار الأنوار عن المفضّلِ بنِ عمرَ : استَعِينُوا بِبعضِ الدنيا على الآخِرَةِ ، فإنّي سَمِعتُ أبا عبدِ اللَّهِ عليه السلام يقولُ : اِستَعِينُوا بِبعضِ هذهِ على‏ هذهِ ، ولا تَكُونوا كَلاًّ على الناسِ
hadiths.english: 2590. Mufaddal b. Umar said, 'Make use of some of the [commodities of this] world to help you in the next world, for I have heard Abu Abdallah (AS) [i.e. Imam al-Sadiq] say, 'Make use of some of this [abode] for that one, but do not be a burden on other people.'

sections.section_title_en: The Best Livelihood is That Which SUFFICES YOU

hadiths.arabic: 2591. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اللّهُمّ ارزُقْ محمّداً وآلَ محمّدٍ ومَن أحَبَّ محمّداً وآلَ محمّدٍ ، العَفافَ والكَفافَ ، وارزُقْ مَن أبغَضَ محمّداً وآلَ محمّدٍ المالَ والوَلَدَ
