hadiths.english: 2591. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O Allah provide moderation and sufficiency to Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, and to those who love Muhammad and his family, and provide abundance of wealth and progeny to those who harbour hatred for Muhammad and his family.'

hadiths.arabic: 2592. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : خَيرُ الرِّزقِ ما يَكْفِي
hadiths.english: 2592. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The best livelihood is that which suffices.'

hadiths.arabic: 2593. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما قَلَّ وكَفى‏ خَيرٌ مِمّا كَثُرَ وألهى‏
hadiths.english: 2593. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'That which is little yet sufficient is better than that which is abundant and distracting [as a result].'

hadiths.arabic: 2594. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إيّاكُم والرّشوَةَ فإنّها مَحضُ الكُفرِ ، ولا يَشُمُّ صاحِبُ الرّشوةِ رِيحَ الجَنَّةِ
hadiths.english: 2594. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Beware of bribery for verily it is sheer infidelity, and the briber will not even smell the fragrance of Paradise.'

hadiths.arabic: 2595. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَعَنَ اللَّهُ الراشيَ والمُرتَشِيَ والرائشَ الذي يَمشِي بَينَهُما
hadiths.english: 2595. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Allah's curse is on the briber, the bribed, and the agent between them.'

hadiths.arabic: 2596. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّما أهلَكَ مَن كانَ قَبلَكُم أنَّهُم مَنَعُوا الناسَ الحَقَّ فاشتَرَوهُ ، وأخَذُوهُم بالباطِلِ فاقتَدَوهُ
hadiths.english: 2596. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The ruin of your predecessors lay in the fact that they deprived people of their rights and subsequently resorted to buying them back, and they handled people using unethical means, which they followed.'

hadiths.arabic: 2597. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : وقد عَلِمتُم أ نَّهُ لا يَنبَغِي أن يكونَ الوالِي على الفُرُوجِ والدِّماءِ والمَغانِمِ والأحكامِ وإمامَةِ المسلمينَ البَخِيلُ ولا المُرتَشِي في الحُكمِ فَيَذهَبَ بالحُقوقِ ، ويَقِفَ بِها دُونَ المَقاطِعِ
hadiths.english: 2597. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'You know full well that he who is in charge of honour, people's lives, war booty, legal commandments and the leadership of the Muslims must not be a miser... nor should he accept bribes in his judgment for he would forfeit their rights, and deprives the rightful from his right.'

hadiths.arabic: 2598. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في قولِهِ تعالى‏ : (أَكَّالُونَ للسُّحْتِ) - : هُو الرَّجُلُ يَقضِي لأخِيهِ الحاجَةَ ثُمّ يَقبَلُ هَدِيَّتَهُ
hadiths.english: 2598. Imam Ali (AS) said about Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“eaters of the unlawful” , 'This refers to the man who fulfils a need for a fellow brother and then accepts a gift from him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2599. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الرُّشى‏ في الحُكمِ هُو الكُفرُ باللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2599. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Accepting bribes as a judge or ruler is tantamount to disbelief in Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2600. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ليسَ للصَّبيِّ لَبَنٌ خَيرٌ مِن لَبَنِ اُمِّهِ
hadiths.english: 2600. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There is no better milk for a child than the milk of his mother.'

hadiths.arabic: 2601. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اُنظُرُوا مَن تُرضِعُ أولادَكُم؛ فإنّ الوَلَدَ يَشِبُّ علَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2601. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Take into account who it is that suckles your children, for verily this is what a child grows on.'

hadiths.arabic: 2602. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : اِستَرضِعْ لِولدِكَ بِلَبَنِ الحِسانِ ، وإيّاكَ والقِباحَ ؛ فإنّ اللَّبَنَ قد يُعدِي
hadiths.english: 2602. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Get beautiful wet-nurses to suckle your child and keep away from ugly ones, for verily the milk has an effect [on the child].'

sections.section_title_en: TYPES OF WET-NURSES THAT SHOULD NOT BE EMPLOYED

hadiths.arabic: 2603. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تَستَرضِعُوا الحَمقاءَ ، ولا العَمشاءَ؛ فإنّ اللَّبَنَ يُعدِي
hadiths.english: 2603. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not employ wet-nurses that are stupid or bleary-eyed for verily the milk has an effect [on the child].'

hadiths.arabic: 2604. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : تَوَقَّوا على‏ أولادِكُم لَبَنَ البَغِيِّ مِن النِّساءِ، والمَجنونَةِ؛ فإنّ اللَّبَنَ يُعدِي
hadiths.english: 2604. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Protect your children from the milk of prostitutes and madwomen, for verily the milk has an effect [on the child].'

hadiths.arabic: 2605. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : رِضاعُ اليَهوديّةِ والنَّصرانيّةِ خَيرٌ مِن رِضاعِ الناصِبيّةِ
hadiths.english: 2605. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Getting a Christian or a Jewish wet-nurse to suckle a child is better than a Nasibiyya.'

hadiths.arabic: 2606. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : نِعمَ القَرينُ الرِّضا
hadiths.english: 2606. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'What an excellent companion satisfaction is.'

hadiths.arabic: 2607. الإمامُ الحسنُ عليه السلام : مَنِ اتَّكَلَ على حُسنِ الاختِيارِ مِنَ اللَّهِ ، لَم يَتَمَنَّ أ نّهُ في غَيرِ الحالِ التي اختارَها اللَّهُ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2607. Imam al-Hasan (AS) said, 'He who trusts whatever Allah has chosen for him to be good, will never wish to be in any situation other than what Allah has chosen for him to be in.'

hadiths.arabic: 2608. الإمامُ الحسنُ عليه السلام : كيفَ يكونُ المؤمنُ مؤمناً وهو يَسخَطُ قِسمَهُ ويُحَقِّرُ مَنزِلَتَهُ والحاكِمُ علَيهِ اللَّهُ ؟!
hadiths.english: 2608. Imam al-Hasan (AS) said, 'How can a believer call himself a believer if he is dissatisfied with his lot in life and despises his current circumstances when Allah is the authority above him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2609. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : أعلى‏ دَرَجةِ الزُّهدِ أدنى‏ دَرَجةِ الوَرَعِ ، وأعلى‏ دَرَجةِ الوَرَعِ أدنى‏ دَرَجةِ اليَقينِ ، وأعلى‏ دَرَجةِ اليَقينِ أدنى‏ دَرَجةِ الرِّضا
hadiths.english: 2609. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'The highest degree of asceticism is equivalent to the lowest degree of piety. And the highest degree of piety is equivalent to the lowest degree of certainty. And the highest degrees of certainty are equivalent to the lowest degrees of ultimate satisfaction (with Allah).'

hadiths.arabic: 2610. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : الرِّضا بمَكروهِ القَضاءِ مِن أعلى‏ دَرَجاتِ اليَقينِ
hadiths.english: 2610. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'Satisfaction with adversities is one of the highest stages of certainty.'

hadiths.arabic: 2611. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لَم يَكُن رسولُ‏اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله يقولُ لِشَي‏ءٍ قد مَضى‏ : لَو كانَ غَيرَهُ !
hadiths.english: 2611. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The Prophet (SAWA) never used to utter the words 'if only...' with regards to something that had happened in the past.'

hadiths.arabic: 2612. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : رَأسُ طاعَةِ اللَّهِ الرِّضا بما صَنَعَ اللَّهُ فيما أحَبَّ العَبدُ وفيما كَرِهَ
hadiths.english: 2612. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The basis of obedience to Allah is to be satisfied with everything that Allah has designed whether he himself likes it or not.'

sections.section_title_en: THINGS THAT INCITE SATISFACTION [WITH ALLAH'S DECREE]

hadiths.arabic: 2613. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أصلُ الرِّضا حُسنُ الثِقَةِ بِاللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2613. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The origin of satisfaction is trust in Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2614. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ أعلَمَ الناسِ باللَّهِ أرْضاهُم بقَضاءِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2614. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily those who have the greatest knowledge of Allah are the most satisfied with His decree.'

hadiths.arabic: 2615. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا أحَبَّ اللَّهُ عَبداً ابتَلاهُ، فإن صَبَرَ اجتَباهُ ، وإن رَضِيَ اصطَفاهُ
hadiths.english: 2615. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When Allah loves a servant He tests him with tribulations, and if he endures these He selects him [for His proximity], and if he bears them with satisfaction, He distinguishes him [a higher status].'

hadiths.arabic: 2616. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اِرْضَ بِقَسْمِ اللَّهِ تَكُنْ أغنَى الناسِ
hadiths.english: 2616. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Satisfy yourself with Allah's share [for you] and you will be the richest of people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2617. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الرِّضا يَنفِي الحُزْنَ
hadiths.english: 2617. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Satisfaction expels sorrow.'

hadiths.arabic: 2618. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّ أهنَأ الناسِ عَيشاً مَن كانَ بما قَسَمَ اللَّهُ لَهُ راضِياً
hadiths.english: 2618. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily the one who enjoys the best standards of living is he who is satisfied with what Allah has apportioned for him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2619. الإمامُ الحسنُ عليه السلام : أنا الضّامِنُ لِمَن لا يَهجِسُ في قَلبِهِ إلّا الرِّضا أن يَدعُوَ اللَّهَ فَيُستَجابَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2619. Imam al-Hasan (AS) said, 'I guarantee you that the one who entertains nothing save satisfaction with Allah in his heart, has only to ask Allah and He will answer him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2620. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الرَّوحُ والرّاحَةُ في الرِّضا واليَقينِ ، والهَمُّ والحُزْنُ في الشَّكِّ والسُّخطِ
hadiths.english: 2620. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Tranquility and comfort lie in satisfaction and certainty, whereas worry and sorrow lie in doubt and dissatisfaction.'

hadiths.arabic: 2621. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن لم يَرضَ بما قَسَمَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ ، اِتَّهَمَ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ في قَضائهِ
hadiths.english: 2621. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'He who is dissatisfied with what Allah has apportioned him accuses Allah with regards to His decree.'

hadiths.arabic: 2622. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن رَضِيَ القَضاءَ أتى‏ علَيهِ القَضاءُ وهُو مَأجُورٌ ومَن سَخِطَ القَضاءَ أتى‏ علَيهِ القَضاءُ وأحبَطَ اللَّهُ أجرَهُ
hadiths.english: 2622. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The one who is satisfied with Allah's decree will experience His decree and be rewarded [on account of his satisfaction], whereas the one who is displeased with the decree, not only will he continue to experience the same decree, but Allah will do away with his reward too.'

hadiths.arabic: 2623. بحار الأنوار : رُويَ أنّ موسى‏ عليه السلام قالَ : يا رَبِّ ، دُلَّني على‏ عَمَلٍ إذا أنا عَمِلتُهُ نِلتُ بهِ رِضاكَ فَأوحَى اللَّهُ إلَيهِ : يابنَ عِمرانَ ، إنّ رِضايَ في كُرهِكَ ولَن تُطِيقَ ذلكَ فَخَرَّ موسى‏ عليه السلام ساجِداً باكِياً فقالَ : يا رَبِّ ، خَصَصتَنِي بالكَلامِ ، ولَم تُكَلِّمْ بَشَراً قَبلِي ، ولَم تَدُلَّني على‏ عَمَلٍ أنَالُ بهِ رِضاكَ ! فَأوحَى اللَّهُ إلَيهِ : إنّ رِضاي في رِضاكَ بِقَضائي
hadiths.english: 2623. It has been narrated in Bihar al-Anwar that Prophet Moses (AS) addressed Allah, saying, 'My Lord, guide me to an action the performance of which will earn me Your good pleasure.' So Allah revealed to him, 'O son of Amran, verily My pleasure lies in that which you will be averse to and you will not be able to endure it.' So Moses fell prostrate, weeping and cried out, 'My Lord! You have selected me to speak to when You have not spoken to any before me, and yet You do not guide me to that action by which I may earn Your pleasure!' So Allah revealed to him, 'Verily My pleasure lies in your pleasure with whatever I decree.'

hadiths.arabic: 2624. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ثلاثٌ يُبلِغْنَ بالعَبدِ رِضوانَ اللَّهِ : كَثرَةُ الاستِغفارِ ، وخَفْضُ الجانِبِ ، وكَثرَةُ الصَّدَقَةِ.
hadiths.english: 2624. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Three things enable a servant to attain Allah's pleasure: persistence in seeking forgiveness, affability towards people, and frequent giving of charity.'

hadiths.arabic: 2625. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن أسخَطَ بَدَنَهُ أرضى‏ رَبَّهُ ، ومَن لَم يُسخِطْ بَدَنَهُ عَصى‏ رَبَّهُ
hadiths.english: 2625. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who dissatisfies [troubles] his body earns Allah's pleasure, and he who is not willing to do so defies Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2626. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أوصاكُم بالتَّقوى‏ ، وجَعَلَها مُنتَهى‏ رِضاهُ وحاجَتَهُ مِن خَلقِهِ
hadiths.english: 2626. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He [Allah] has advised you to be Godwary in all things, and has made it the height of His good pleasure and His sole requirement from His creatures.'

hadiths.arabic: 2627. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : رِضا اللَّهِ سبحانَهُ مَقرونٌ بطاعَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 2627. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Allah's pleasure is linked to His obedience.'

hadiths.arabic: 2628. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : إنَّ أرضاكُم عِندَ اللَّهِ أسبَغُكُم على‏ عِيالِهِ
hadiths.english: 2628. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'Verily the one who Allah is most pleased with from among you is the one who is the most generous towards his own dependents.'

hadiths.arabic: 2629. بحار الأنوار : رُويَ أنّ موسى‏ عليه السلام قالَ : يا رَبِّ أخبِرْني عن آيَةِ رِضاكَ عن عَبدِكَ ، فَأوحَى اللَّهُ تعالى‏ إلَيهِ : إذا رَأيتَني اُهَيِّئُ عبدِي لطاعَتِي وأصرِفُهُ عن مَعصِيَتي ، فذلكَ آيَةُ رِضايَ
hadiths.english: 2629. It is narrated in Bihar al-Anwar that Prophet Moses (AS) said, 'O My Lord, what is a sign of Your pleasure with a servant of Yours?' So Allah revealed to him, saying, 'When you see Me preparing My servant for My obedience and averting him from My disobedience, [know that] it is a sign of My pleasure.'

hadiths.arabic: 2630. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : علامَةُ رِضا اللَّهِ سبحانَهُ عن العَبدِ ، رِضاهُ بما قَضَى‏ بهِ سبحانَهُ لَهُ وعلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2630. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The sign of Allah's pleasure with His servant is the satisfaction found in the servant himself with all that Allah decrees, be it in his favour or not.'

sections.section_title_en: Pleasing People at the Expense OF ALLAH'S DISPLEASURE

hadiths.arabic: 2631. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - فيما كَتَبَ إلى‏ محمّدِ بنِ أبي بكرٍ - : إنِ استَطَعتَ أن لاتُسخِطَ رَبَّكَ برِضا أحَدٍ مِن خَلقِهِ فَافعَلْ؛ فإنَّ في اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ خَلَفاً مِن غَيرِهِ ، ولَيسَ في شي‏ءٍ سِواهُ خَلَفٌ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 2631. Imam Ali (AS), in a letter that he wrote to Muhammad b. Abu Bakr, said, 'Try to the best of your ability not to displease your Lord by pleasing any of His creatures, for verily Allah can easily substitute a servant for another but the servant has recourse to no other substitute for Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2632. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : مَن طَلَبَ رِضا اللَّهِ بِسَخَطِ الناسِ كَفاهُ اللَّهُ اُمُورَ الناسِ ، ومَن طَلَبَ رِضا الناسِ بِسَخَطِ اللَّهِ ، وَكَلَهُ اللَّهُ إلى النّاسِ
hadiths.english: 2632. Imam al-Hossein (AS) said, 'He who seeks to please Allah at the expense of displeasing people, Allah suffices him in everything including his affairs with people. But the one who seeks to please people at the expense of Allah's displeasure, Allah relegates him to those very people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2633. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ الرِّفقَ لَم يُوضَعْ على‏ شي‏ءٍ إلّا زانَهُ ، ولا نُزِعَ مِن شَي‏ءٍ إلّا شانَهُ
hadiths.english: 2633. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'No sooner is leniency added to something than it adorns it, and no sooner is it taken away from something than it spoils it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2634. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما اصطَحَبَ اثنانِ إلّا كانَ أعظَمُهُما أجراً وأحَبُّهُما إلى اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ أرفَقَهُما بصاحِبِهِ
hadiths.english: 2634. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When two people become friends or accompany each other, the one with the greater reward and the most beloved in Allah's eyes is the one who is the most gentle towards his companion.'

hadiths.arabic: 2635. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا أرادَ اللَّهُ بأهلِ بيتٍ خَيراً أدخَلَ علَيهِم بابَ رِفقٍ
hadiths.english: 2635. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When Allah wishes to bestow good on a household, he introduces leniency into it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2636. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أعقَلُ الناسِ أشَدُّهُم مُداراةً للناسِ
hadiths.english: 2636. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The most intelligent person is he who is the most tolerant towards people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2637. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ اللَّهَ عزّوجلّ رَفيقٌ يُحِبُّ الرِّفقَ في الأمرِ كُلِّهِ
hadiths.english: 2637. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Allah, Mighty and Exalted, is lenient and loves leniency in all matters.'

hadiths.arabic: 2638. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الرِّفقُ مِفتاحُ النَّجاحِ.
hadiths.english: 2638. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Leniency is the key to success.'

hadiths.arabic: 2639. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنَّ لِكُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ قُفْلاً وقُفلُ الإيمانِ الرِّفقُ
hadiths.english: 2639. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Everything has a lock, and the lock of faith is leniency.'

hadiths.arabic: 2640. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : الرِّفقُ نِصفُ العَيشِ
hadiths.english: 2640. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Moderation is worth half of one's livelihood.'

hadiths.arabic: 2641. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ هذا الدِّينَ مَتِينٌ فَأوغِلُوا فيهِ برِفقٍ ، ولا تُكرِهُوا عِبادَةَ اللَّهِ إلى‏ عِبادِ اللَّهِ فتكونوا كالراكِبِ المُنْبَتِّ الذي لا سَفَراً قَطَعَ ولا ظَهْراً أبقى‏
hadiths.english: 2641. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily this religion is firm so penetrate into it gently, and do not arouse aversion for Allah's worship in His servants that they may become like shattered riders who have neither gotten further in their travel nor have any drive left to continue.'

hadiths.arabic: 2642. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : خادِعْ نفسَكَ في العِبادَةِ، وارفُقْ بها ولا تَقهَرْها ، وخُذْ عَفوَها ونَشاطَها ، إلّا ما كانَ مَكتوباً علَيكَ مِن الفَريضَةِ ، فإنّهُ لابُدَّ مِن قضائها وتَعاهُدِها عندَ مَحَلِّها
hadiths.english: 2642. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Cajole your soul tactfully to worship, and be gentle with it and do not force it. Make allowances for both its weariness and its activity, except for the daily obligations that are incumbent upon it, for it must fulfil them and undertake them at their prescribed times.'

hadiths.arabic: 2643. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ في الرِّفقِ الزِّيادَةَ والبَرَكَةَ ، ومَن يُحرَمِ الرِّفقَ يُحرَمِ الخَيرَ
hadiths.english: 2643. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily in leniency is to be found abundance and benediction, so whoever is divested of leniency is deprived of good.'

hadiths.arabic: 2644. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الرِّفقُ يُيَسِّرُ الصِّعابَ ، ويُسَهِّلُ شَديدَ الأسبابِ
hadiths.english: 2644. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Leniency eases hardships and facilitates difficult situations.'

hadiths.arabic: 2645. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : مَن اُحْجِمَ عن الرَّأيِ وعَيِيَتْ بِهِ الحِيَلُ ، كانَ الرِّفقُ مِفتاحَهُ
hadiths.english: 2645. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, 'For him who is rendered helpless in making a decision and who is at a loss of what to do, moderation is the key.'

hadiths.arabic: 2646. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : كانَ آخِرُ ما أوصى‏ بهِ الخضرُ موسى‏ بنَ عِمرانَ عليهما السلام : . ما رَفَقَ أحَدٌ بأحَدٍ في الدنيا إلّا رَفَقَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ بهِ يَومَ القِيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 2646. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'The last piece of advice that al-Khidr gave to Prophet Moses (AS) was: 'When a person is lenient towards someone in this world, Allah will be lenient with him on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.arabic: 2647. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إن شِئتَ أن تُكرَمَ فَلِنْ ، وإن شِئتَ أن تُهانَ فاخشُنْ
hadiths.english: 2647. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'If you wish to be honoured [by people] be lenient [towards them], and if you wish to be humiliated then be rough.'

hadiths.arabic: 2648. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن كانَ رفيقاً في أمرِهِ نالَ ما يُريدُ مِنَ الناسِ
hadiths.english: 2648. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'One who is lenient and moderate in his affairs will obtain whatever he wants from people.'

sections.section_title_en: MAN'S ACTIONS ARE SCRUTINIZED BY Allah, the Angels and his Own Limbs

hadiths.arabic: 2649. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: اِعلَمُوا عِبادَاللَّهِ أَنَّ علَيكُم رَصَداً مِن أنفُسِكُم ، وعُيُوناً من جَوارِحِكُم ، وحُفَّاظَ صِدْقٍ يَحفَظُونَ أعمالَكُم ، وعَدَدَ أنفاسِكم ، لا تَستُرُكُم مِنهُم ظُلمَةُ لَيلٍ داجٍ ، ولا يُكِنُّكُم مِنهُم بابٌ ذو رِتاجٍ
hadiths.english: 2649. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Know O servants of Allah that your own selves monitor you, and your limbs are a watchful eye over you. The truthful guardian angels record your deeds as well as the number of your breaths. Neither can the dark gloomy night conceal you from view, nor can you hide behind a bolted door.'

hadiths.arabic: 2650. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : كان فيها [ أي صُحُفِ إبراهيم عليه السلام‏]... : على العاقِلِ ما لَم يَكُن مَغلوباً على‏ عَقلِهِ أن يكونَ لَهُ ساعاتٌ : ساعَةٌ يُناجِي فيها رَبَّهُ عزّوجلّ ، وساعَةٌ يُحاسِبُ نَفسَهُ ، وساعَةٌ يَتَفَكَّرُ فيما صَنَعَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ إلَيهِ ، وساعَةٌ يَخلُو فيها بِحَظِّ نفسِهِ مِنَ‏الحَلالِ؛ فإنّ هذهِ الساعَةَ عَونٌ لِتلكَ الساعاتِ واستِجمامٌ للقُلوبِ وتَوزِيعٌ لها
hadiths.english: 2650. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The scriptures of Prophet Abraham (AS) contain the following: '...the rational man, as long as he is of sound reason, must put aside several hours during the day - an hour for conversing with his Lord, an hour for [self-scrutiny and] accounting for himself, an hour to ponder over Allah's favours bestowed upon him, and an hour to spend on his own lawful pleasures, for this one hour will be an aid to him in fulfilling his other hours, as well as a time to recuperate and relax.'

hadiths.arabic: 2651. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِجعَلْ مِن نفسِكَ على‏ نفسِكَ رَقيباً ، واجعَلْ لِآخِرَتِكَ مِن دُنياك نَصيباً
hadiths.english: 2651. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Appoint your own self as a scrutinizer over yourself, and use this world to reserve your share in the Hereafter.'

hadiths.arabic: 2652. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يَنبَغِي أن يكونَ الرجُلُ مُهَيمِناً عَلى‏ نَفسِهِ ، مُراقِباً قَلبَهُ حافِظاً لِسانَهُ
hadiths.english: 2652. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Man must control and survey his own self, scrutinize his heart, and guard his tongue.'

hadiths.arabic: 2653. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : رَحِمَ اللَّهُ امرَأً (عَبداً) سَمِعَ حُكْماً فَوَعى‏ ، ودُعِيَ إلى‏ رَشادٍ فَدَنا ، وأخَذَ بِحُجْزَةِ هادٍ فَنَجا ، راقَبَ رَبَّهُ ، وخافَ ذَنبَهُ
hadiths.english: 2653. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Allah has mercy on the servant who scrutinizes his sins carefully and fears his Lord.'

hadiths.arabic: 2654. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : على العاقِلِ أن يُحصِيَ على‏ نفسِهِ مَساوِيَها في الدِّينِ والرَأيِ والأخلاقِ والأدَبِ ، فَيَجمَعَ ذلكَ في صَدرِهِ أو في كتابٍ ويَعمَلَ في إزالَتِها
hadiths.english: 2654. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The rational man must calculate his soul's misdeeds against religion, reason, ethical virtues and good moral conduct. He must gather this information within himself or write it down in a book and work at eradicating them.'

hadiths.arabic: 2655. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : كانَ فيما وَعَظَ اللَّهُ تَبارَكَ و تَعالى‏ بهِ عيسَى بنَ مريمَ عليه السلام أن قالَ له : يا عيسى‏ ، كُنْ حَيثُما كُنتَ مُراقِباً لي
hadiths.english: 2655. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Among the advices that Allah, Blessed and most High, gave to Jesus son of Mary (AS) was, 'O Jesus, wherever you may be, scrutinize yourself on My behalf.'

hadiths.arabic: 2656. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَنِ اعتَدَلَ يَوماهُ فهُو مَغبونٌ ، ومَن كانَ في غَدِهِ شَرّاً مِن يَومِهِ فهُو مَفتونٌ ، ومَن لَم يَتَفَقَّدِ النُقصانَ في نفسِهِ دام نَقصُهُ ، ومَن دامَ نَقصُهُ فالمَوتُ خَيرٌ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2656. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The man for whom each day passes exactly the same as another [where there is no change in his character or his deeds] is indeed a loser. And the man for whom the next day is always worse than the previous day is indeed cursed. And the man who never sees to improve himself day after day is indeed at a loss, and whoever passes his days in such loss, death is surely better for him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2657. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : لَيسَ مِنّا مَن لَم يُحاسِبْ نفسَهُ في كُلِّ يَومٍ ، فَإن عَمِلَ حَسَناً استَزادَ اللَّهَ ، وإن عَمِلَ سَيِّئاً استَغفَرَ اللَّهَ مِنهُ وتابَ إلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2657. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'The one who does not take account of himself every single day is not one of us. And when he performs a good deed, he should ask Allah to enable him to do more, and when he commits an evil deed, he must seek Allah's forgiveness and repent for it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2658. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّما سُمِّيَ الرَّمَضانُ لأ نّهُ يَرمَضُ الذُّنوبَ
hadiths.english: 2658. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily Ramadan has been thus named because it scorches away sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 2659. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ أبوابَ السماءِ تُفتَحُ في أوَّلِ ليلةٍ مِن شَهرِرَمَضانَ، ولا تُغلَقُ إلى‏ آخِرِ ليلةٍ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 2659. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily the gates of the heavens are opened on the first night of the month of Ramadan, and are not closed again until the very last night.'

hadiths.arabic: 2660. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَو يَعلَمُ العَبدُ ما في رَمَضانَ لَوَدَّ أن يكونَ رَمَضانُ السَّنَةَ
hadiths.english: 2660. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If the servant was to fathom the worth of Ramadan, he would wish that Ramadan lasted the whole year.'

hadiths.arabic: 2661. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا استَهَلَّ رَمَضانُ غُلِّقَتْ أبوابُ النارِ ، وفُتِحَتْ أبوابُ الجِنانِ ، وصُفِّدَتِ الشَّياطينُ
hadiths.english: 2661. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'As soon as the month of Ramadan sets in, the gates of Hell are locked up, the gates of Paradise are opened, and the devils are bound up.'

hadiths.arabic: 2663. الإمامُ الباقر عليه السلام : قالَ رسولُ‏اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله لَمّا حَضَرَ شَهرُ رَمَضانَ وذلكَ لثَلاثٍ بَقِينَ مِن شَعبانَ، قالَ لبِلالٍ : نادِ في الناسِ ، فَجَمعَ الناسُ ثُمّ صَعِدَ المِنبَرَ، فَحَمِدَ اللَّهَ وأثنى‏ علَيهِ، ثُمّ قالَ: أيُّها الناسَ ، إنَّ هذا الشَّهرَ قد حَضَرَكُم وهُو سَيِّدُ الشُّهُورِ ، فيهِ ليلةٌ خَيرٌ مِن ألفِ شَهرٍ ، تُغلَقُ فيهِ أبوابُ النِّيرانِ، وتُفتَحُ فيهِ أبوابُ الجِنانِ ، فَمَن أدرَكَهُ فلَم يُغفَرْ لهُ فَأبعَدَهُ اللَّهُ
hadiths.english: 2663. Imam al-Baqir (AS) narrated, 'At the end of Shaban, when there were only three days left till the month of Ramadan, the Prophet (SAWA) told Bilal, 'Call all the people', so the people gathered together. The Prophet (SAWA) mounted the pulpit, praised Allah and glorified Him, then continued, 'O people, this month that is coming upon you is the chief of all months. One particular night in it is better than a thousand months. During this month, the gates of Hell are locked up, and the gates of Paradise are opened. So whoever, in spite of experiencing this month is not forgiven, has indeed been distanced by Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2664. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - مِن وَصِيَّتِهِ لِولْدِهِ عِندَ دُخُولِ شَهرِ رَمَضانَ - : فاجهَدُوا أنفُسَكُم فإنّ فيهِ تُقسَمُ الأرزاقُ ، وتُكتَبُ الآجالُ ، وفيهِ يُكتَبُ وَفدُ اللَّهِ الذين يَفِدُونَ إلَيهِ ، وفيهِ ليلةٌ العَمَلُ فيها خَيرٌ مِن العَمَلِ في ألفِ شَهرٍ
hadiths.english: 2664. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), in his advice to his children heralding the advent of the month of Ramadan, said, 'Exert yourselves [in doing good deeds] for verily in this month sustenance is apportioned, life spans are destined, the names of Allah's select servants who wish to strive towards Him are recorded down, and in this month is a night wherein the good deeds performed equal the deeds of a thousand months.'

sections.section_title_en: ALLAH'S FORGIVENESS IN THE MONTH OF RAMAdaN

hadiths.arabic: 2665. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أدرَكَ شَهرَ رَمَضانَ فلَم يُغفَرْ لَهُ فَأبعَدَهُ اللَّهُ
hadiths.english: 2665. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He who experiences the month of Ramadan and remains unforgiven has indeed been distanced by Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2666. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - في خُطبتِهِ عندَ إقبالِ شهرِ رمضانَ - : إنّ الشَّقِيَّ مَن حُرِمَ غُفرانَ اللَّهِ في هذا الشَّهرِ العَظيمِ
hadiths.english: 2666. The Prophet (SAWA), in his sermon heralding the advent of the month of Ramadan, said, 'Verily the most unfortunate is he who is deprived of Allah's forgiveness in this great month.'

hadiths.arabic: 2667. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَنْ لم يُغفَرْ لَهُ في شَهرِ رمضانَ ففِي أيِّ شهرٍ يُغفَرُ لَهُ ؟!
hadiths.english: 2667. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If a person remains unforgiven in the month of Ramadan, then what other month is there left for him to be forgiven in?!'

hadiths.arabic: 2668. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن لَم يُغفَرْ لَهُ في شهرِ رمضانَ لَم يُغفَرْ لَهُ إلى مِثلِهِ مِن قابِلٍ إلّا أن يَشهَدَ عَرَفَةَ.
hadiths.english: 2668. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'If a person remains unforgiven in the month of Ramadan, he will not be forgiven in any other month after it unless he is able to attend the plains of Arafa [during the obligatory pilgrimage].'

hadiths.arabic: 2669. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ الأرواحَ لا تُمازِجُ البَدَنَ ولا تُواكِلُهُ ، وإنّما هِي كِلَلٌ لِلبَدَنِ مُحِيطَةٌ به
hadiths.english: 2669. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily the spirits neither merge with the body nor are they dependent of it. Rather they are like a thin veil surrounding the body.'

hadiths.arabic: 2670. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الرُّوحُ جِسمٌ رَقِيقٌ قد اُلبِسَ قالَباً كثيفاً
hadiths.english: 2670. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The spirit is a subtle form that is in enveloped in a dense shell [i.e. the body].'

hadiths.arabic: 2671. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الأرواحُ جُنودٌ مُجَنَّدَةٌ ، فما تَعارَفَ مِنها ائتَلَفَ ، وما تَناكَرَ مِنها اختَلَفَ
hadiths.english: 2671. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Spirits are pre-mobilized groups in that they are mutually attracted to other spirits that they are in harmony with and they mutually repel those that they differ.'

hadiths.arabic: 2672. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : المَوَدَّةُ تَعاطُفُ القُلوبِ في ائتِلافِ الأرواحِ
hadiths.english: 2672. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Love is when hearts harbour mutual affection due to the harmony between their spirits.'

hadiths.arabic: 2674. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّ لِلجِسمِ سِتَّةَ أحوالٍ: الصِّحّةُ ، والمَرضُ ، والمَوتُ ، والحَياةُ ، والنَّومُ ، واليَقَظَةُ ، وكذلكَ الرُّوحُ ، فحياتُها عِلمُها ، ومَوتُها جَهلُها ، ومَرَضُها شَكُّها ، وصِحَّتُها يَقِينُها ، ونَومُها غَفلَتُها ، ويَقَظَتُها حِفظُها
hadiths.english: 2674. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The body experiences six different states: health, sickness, death, life, sleep and wakefulness, and so does the spirit. Its life is its knowledge and its death ignorance; its sickness is doubt whereas its health is certainty; its sleep is its negligence and its wakefulness is its consciousness.'

hadiths.arabic: 2675. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - عندما سَألَه أبو بصيرٍ عنِ الرُّوحِ عِندَ النَّومِ أخارِجٌ مِن البَدَنِ ؟ - : لا يا أبا بصيرٍ ، فإنَّ الرُّوحَ إذا فارَقَتِ البَدَنَ لَم تَعُدْ إلَيهِ ، غَيرَ أنّها بمَنزِلَةِ عَينِ الشَّمسِ مَركُوزةٌ في السماءِ في كَبِدِها ، وشُعاعُها في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2675. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), when asked by his companion Abu Basir whether the spirit remains with the body during sleep or leaves it, replied, 'No, O Abu Basir, verily if the spirit were to leave the body it would never again return to it. It is actually like the sun that is fixed in its place in the centre of the sky, yet its rays extend out to the earth.'

hadiths.arabic: 2676. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنّ المَرءَ إذا نامَ فإنّ رُوحَ الحَيَوانِ باقِيَةٌ في البَدَنِ ، والذي يَخرُجُ مِنهُ رُوحُ العَقلِ.
hadiths.english: 2676. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'When man sleeps, the animal spirit within him remains with his body, and that which leaves it is the rational spirit.'

hadiths.arabic: 2677. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن وَثِقَ بأنَّ ما قَدَّرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ لَن يَفُوتَهُ اسْتَراحَ قَلبُهُ
hadiths.english: 2677. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who has confidence in the fact that whatever sustenance Allah has apportioned for him will definitely reach him has secured comfort for his heart.'

hadiths.arabic: 2678. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزَّوجةُ المُوافِقَةُ إحدَى الراحَتَينِ
hadiths.english: 2678. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'A compatible wife is one of the two main comforts.'

hadiths.arabic: 2679. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَنِ اقتَصَرَ على‏ بُلغَةِ الكَفافِ فَقَدِ انتَظَمَ الراحَةَ ، وتَبَوَّأ خَفضَ الدَّعَةِ
hadiths.english: 2679. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who restricts himself to what is just sufficient for maintenance has secured comfort and leads a carefree life.'

hadiths.arabic: 2680. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزُّهدُ في الدنيا الراحَةُ العُظمى‏
hadiths.english: 2680. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The greatest comfort lies in practicing abstemiousness in this world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2681. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الرَّوْحُ والرّاحَةُ في الرِّضا واليَقينِ ، والهَمُّ والحَزَنُ في الشَكِّ والسَّخَطِ
hadiths.english: 2681. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Tranquility and comfort lie in satisfaction and certainty, whereas worry and sorrow lie in doubt and dissatisfaction.'

hadiths.arabic: 2682. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: أروَحُ الرَّوْحِ اليَأسُ عنِ الناسِ
hadiths.english: 2682. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Absolute tranquility lies in despairing of [any favours from] people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2683. بحار الأنوار عن الإمام الصادق عليه السلام - لأصحابِهِ - : لا تَتَمَنَّوا المُستَحِيلَ ، قالوا : ومَن يَتَمَنَّى المُستَحيلَ ؟ ! فقالَ : أنتُم ، ألَستُم تَمَنَّونَ الراحَةَ في الدنيا ؟! قالوا : بَلى‏ ، فقالَ : الراحَةُ للمُؤمِنِ في الدنيا مُستَحيلَةٌ
hadiths.english: 2683. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, addressing his companions, 'Do not wish for the impossible.' They retorted, 'Who ever wishes for the impossible?' to which he replied, 'You do. Do you not wish for comfort in this world?' They replied, 'Yes', so he (AS) said, 'Comfort is impossible for the believer to secure in this world.'

sections.section_title_en: The Divine Recommendation of Cultivation and Agriculture

hadiths.arabic: 2684. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما مِن مسلِمٍ يَغرِسُ غَرساً أو يَزرَعُ زَرعاً ، فَيَأكُلُ مِنهُ طَيرٌ أو إنسانٌ أو بَهيمِةٌ ، إلّا كانَ لَهُ بِه صَدَقةٌ
hadiths.english: 2684. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Every single Muslim that plants or cultivates anything of which humans, animals or birds may eat from is counted as charity towards them on his behalf.'

hadiths.arabic: 2685. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : كانَ أبي يقولُ : خَيرُ الأعمالِ الحَرْثُ ، تَزرَعهُ فَيَأكُلُ مِنهُ البَرُّ والفاجِرُ ، أمّا البَرُّ فَما أكَلَ مِن شي‏ءٍ استَغفَرَ لكَ ، وأمّا الفاجِرُ فما أكَلَ مِنهُ مِن شَي‏ءٍ لَعَنَهُ ، ويَأكُلُ مِنهُ البهائمُ والطَّيرُ
hadiths.english: 2685. Imam al-Baqir (AS) narrated that his father used to say, 'The best of occupations is tilling the land, the produce of which is eaten by both the good-doer and the wrongdoer. That which the good-doer eats will seek forgiveness on his [i.e. the grower's] behalf, and that which the wrongdoer eats will curse him [i.e. the wrongdoer]. The birds and animals eat thereof too.'

hadiths.arabic: 2686. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : كانَ أميرُ المؤمنينَ عليه السلام يقولُ : مَن وَجَدَ ماءً وتُراباً ثُمّ افتَقَرَ فَأبعَدَهُ اللَّهُ
hadiths.english: 2686. Imam al-Baqir (AS) narrated that Imam Ali (AS) used to say, 'He who, in spite of having water and soil at his disposal, is still poor, is dissociated by Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2687. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: الزّارِعُونَ كُنُوزُ الأنامِ، يَزرَعُونَ طَيِّباً أخرَجَهُ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ ، وهُم يومَ القِيامَةِ أحسَنُ الناسِ مَقاماً ، وأقرَبُهُم مَنزِلَةً ، يُدعَوْنَ المُبارَكِينَ
hadiths.english: 2687. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The farmers are the treasures of mankind for they plant and harvest the good things that Allah has made grow. On the Day of Resurrection, they will occupy the best and nearest position [to Allah] and will be called the blessed ones.'

hadiths.arabic: 2688. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - في قولِ اللَّه عزّوجلّ : (وعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ المُؤمِنُونَ) - : الزّارِعُونَ
hadiths.english: 2688. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said that the verse of Allah in the Qur'an:“And on Allah do the believers rely” refers to the farmers.'

hadiths.arabic: 2689. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سَأ لَهُ يزيدُ بنُ هارونَ الواسِطيُّ عنِ الفَلّاحِينَ - : هُمُ الزّارِعُونَ كُنوزَ اللَّهِ في أرضِهِ ، وما في الأعمالِ شَي‏ءٌ أحَبَّ إلى اللَّهِ مِن الزِّراعَةِ ، وما بَعَثَ اللَّهُ نبيّاً إلّا زَرّاعاً إلّا إدريسَ عليه السلام فإنّهُ كانَ خَيّاطاً
hadiths.english: 2689. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There is no occupation more beloved to Allah than agriculture, and every single prophet that Allah sent down was a farmer except Prophet Enoch (AS) who was a tailor.'

hadiths.arabic: 2690. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : ما فَرَضَ اللَّهُ عَزّ ذِكرُهُ على‏ هذهِ الاُمّةِ أشَدَّ علَيهِم مِنَ الزَّكاةِ ، وما تَهلِكُ عامَّتُهُم إلّا فيها
hadiths.english: 2690. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Allah - exalted be His remembrance - has not obligated anything more difficult for this community than paying the alms-tax, and the downfall of the majority of people lies in [their failure to pay] it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2691. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لا صلاةَ لِمَن لا زكاةَ لَهُ ، ولا زكاةَ لِمَن لا وَرَعَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 2691. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The prayer of one who does not give the alms-tax is void, and the alms-tax of the impious is void.'

hadiths.arabic: 2692. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّما وُضِعَتِ الزَّكاةُ اِختِباراً للأغنِياءِ ومَعُونَةً لِلفُقَراءِ ، ولَو أنَّ الناسَ أدَّوا زكاةَ أموالِهِم ما بَقِيَ مسلمٌ فَقيراً مُحتاجاً ، ولَاسْتَغنى‏ بما فَرَضَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ لَهُ ، وإنّ الناسَ ما افتَقَرُوا ، ولا احتاجُوا ، ولا جاعُوا ، ولا عَرُوا إلّا بِذُنوبِ الأغنياءِ
hadiths.english: 2692. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The alms-tax has been prescribed as a test for the rich and an aid to the poor. If people duly paid the alms-tax on their wealth, there would not remain a single poor or needy Muslim, and all would suffice themselves through what Allah has prescribed. Verily people are only impoverished, needy, hungry and naked as a result of the sins of the wealthy.'

sections.section_title_en: THE ROLE OF THE ALMS-TAX IN THE INCREASE OF WEALTH

hadiths.arabic: 2693. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا أرَدتَ أن يُثرِيَ اللَّهُ مالَكَ فَزَكِّهِ
hadiths.english: 2693. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If you want Allah to enrich your wealth then give the alms-tax from it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2694. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: حَصِّنُوا أموالَكُم بالزَّكاةِ
hadiths.english: 2694. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Strengthen your capital by paying the alms-tax.'

hadiths.arabic: 2695. الإمامُ الحسنُ عليه السلام : ما نَقَصَتْ زكاةٌ مِن مالٍ قَطُّ
hadiths.english: 2695. Imam al-Hasan (AS) said, 'The giving of the alms-tax never diminishes wealth.'

hadiths.arabic: 2696. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : وَجَدنا في كتابِ رسولِ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله... إذا مَنَعُوا الزَّكاةَ مَنَعَتِ الأرضُ بَرَكَتَها مِنَ الزَّرعِ والثِّمارِ والمَعادِنِ كُلِّها
hadiths.english: 2696. Imam al-Baqir (AS) narrated, 'We found the following written in the book of the Prophet (SAWA): ...When the alms-tax is withheld, the earth withholds all its yield of plants, fruits and minerals.'

hadiths.arabic: 2697. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنّ اللَّهَ عزّوجلّ وَضَعَ الزَّكاةَ قُوتاً للفُقَراءِ وتَوفِيراً لِأموالِكُم
hadiths.english: 2697. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Verily Allah has fixed the alms-tax as a provision for the poor and a proliferation of your wealth.'

hadiths.arabic: 2698. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : إذا حُبِسَتِ الزَّكاةُ ماتَتِ المَواشِي
hadiths.english: 2698. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'When the alms-tax is not paid, livestock die as a result.'

sections.section_title_en: THE ONE WHO REFUSES TO PAY THE ALMS-TAX

hadiths.arabic: 2699. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : الذي يَمنَعُ الزَّكاةَ يُحَوِّلُ اللَّهُ مالَهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ شُجاعاً مِن نارٍ لَهُ رِيمَتانِ‏ فَيُطَوِّقُهُ إيّاهُ ثُمّ يقالُ لَهُ : اِلزَمْهُ كما لَزِمَكَ في الدنيا ، وهُو قولُ اللَّهِ (سَيُطَوَّقُونَ ما بَخِلُوا بِهِ يَوم القيامة) .
hadiths.english: 2699. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'He who refuses to pay the alms-tax, on the Day of Resurrection Allah will transform his wealth into a cobra with two venom glands that will coil itself around him and be told, 'Tighten your grip on him just as he was tight-fisted with you in the world.' This is in accordance with Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“They will be collared with what they grudge...”

hadiths.arabic: 2700. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن مَنَعَ الزَّكاةَ سَألَ الرَّجعَةَ عندَ المَوتِ، وهُو قولُ اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ : (حَتّى‏ إذا جاءَ أحَدَهُمُ المَوْتُ قالَ رَبِّ ارْجِعُونِ * لَعَلِّي أعْمَلُ صالِحاً فيما تَرَكْتُ) .
hadiths.english: 2700. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Those who refuse to pay the alms-tax ask to be returned to the world at the time of death, as per Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“When death comes to one of them, he says, 'My Lord! Take me back, that I may act righteously in what I have left behind.”

hadiths.arabic: 2701. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : السُّرّاقُ ثلاثةٌ : مانعُ الزَّكاةِ ، ومُستَحِلُّ مُهُورِ النِّساءِ ، وكذلكَ مَنِ استَدانَ ولَم يَنوِ قَضاءَهُ
hadiths.english: 2701. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There are three types of people that are considered thieves: the one who refuses to pay the alms-tax, the one who spends his wife's dowry unlawfully, and the one who takes a loan with no intention to repay it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2702. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن مَنَعَ قِيراطاً مِنَ الزَّكاةِ فَلْيَمُتْ إن شاءَ يَهُوديّاً وإن شاءَ نَصرانيّاً
hadiths.english: 2702. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'He who refuses to pay [as meagre an amount as] a sixteen of a dirham in alms-tax may as well die a Jew or a Christian.'

sections.section_title_en: Those Who are Entitled to Receive THE ALMS-TAX

hadiths.arabic: 2703. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - في قولِهِ تعالى‏ : (إنّما الصَّدَقاتُ للفُقَراءِ ...) - : الفَقيرُ الذي لا يَسأ لُ الناسَ ، والمِسكينُ أجهَدُ مِنهُ ، والبائسُ أجهَدُهُم
hadiths.english: 2703. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), with regards to Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“Charities are only for the poor...” , said, 'The poor man is he who does not beg from people [despite his poverty], the destitute lives in even harsher conditions than him, and the wretched one lives in the most straitened circumstances of all.'

sections.section_title_en: There is a zakat for Everything

hadiths.arabic: 2704. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : زكاةُ القُدرَةِ ، الإنصافُ
hadiths.english: 2704. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The zakat of power is equity.'

hadiths.arabic: 2705. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : زكاةُ الجَمالِ ، العَفافُ
hadiths.english: 2705. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The zakat of beauty is chastity.'

hadiths.arabic: 2706. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : زكاةُ اليَسارِ ، بِرُّ الجِيرانِ وصِلَةُ الأرحامِ
hadiths.english: 2706. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The zakat of prosperity is goodness to one's neighbours and maintaining relations with one's kin.'

hadiths.arabic: 2707. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : زكاةُ الصِّحَّةِ ، السَّعيُ في طاعَةِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2707. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The zakat of health is exerting oneself in Allah's obedience.'

hadiths.arabic: 2708. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : زكاةُ الشَّجاعةِ ، الجِهادُ في سبيلِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 2708. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The zakat of courage is fighting in the way of Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2709. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : علَيكَ بالصَّومِ ؛ فَإنّهُ زكاةُ البَدَنِ
hadiths.english: 2709. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Fast, for that is the zakat of the body.'

hadiths.arabic: 2710. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّ لِكُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ زكاةً ، وزكاةُ العِلمِ أن يُعَلِّمَهُ أهلَهُ
hadiths.english: 2710. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Verily upon everything is its zakat, and the zakat of knowledge is to teach it to those who are worthy of it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2711. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : المَعروفُ زكاةُ النِّعَمِ ، والشَّفاعةُ زكاةُ الجاهِ ، والعِلَلُ زكاةُ الأبدانِ ، والعَفوُ زَكاةُ الظَّفَرِ ، وما أدّيتَ زكاتَهُ فهُو مَأمونُ السَّلْبِ
hadiths.english: 2711. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Good moral conduct is the zakat of bounties, intercession is the zakat of high status, ailments are the zakat of the body, amnesty is the zakat of victory, and all that you give out zakat on is protected from being snatched away from you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2712. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن أدّى‏ زكاةَ الفِطرَةِ تَمَّمَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بها ما نَقَصَ مِن زكاةِ مالِهِ
hadiths.english: 2712. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who pays the obligatory alms-tax at the end of Ramadan, Allah uses it to make up for any deficit in the alms-tax paid on his wealth.'

hadiths.arabic: 2713. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ مِن تَمامِ الصَّومِ إعطاءَ الزَّكاةِ - يعني الفِطرَةَ - كما أنَّ الصَّلاةَ على النبِيّ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله مِن تَمامِ الصّلاةِ ، لأ نّه مَن صامَ ولَم يُؤَدِّ الزَّكاةَ فلا صَومَ لَهُ إذا تَرَكَها مُتَعَمِّداً
hadiths.english: 2713. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Giving the alms-tax at the end of the month of Ramadan completes and constitutes fasting just as sending blessings on the Prophet (SAWA) at the end of the prayer completes and constitutes the prayer. Verily the one who fasts and yet intentionally does not pay the alms-tax due, his fasting is invalid.'

hadiths.arabic: 2714. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : حَسْبُ المَرءِ مِن عِرفانِهِ ، عِلمُهُ بِزَمانِهِ
hadiths.english: 2714. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The worth of a man with regard to his perception of things is his knowledge of time.'

hadiths.arabic: 2715. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أعرَفُ الناسِ بالزّمانِ ، مَن لَم يَتَعَجَّبْ مِن أحداثِهِ
hadiths.english: 2715. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The man who best understands time is he who is not taken aback by its proceedings.'

hadiths.arabic: 2716. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : العالِمُ بِزَمانِهِ ، لا تَهجُمُ علَيهِ اللَّوابِسُ
hadiths.english: 2716. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'He who knows [the workings of] his time is never overwhelmed by its obscurities.'

hadiths.arabic: 2717. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن وَثِقَ بِالزَّمانِ صُرِعَ
hadiths.english: 2717. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who places his trust in time has gone mad.'

hadiths.arabic: 2718. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن أمَنَ الزَمانَ خانَهُ ، ومَن أعظَمَهُ أهانَهُ
hadiths.english: 2718. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever trusts time is betrayed by it, and whoever holds it in high esteem is abased by it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2719. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن أمَنَ الزَّمانَ خانَهُ ، ومَن تَعَظَّمَ علَيهِ أهانَهُ ، ومَن تَرَغَّمَ علَيهِ أرغَمَهُ ، ومَن لَجَأَ إلَيهِ أسلَمَهُ ، ولَيسَ كُلُّ مَن رَمى‏ أصابَ ، وإذا تَغَيَّرَ السُّلطانُ تَغَيَّرَ الزَّمانُ
hadiths.english: 2719. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever trusts time is betrayed by it, whoever attaches great importance to it is abased by it, whoever is angry with time, it spites him even more, and whoever takes refuge with time is forsaken by it. Not everyone who throws hits the target. When the sultan changes so does the time.'

hadiths.arabic: 2720. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزَّمانُ يَخُونُ صاحِبَهُ ، ولا يَستَعتِبُ لِمَن عاتَبَهُ
hadiths.english: 2720. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Time betrays the one who believes he possesses time, and it does not seek to please the one who blames it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2721. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن تَشاغَلَ بالزَّمانِ شَغَلَهُ
hadiths.english: 2721. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever preoccupies himself with time is occupied by it in turn.'

hadiths.arabic: 2722. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: مَن عَتَبَ عَلى الزمانِ طالَت مَعتَبَتُهُ
hadiths.english: 2722. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who blames time will find no end to his frustration.'

hadiths.arabic: 2723. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن عانَدَ الزَّمانَ أرغَمَهُ ، ومَنِ استَسلَمَ إلَيهِ لَم يَسلَمْ
hadiths.english: 2723. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever resists time is spited by it even more, and whoever surrenders to it is not safe either.'

hadiths.arabic: 2724. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن كابَرَ الزَّمانَ عَطِبَ ، ومن يَنقِمْ علَيهِ غَضِبَ
hadiths.english: 2724. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Whoever contends with time is thwarted, and whoever is resentful towards it ends up getting angry himself.'

hadiths.arabic: 2726. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اِشتَدَّ غَضَبُ اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ عَلَى امرأةٍ ذاتِ بَعلٍ مَلَأتْ عَينَها مِن غَيرِ زَوجِها أو غَيرِ ذِي مَحرَمٍ مِنها ، فإنّها إن فَعَلَتْ ذلكَ أحبَطَ اللَّهُ كُلَّ عَمَلٍ عَمِلَتهُ ، فإن أوطَأتْ فِراشَهُ غَيرَهُ كانَ حَقّاً عَلَى‏اللَّهِ أن‏يُحرِقَها بِالنارِ بعدَ أن يُعَذِّبَها في قَبرِها
hadiths.english: 2726. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Allah's wrath is indeed severe on the married woman who fills her eyes with desire for men other than her husband or looks lustfully at anyone other than her unmarriageable kin [i.e. husband], upon which Allah thwarts every single good deed she has ever committed. And if she welcomes anyone other than her husband in his bed, Allah will rightfully burn her in the Fire after He has chastised her in her grave.'

hadiths.arabic: 2727. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما زَنى‏ غَيُورٌ قَطُّ
hadiths.english: 2727. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'A man who is possessive [over his own wife] will never commit adultery.'

hadiths.arabic: 2728. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّ أشَدَّ الناسِ عَذاباً يَومَ القِيامَةِ رَجُلٌ أقَرَّ نُطفَتَهُ في رَحِمٍ تَحْرُمُ علَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2728. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The one to face the severest punishment on the Day of Resurrection will be the man who deposited his sperm in a womb that was forbidden to him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2729. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : حُرِّمَ الزِّنا لِما فيهِ مِنَ الفَسادِ مِن قَتلِ الأنفُسِ ، وذَهابِ الأنسابِ ، وتَركِ التَّربيَةِ للأطفالِ ، وفَسادِ المَوارِيثِ ، وما أشبَهَ ذلكَ مِن وُجُوهِ الفَسادِ
hadiths.english: 2729. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'Fornication has been prohibited due to the corruption it engenders, from murder to illegitimacy to ill-breeding of children to broken lineages and all sorts of other social ills.'

hadiths.arabic: 2730. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يا عليُّ في الزِّنا سِتُّ خِصالٍ : ثلاثٌ مِنها في‏الدنيا وثلاثٌ في الآخِرَةِ ، فأمّا التي في الدنيا فَيَذهَبُ بالبَهاءِ ، ويُعَجِّلُ الفَناءَ ، ويَقطَعُ الرِّزقَ ، وأمّا التي في الآخِرَةِ فَسُوءُ الحِسابِ ، وسَخَطُ الرحمنِ ، والخُلُودُ في النارِ
hadiths.english: 2730. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O Ali, there are six consequences that result from fornication, three of which are in this world and three in the Hereafter. In this world, it takes away one's beauty, hastens one's death and cuts off one's sustenance. In the Hereafter, it results in an evil reckoning, solicits the indignation of the Merciful Himself and makes one deserving of eternity in the Fire.'

hadiths.arabic: 2731. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزِّنا يُورِثُ الفَقرَ
hadiths.english: 2731. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Fornication brings about poverty.'

hadiths.arabic: 2732. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : وَجَدْنا في كتابِ رسولِ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا ظَهَرَ الزِّنا مِن بَعدِي كَثُرَ مَوتُ الفَجْأةِ
hadiths.english: 2732. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'We found written in the book of the Prophet (SAWA), 'If fornication prevails after my death, incidences of sudden death will increase.'

hadiths.arabic: 2733. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إذا فَشا الزِّنا ظَهَرَتِ الزَّلازِلُ
hadiths.english: 2733. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'When fornication becomes widespread earthquakes occur as an upshot.'

sections.section_title_en: EVERY LIMB HAS ITS OWN SHARE OF FORNICATION

hadiths.arabic: 2734. المسيحُ عليه السلام: أيُّما امرأةٍ استَعطَرَتْ وخَرَجَتْ لِيُوجَدَ رِيحُها فهِي زانِيَةٌ ، وكُلُّ عَينٍ زانِيَةٌ
hadiths.english: 2734. Prophet Jesus (AS) said, 'Every woman that perfumes herself and leaves her house intending for her perfume to be sensed by others is an adulteress, and every eye [that looks lustfully] is fornicating.'

hadiths.arabic: 2735. المسيحُ عليه السلام : لا تَكُونَنَّ حَديدَ النَّظَرِ إلى‏ ما لَيسَ لكَ فإنّهُ لَن يَزنِي فَرجُكَ ما حَفِظتَ عَينَكَ ، فإن قَدَرتَ أن لا تَنظُرَ إلى‏ ثَوبِ المرأةِ التي لا تَحِلُّ لكَ فافعَل
hadiths.english: 2735. Prophet Jesus (AS) said, 'Do not look intently at one who does not belong to you, for verily your genitals will not commit fornication as long as you guard your gaze [from fornicating]. So if you are able to keep yourself from looking at the apparel of a woman who is not permitted to you, then do so.'

hadiths.arabic: 2736. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : عَلى‏ كُلِّ نَفَسٍ مِن بَني آدَمَ كُتِبَ حَظٌّ مِنَ الزِّنا أدرَكَ ذلكَ لا محالَةَ ، فالعَينُ زِناها النَّظَرُ ، والرِّجلُ زِناها المَشيُ ، والاُذُنُ زِناها الاستِماعُ
hadiths.english: 2736. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Every breath of man has its share in fornication which he is inevitably aware of at the time. The fornication of the eye is to look [at that which is forbidden to it], and the fornication of the foot is to walk [to where it is forbidden for it], and for the ear to listen [to that which is forbidden].

hadiths.arabic: 2737. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما تَعَبَّدُوا للَّهِ‏ِ بشَي‏ءٍ مِثلِ الزُّهدِ في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2737. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'People cannot worship Allah with anything better than asceticism from worldly pleasures.'

hadiths.arabic: 2738. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزُّهدُ شِيمَةُ المُتَّقِينَ وسَجِيَّةُ الأوّابِينَ
hadiths.english: 2738. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Asceticism is the distinguishing characteristic of Godwary people and the natural disposition of those who turn to Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2739. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنَّ مِن أعوَنِ الأخلاقِ على الدِّينِ الزُّهدَ في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2739. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily among the qualities that greatly develop one's faith is abstention from worldly pleasures.'

hadiths.arabic: 2740. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : كانَ فيما ناجَى اللَّهُ به موسى‏ عليه السلام : ما تَزَيَّنَ لي المُتَزَيِّنُونَ بمِثلِ الزُّهدِ في الدنيا عَمّا بِهِمُ الغِنى‏ عنه
hadiths.english: 2740. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'In one of His conversations with Prophet Moses (AS), Allah told him the following, '...those who seek to adorn themselves [for Me] have no better apparel than abstention from the worldly pleasures that they find indispensable.'

hadiths.arabic: 2741. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : جُعِلَ الخَيرُ كُلُّهُ في بَيتٍ ، وجُعِلَ مِفتاحُهُ الزُّهدَ في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2741. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'All goodness has been placed in one house, and its key is asceticism and restraint from worldly pleasures.'

hadiths.arabic: 2742. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الزُّهدُ في الدنيا قَصرُ الأمَلِ، وشُكرُ كُلِّ نِعمَةٍ ، والوَرَعُ عن كُلِّ ما حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ
hadiths.english: 2742. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Asceticism from worldly pleasures means to cut short one's hopes of this world, to be grateful for every single bounty, to have piety and to keep away from all that which Allah has prohibited.'

hadiths.arabic: 2743. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الزُّهدُ لَيسَ بتَحريمِ الحَلالِ ، ولكنْ أن يكونَ بما في يَدَيِ اللَّهِ أوثَقَ مِنهُ بما في يَدَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2743. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Asceticism is not to prohibit oneself that which is allowed. Rather it is to find that which is with Allah more secure than that which is in one's own possession.'

hadiths.arabic: 2744. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزُّهدُ كَلِمَةٌ بينَ كَلِمَتَينِ ، قالَ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ : (لِكَيْلا تَأْسَوا عَلَى‏ ما فاتَكُمْ وَلا تَفْرَحُوا بِما آتاكُمْ واللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتالٍ فَخُورٍ ) فَمَن لَم يَأسَ على الماضِي ، ولَم يَفرَحْ بالآتي فقد أخَذَ الزُّهدَ بِطَرَفَيهِ
hadiths.english: 2744. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Asceticism is summed up between two phrases in the Qur'an, where Allah, most High, says,“So that you may not grieve for what has escaped you, nor be exultant at what He has given you.” Therefore, one who neither grieves about past losses nor is overjoyed about the possessions he is granted has perfected his asceticism from both sides.'

hadiths.arabic: 2745. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الزُّهدُ مِفتاحُ بابِ الآخِرَةِ ، والبَراءةِ مِنَ النارِ ، وهُو تَركُكَ كُلَّ شي‏ءٍ يَشغَلُكَ عنِ اللَّهِ ، مِن غَيرِ تَأسُّفٍ على فَوتِها ، ولا إعجابٍ في تَركِها ، ولا انتِظارِ فَرَجٍ مِنها ، ولا طَلَبِ مَحمَدَةٍ علَيها ، ولا عِوَضٍ مِنها ، بل تَرى‏ فَوتَها راحَةً وكَونَها آفَةً ، وتكونُ أبداً هارِباً مِنَ الآفَةِ ، مُعتَصِماً بِالرّاحَةِ
hadiths.english: 2745. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Asceticism is the key to the door of the Hereafter and immunity from the Fire, and it is to abandon all those things that preoccupy you from Allah, neither experiencing regret upon their loss, nor self-admiration for having abandoned them, nor awaiting deliverance from them, nor seeking praise on account of them, and nor anything else in exchange for them. Rather you see their loss as a source of comfort and their presence as a source of misfortune, such that you consistently run away from misfortune and seek refuge in comfort.'

sections.section_title_en: QUALITIES OF THE ONE WHO PRACTICES ASCETICISM

hadiths.arabic: 2746. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزاهدُ في الدنيا مَن لَم يَغلِبِ الحَرامُ صَبرَهُ ، ولَم يَشغَلِ الحَلالُ شُكرَهُ
hadiths.english: 2746. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The one who practices asceticism from worldly pleasures is such that he neither allows the prohibited things to overcome his perseverance [in the way of Allah], nor the permissible things to distract him from gratefulness to Allah.'

hadiths.arabic: 2747. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّ الزاهِدينَ في الدنيا تَبكِي قلُوبُهُم وإن ضَحِكُوا ، ويَشتَدُّ حُزنُهُم وإن فَرِحُوا ، ويَكثُرُ مَقتُهُم أنفُسَهُم ، وإنِ اغتَبَطُوا بما رُزِقُوا
hadiths.english: 2747. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Those who restrain themselves from worldly pleasures are such that their hearts are weeping though outwardly they may laugh, they experience great sorrow though they display joy, and they are filled with self-contempt though they rejoice at all that they have been bestowed.'

hadiths.arabic: 2748. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام لمّا سُئلَ عن الزاهِدِ في الدنيا - : الذي يَترُكُ حَلالَها مخافَةَ حِسابِهِ ، ويَترُكُ حَرامَها مَخافَةَ عَذابِهِ
hadiths.english: 2748. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), when asked to define the ascetic, said, 'The ascetic is the one who renounces the permissible things in this world for fear of having to account for them, and renounces the forbidden things of this world for fear of punishment for them.'

hadiths.arabic: 2749. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عن صِفَةِ الزاهِدِ - : مُتَبَلِّغٌ بِدُونِ قُوتِهِ ، مُستَعِدٌّ لِيَومِ مَوتِهِ ، مُتَبَرِّمٌ بحَياتِهِ
hadiths.english: 2749. Imam al-Rida (AS), when asked about the qualities of the ascetic, replied, 'He manages to still his hunger without pursuit of food, he is well-prepared for his death, and weary of his life in this world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2750. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أحَقُّ الناسِ بالزَّهادَةِ مَن عَرَفَ نَقصَ الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2750. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The person best able to practice abstemiousness is he who understands the inferiority of this worldly life.'

hadiths.arabic: 2751. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كيفَ يَزهَدُ في الدنيا مَن لا يَعرِفُ قَدرَ الآخِرَةِ ؟ !
hadiths.english: 2751. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'How can one renounce the pleasures of this world when he has not yet fathomed the worth of the Hereafter?!'

hadiths.arabic: 2752. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : أكثِرْ ذِكرَ المَوتِ ، فإنّهُ لَم‏يُكثِرْ إنسانٌ ذِكرَ المَوتِ إلّا زَهِدَ في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2752. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Remember death frequently, for no sooner does man increase his remembrance of death than he begins to renounce this world's life.'

hadiths.arabic: 2753. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام عند قبرٍ حَضَرَهُ - : إنَّ شيئاً هذا آخِرُهُ لَحَقِيقٌ أن يُزهَدَ في أوَّلِهِ ، وإنَّ شيئاً هذا أوَّلُهُ لَحَقِيقٌ أن يُخافَ آخِرُهُ
hadiths.english: 2753. Imam al-Kazim (AS) once said while standing at a graveside, 'Indeed something that ends with this [i.e. death] is worthy of its beginning being spent in abstemiousness. And indeed something that begins with this is worthy of its end being feared with apprehension.'

hadiths.arabic: 2754. الإمامُ العسكريُّ عليه السلام : لَو عَقَلَ أهلُ الدنيا خَرِبَتْ
hadiths.english: 2754. Imam al-Askari (AS) said, 'If the inhabitants of this world used their intellect, the world would self-destruct [for it would cease to be of any importance].'

hadiths.arabic: 2755. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الزُّهدُ في الدنيا يُرِيحُ القَلبَ والبَدَنَ ، والرَّغبَةُ فيها تُتعِبُ القَلبَ والبَدَنَ
hadiths.english: 2755. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Abstaining from the vain pleasures of this world puts the heart and the body at rest, whereas longing for them exhausts the heart and the body.'

hadiths.arabic: 2756. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن زَهِدَ في الدنيا ، ولم يَجزَعْ مِن ذُلِّها ، ولَم يُنافِسْ في عِزِّها ، هَداهُ اللَّهُ بغَيرِ هِدايَةٍ مِن مَخلوقٍ ، وعَلَّمَهُ بغَيرِ تَعلِيمٍ ، وأثبَتَ الحِكمَةَ في صَدرِهِ وأجراها على‏ لِسانِهِ
hadiths.english: 2756. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who renounces this worldly life, neither concerning himself with its baseness nor vying for its glory, Allah rewards him with a gift that is unobtainable through any of His creatures, grants him knowledge without the need for learning, secures wisdom in his heart and makes it flow upon his tongue.'

hadiths.arabic: 2757. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِزهَدْ في الدنيا تَنزِلْ علَيكَ الرَّحمَةُ
hadiths.english: 2757. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Abstain from the vain pleasures of this world and divine mercy will descend upon you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2758. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزهدُ في الدنيا الراحَةُ العُظمى‏
hadiths.english: 2758. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Abstaining from the vain pleasures of this world is the greatest source of comfort.'

hadiths.arabic: 2759. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : مَن زَهِدَ في الدنيا هانَتْ علَيهِ مَصائبُها ولم يَكرَهْها
hadiths.english: 2759. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'He who renounces the world's vain pleasures finds its afflictions trivial and is not bothered by them as a result.'

hadiths.arabic: 2760. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : حَرامٌ على‏ قُلوبِكُم أن تَعرِفَ حَلاوَةَ الإيمانِ حتّى‏ تَزهَدَ في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2760. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'It is forbidden for your hearts that they should taste the sweetness of faith until and unless they abstain from the pleasures of this world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2761. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أزهَدُ الناسِ مَنِ اجتَنَبَ الحَرامَ
hadiths.english: 2761. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The most abstemious of people is he who renounces the prohibited things.'

hadiths.arabic: 2762. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا تَكُنْ مِمَّن يُرِيدُ الآخِرَةَ بِعَمَلِ الدنيا يقولُ في الدنيا قَولَ الزاهِدينَ ، ويَعمَلُ فيها عَمَلَ الراغِبِينَ
hadiths.english: 2762. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Do not be of those who try to secure the Hereafter by means of the worldly life...they disparage this world using ascetic terms, yet act like those who covet it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2763. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ الزُّهدِ إخفاءُ الزُّهدِ
hadiths.english: 2763. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The best level of asceticism is to conceal one's asceticism.'

hadiths.arabic: 2764. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا هَرَبَ الزاهدُ مِنَ الناسِ فاطْلُبْهُ ، إذا طَلَبَ الزاهدُ الناسَ فاهْرُبْ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 2764. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'When an abstemious person flees from people, seek after him, and when he seeks after people, flee from him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2765. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : يقولُ اللَّهُ : يا ابنَ آدَمَ ، اِرْضَ بما آتَيتُكَ تَكُن مِن أزهَدِ الناسِ
hadiths.english: 2765. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'Allah says, 'O son of Adam, be satisfied with what I have given you and you will be among the most abstemious of people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2766. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنّ أصبَرَكُم على البَلاءِ لَأزهَدُكُم في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2766. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Verily he who is most persevering in the face of adversity is the most abstemious from among you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2755. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الزُّهدُ في الدنيا يُرِيحُ القَلبَ والبَدَنَ ، والرَّغبَةُ فيها تُتعِبُ القَلبَ والبَدَنَ
hadiths.english: 2755. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Abstaining from the vain pleasures of this world puts the heart and the body at rest, whereas longing for them exhausts the heart and the body.'

hadiths.arabic: 2756. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن زَهِدَ في الدنيا ، ولم يَجزَعْ مِن ذُلِّها ، ولَم يُنافِسْ في عِزِّها ، هَداهُ اللَّهُ بغَيرِ هِدايَةٍ مِن مَخلوقٍ ، وعَلَّمَهُ بغَيرِ تَعلِيمٍ ، وأثبَتَ الحِكمَةَ في صَدرِهِ وأجراها على‏ لِسانِهِ
hadiths.english: 2756. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who renounces this worldly life, neither concerning himself with its baseness nor vying for its glory, Allah rewards him with a gift that is unobtainable through any of His creatures, grants him knowledge without the need for learning, secures wisdom in his heart and makes it flow upon his tongue.'

hadiths.arabic: 2757. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِزهَدْ في الدنيا تَنزِلْ علَيكَ الرَّحمَةُ
hadiths.english: 2757. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Abstain from the vain pleasures of this world and divine mercy will descend upon you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2758. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الزهدُ في الدنيا الراحَةُ العُظمى‏
hadiths.english: 2758. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Abstaining from the vain pleasures of this world is the greatest source of comfort.'

hadiths.arabic: 2759. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : مَن زَهِدَ في الدنيا هانَتْ علَيهِ مَصائبُها ولم يَكرَهْها
hadiths.english: 2759. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'He who renounces the world's vain pleasures finds its afflictions trivial and is not bothered by them as a result.'

hadiths.arabic: 2760. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : حَرامٌ على‏ قُلوبِكُم أن تَعرِفَ حَلاوَةَ الإيمانِ حتّى‏ تَزهَدَ في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2760. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'It is forbidden for your hearts that they should taste the sweetness of faith until and unless they abstain from the pleasures of this world.'

hadiths.arabic: 2761. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أزهَدُ الناسِ مَنِ اجتَنَبَ الحَرامَ
hadiths.english: 2761. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The most abstemious of people is he who renounces the prohibited things.'

hadiths.arabic: 2762. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا تَكُنْ مِمَّن يُرِيدُ الآخِرَةَ بِعَمَلِ الدنيا يقولُ في الدنيا قَولَ الزاهِدينَ ، ويَعمَلُ فيها عَمَلَ الراغِبِينَ
hadiths.english: 2762. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Do not be of those who try to secure the Hereafter by means of the worldly life...they disparage this world using ascetic terms, yet act like those who covet it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2763. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ الزُّهدِ إخفاءُ الزُّهدِ
hadiths.english: 2763. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The best level of asceticism is to conceal one's asceticism.'

hadiths.arabic: 2764. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا هَرَبَ الزاهدُ مِنَ الناسِ فاطْلُبْهُ ، إذا طَلَبَ الزاهدُ الناسَ فاهْرُبْ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 2764. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'When an abstemious person flees from people, seek after him, and when he seeks after people, flee from him.'

hadiths.arabic: 2765. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : يقولُ اللَّهُ : يا ابنَ آدَمَ ، اِرْضَ بما آتَيتُكَ تَكُن مِن أزهَدِ الناسِ
hadiths.english: 2765. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'Allah says, 'O son of Adam, be satisfied with what I have given you and you will be among the most abstemious of people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2766. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنّ أصبَرَكُم على البَلاءِ لَأزهَدُكُم في الدنيا
hadiths.english: 2766. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Verily he who is most persevering in the face of adversity is the most abstemious from among you.'

hadiths.arabic: 2767. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أحَبَّ أن يَلقَى اللَّهَ طاهِراً مُطَهَّراً فَلْيَلْقَهُ بزَوجَةٍ
hadiths.english: 2767. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever wants to meet Allah pure and immaculate should meet him accompanied by a wife.'

hadiths.arabic: 2768. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما بُنِيَ في الإسلامِ بِناءٌ أحَبَّ إلى اللَّهِ عزّوجلّ ، وأعَزَّ مِنَ التَّزويجِ
hadiths.english: 2768. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There is no institution in Islam more beloved and dearer to Allah than marriage.'

hadiths.arabic: 2769. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : النِّكاحُ سُنَّتِي ، فَمَن رَغِبَ عَن سُنَّتي فَلَيسَ مِنّي
hadiths.english: 2769. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Marriage is my practice, so whoever rejects my practice is not from me.'

hadiths.arabic: 2770. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما مِن شابٍّ تَزَوَّجَ في حَداثَةِ سِنِّهِ إلّا عَجَّ شَيطانُهُ : يا وَيْلَهُ ، يا وَيْلَهُ ! عَصَمَ مِنّي ثُلُثَي دِينِهِ ، فَلْيَتَّقِ اللَّهَ العَبدُ في‏الثُّلُثِ الباقِي
hadiths.english: 2770. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When any young person gets married at the prime of his youth, his inner Satan cries out in rage, 'Woe unto him! Woe unto him! Two thirds of his faith have now been secured against me, and he has only to be careful of his duty to Allah in the remaining third.'

hadiths.arabic: 2771. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا تَزَوَّجَ العَبدُ فقدِ استَكمَلَ نِصفَ الدينِ ، فَلْيَتَّقِ اللَّهَ في النِّصفِ الباقي
hadiths.english: 2771. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When the servant gets married, he has completed half of his faith, so let him be careful of his duty to Allah in the remaining half.'

hadiths.arabic: 2772. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : المُتَزَوِّجُ النائمُ أفضَلُ عِندَ اللَّهِ مِنَ الصائمِ القائمِ العَزَبِ
hadiths.english: 2772. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A married person sleeping is better in the sight of Allah than an unmarried person who fasts and spends his night prayer.'

hadiths.arabic: 2773. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اِتَّخِذُوا الأهلَ ؛ فإنّه أرْزَقُ لَكُم
hadiths.english: 2773. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Take up a wife for verily that will bring about an increase in your sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 2774. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : زَوِّجُوا أياماكُم ، فَإنَّ اللَّهَ يُحسِنُ لَهُم في أخلاقِهِم ، ويُوَسِّعُ لَهُم في‏ أرزاقِهِم ، ويَزِيدُهُم في مُرُوّاتِهِم
hadiths.english: 2774. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Marry those who are single among you for verily Allah will develop their moral traits [through marriage], He will increase their sustenance for them, and will enhance their integrity and gallantry.'

hadiths.arabic: 2775. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : رَكعَتانِ يُصَلّيهِما مُتَزَوِّجٌ أفضَلُ مِن سَبعينَ رَكعَةً يُصَلِّيها غيرُ مُتَزَوِّجٍ
hadiths.english: 2775. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'A two-unit prayer performed by a married person is better than seventy units performed by an unmarried person.'

hadiths.arabic: 2776. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : شِرارُ مَوتاكُمُ العُزّابُ
hadiths.english: 2776. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The worst ones from among your dead are the single people.'

hadiths.arabic: 2777. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : شِرارُكُم عُزّابُكُم ، رَكعَتانِ مِن مُتَأهِّلٍ خَيرٌ مِن سَبعِينَ ركعةً مِن غَيرِ مُتَأهِّلٍ
hadiths.english: 2777. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The worst ones from among you are the single ones - two units of prayer performed by a married person is better than seventy units performed by an unmarried person.'

sections.section_title_en: THE REWARD FOR GETTING FELLOW MUSLIMS MARRIED

hadiths.arabic: 2778. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن زَوَّجَ أعزَباً كانَ مِمَّن يَنظُرُ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ إلَيهِ يَومَ القِيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 2778. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'He who arranges for a single person to get married will be amongst those whom Allah will regard [with mercy] on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.arabic: 2779. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : ثلاثةٌ يَستَظِلُّونَ بِظِلِّ عَرشِ اللَّهِ يَومَ لا ظِلَّ إلّا ظِلُّهُ : رَجُلٌ زَوَّجَ أخاهُ المسلمَ ، أو أخدَمَهُ ، أو كَتَمَ لَهُ سِرّاً
hadiths.english: 2779. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'There are three types of people who will be shaded by Allah's Throne on the Day when no shade will avail apart from it: the one who arranged the marriage of a fellow Muslim brother, or served him in some way, or concealed his Muslim brother's faults [from others].'

sections.section_title_ar: الحثّ على التعجيل في تَزويجِ البَناتِ‏
sections.section_title_en: Enjoinment of Urgency in THE MARRIAGE OF YOUNG WOMEN

hadiths.arabic: 2780. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : نَزَلَ جَبرئيلُ على النبِيّ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله فقالَ : يا محمّدُ ، إنّ رَبَّكَ يُقرِئُكَ السلامَ ، ويقولُ : إنّ الأبكارَ مِنَ النساءِ بمَنزِلَةِ الثَّمَرِ على الشَّجَرِ ، فإذا أينَعَ الثَّمرُ فلا دَواءَ لَهُ إلّا اجتِناؤهُ وإلّا أفسَدَتْهُ الشَّمسُ ، وغَيَّرَتْهُ الرِّيحُ ، وإنّ الأبكارَ إذا أدرَكنَ ما تُدرِكُ النساءُ فلا دَواءَلَهُنَ‏إلّا البُعُولُ، وإلّا لَم يُؤمَنْ علَيهِنَّ الفِتنَةُ ، فَصَعِدَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله المِنبَرَ فَجَمَعَ الناسَ ثُمّ أعلَمَهُم ما أمَرَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ بِهِ
hadiths.english: 2780. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'The archangel Gabriel descended to the Prophet (SAWA) and told him, 'O Muhammad, verily your Lord extends salutations on you and says, 'Verily the virgins from among your women are as fruits on a tree, which when they ripen must be plucked otherwise the sun rots them and the wind alters them. So when young women reach marriageable age, they have no other recourse apart from husbands, otherwise they will not be safe from corruption.' The Prophet (SAWA) then climbed the pulpit, gathered the people and informed them of what Allah had commanded him.'

sections.section_title_en: The Importance of Faith WHEN SELECTING A SPOUSE

hadiths.arabic: 2781. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن تَزَوَّجَ امرَأةً لا يَتَزَوَّجُها إلّا لِجَمالِها لَم يَرَ فيها ما يُحِبُّ ، ومَن تَزَوَّجَها لِمالِها لا يَتَزَوَّجُها إلّا وَكَلَهُ اللَّهُ إلَيهِ ، فعلَيكُم بذاتِ الدِّينِ
hadiths.english: 2781. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He who marries a woman solely for her beauty will not find anything he likes in her, he who marries her for her wealth will be deprived of it as soon as he marries her, so look to marry women of faith.'

hadiths.arabic: 2782. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا يُختارُ حُسنُ وَجهِ المَرأةِ على‏ حسُنِ دِينِها
hadiths.english: 2782. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The beauty of a woman's faith must be given priority over the beauty of her face.'

hadiths.arabic: 2783. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا جاءَكُم مَن تَرضَونَ دِينَهُ وأمانَتَهُ يَخطُبُ (إلَيكُم) فَزَوِّجُوهُ ، إن لا تَفعَلُوهُ تَكُن فِتنَةٌ في الأرضِ وفَسادٌ كبيرٌ
hadiths.english: 2783. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When someone comes to you with a proposal and you are well-pleased with his faith and his integrity then accept him in marriage, for if you do not, discord and corruption will prevail in the land.'

hadiths.arabic: 2784. الإمامُ الحسنُ عليه السلام - لرجل جاءَ إلَيهِ يَستَشِيرُهُ في تَزويجِ ابنَتِهِ - : زَوِّجْها مِن رَجُلٍ تَقِيٍّ ، فإنّهُ إن أحَبَّها أكرَمَها وإن أبغَضَها لَم يَظلِمْها
hadiths.english: 2784. Imam al-Hasan (AS) said to man who came to ask his advice about getting his daughter married, 'Marry her to a pious man, for if he loves her he will honour her, and if he comes to dislike her, at least he will not be unjust towards her.'

sections.section_title_en: THE CENSURE OF DEMANDING AN EXCESSIVE DOWRY

hadiths.arabic: 2785. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أفضَلُ نِساءِ اُمَّتِي أصبَحُهُنَّ وَجهاً وأقَلُّهُنَّ مَهراً
hadiths.english: 2785. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The best women of my community are those that have the prettiest faces and the smallest dowries.'

hadiths.arabic: 2786. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : خَيرُ الصَّداقِ أيسَرُهُ
hadiths.english: 2786. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The best dowry is the simplest one.'

hadiths.arabic: 2787. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أمّا شُؤمُ المَرأةِ فكَثرَةُ مَهرِها وعُقوقُ زَوجِها
hadiths.english: 2787. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The bane of a woman is her excessive dowry and her disrespect of her husband.'

sections.section_title_en: The Importance of Being Careful IN SELECTING WIFE

hadiths.arabic: 2788. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: تَزَوَّجُوا في الحِجْزِ الصالِحِ، فإنّ العِرْقَ دَسّاسٌ
hadiths.english: 2788. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Marry into a good tribe for verily blood is effective [traits and characteristics are inherited].'

hadiths.arabic: 2789. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : تَخَيَّرُوا لِنُطَفِكُم ، فإنَّ النساءَ يَلِدْنَ أشباهَ إخوانِهِنَّ وأخَواتِهِنَّ
hadiths.english: 2789. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Choose carefully for your seed, for verily women give birth to children who resemble their own brothers and sisters.'

hadiths.arabic: 2790. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عن آبائهِ عليهم السلام : أنّ رسولَ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله قالَ لِلنّاسِ : إيّاكُم وخَضْراءَ الدِّمَنِ ، قيلَ : يا رسولَ اللَّهِ، وما خَضراءُ الدِّمَنِ ؟ قالَ : المَرأةُ الحَسناءُ في مَنبِتِ السُّوءِ
hadiths.english: 2790. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The Prophet (SAWA) addressing the people, saying, 'Beware of the verdure that grows in manure.' He was asked, 'What is the verdure that grows in manure?' He replied, 'It is a beautiful woman that comes from an evil environment.'

hadiths.arabic: 2791. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إيّاكُم وتَزَوُّجَ الحَمْقاءِ ، فإنَّ صُحبَتَها ضَياعٌ ووُلْدَها ضِباعٌ
hadiths.english: 2791. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Beware of marrying a stupid girl for her company is a waste and her offspring are [like] hyenas.'

hadiths.arabic: 2792. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أعظَمُ الناسِ حَقّاً على المرأةِ زَوجُها ، وأعظَمُ الناسِ حقّاً عَلَى الرَّجُلِ اُمُّهُ
hadiths.english: 2792. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The person with the greatest right over a woman is her husband, and the person with the greatest right over a man is his mother.'

hadiths.arabic: 2793. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ويلٌ لِامرَأةٍ أغضَبَتْ زَوجَها ، وطُوبى‏ لِامرَأةٍ رَضِيَ عنها زَوجُها
hadiths.english: 2793. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Woe unto the woman who angers her husband, and blessed is the woman whose husband is pleased with her.'

hadiths.arabic: 2794. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : لا شَفيعَ للمرأةِ أنجَحُ عِند رَبِّها مِن رِضا زَوجِها
hadiths.english: 2794. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'There is no interceder for a woman more efficient with her Lord than the content of her spouse.'

hadiths.arabic: 2795. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما زالَ جَبرَئيلُ يُوصِينِي بالمرأةِ حتّى‏ ظَنَنتُ أ نَّهُ لا يَنبَغِي طَلاقُها إلّا مِن فاحِشَةٍ مُبَيِّنَةٍ
hadiths.english: 2795. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The archangel Gabriel continues to bring down so much advice with regard to the [treatment of the] woman that I think she must never be divorced unless she has committed adultery.'

hadiths.arabic: 2797. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : قَولُ الرَّجُلِ للمرأةِ : «إنّي اُحِبُّكِ» لا يَذهَبُ مِن قَلبِها أبداً
hadiths.english: 2797. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A man's telling his wife 'I love you' never leaves her heart.'

hadiths.arabic: 2799. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : سَألَتْ اُمُّ سَلَمَةَ رسولَ اللَّه صلى اللَّه عليه وآله عن فَضلِ النساءِ في خِدمَةِ أزواجِهِنَّ ، فقال : أيُّما امرَأةٍ رَفَعَتْ مِن بَيتِ زَوجِها شيئاً مِن مَوضِعٍ إلى‏ مَوضِعٍ تُرِيدُ بهِ صَلاحاً إلَّا نَظَرَ اللَّهُ إلَيها ، ومَن نَظَرَ اللَّهُ إلَيهِ لَم يُعَذِّبْهُ
hadiths.english: 2799. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) narrated that Umm Salama [the Prophet's wife] asked the Prophet (SAWA) about the status of women when being of service to their husbands, so he (SAWA) replied, 'Any woman who so much as moves something from one place to another in her husband's house with the intention of improving it is regarded with mercy by Allah, and whoever Allah regards [with mercy] He does not punish.'

hadiths.arabic: 2800. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : جِهادُ المَرأةِ حُسنُ التَّبَعُّلِ
hadiths.english: 2800. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'The sacred war (jihad) of a woman is being a good spouse to her husband.'

hadiths.arabic: 2801. رسولُ‏اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: إذا سَقَى الرجلُ امرَأتَهُ اُجِرَ
hadiths.english: 2801. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'If a man quenches his wife's thirst he is rewarded for it.'

hadiths.arabic: 2802. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : جُلوسُ المَرءِ عندَ عِيالِهِ أحَبُّ إلى اللَّهِ تعالى‏ مِنِ اعتِكافٍ في مَسجِدِي هذا
hadiths.english: 2802. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A man's sitting beside his family is more beloved in the sight of Allah than his spending the night in worship in this mosque of mine.'

hadiths.arabic: 2803. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَيُؤجَرُ في رَفعِ اللُّقمَةِ إلى‏ فِي امرَأتِهِ
hadiths.english: 2803. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Verily the man who lifts a morsel of food to his wife's mouth is well rewarded.'

hadiths.arabic: 2804. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن كانَ لَهُ امرَأةٌ تُؤذِيهِ لَم يَقبَلِ اللَّهُ صلاتَها ولا حَسَنَةً مِن عَمَلِها حتّى‏ تُعِينَهُ وتُرضِيَهُ وإن صامَتِ الدَّهرَ وعلى الرَّجُلِ مِثلُ ذلكَ الوِزْرِ والعَذابِ إذا كانَ لَها مُؤذِياً ظالِماً
hadiths.english: 2804.
